title: Mid-Level Application Security Administrator
description:
WMATA-0000007522
Application Security Administrator - Mid The Application Security Administrator has a primary focus on the establishment and management of user accounts for the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA). To include developing and implementing rolebased access controls through user profiles, which address need to know, separation of duties, and least privilege according to WMATA policy. The candidate will be responsible for the development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) user guidance and conducting annual user account recertification. This position will interact with various types of customers/users, ISSOs, ISSEs, etc. and must be able to effectively interact with each and provide strong customer support, ticket resolution, and reporting. Security Administration support includes, but is not limited to PeopleSoft, Maximo, Entrust, etc.
 
The desired candidate should have at least five (5) years of experience in designing, implementing, and supporting security processes in multiple PeopleSoft environments, including new implementations, security redesign or assessment of a security environment.
Experience in PeopleSoft HCM/ELM/FSCM with version 9.0 and higher, PeopleSoft EPM/CRM, PeopleTools with version 8.5x, knowledge of Maximo, Entrust Security and SQL developer is highly desired. 
 
Minimum Qualifications: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field with a minimum of five (5) years of experience in an information technology environment with a concentration on IT security administration and management of PeopleSoft applications. Or an equivalent combination of postsecondary school education and ten (10) years of progressively responsible experience an information technology environment with a concentration on IT security administration and management of PeopleSoft applications.
 
Job Summary/Duties: This classification requires a comprehensive in-depth knowledge of information contained in the PeopleSoft applications (i.e., FMS, HCM, EPM, CRM, etc.) and Oracle databases. The contractor will be responsible for the protection of WMATA¿s Peoplesoft and Oracle information assets against unauthorized use, modification, disclosure, or destruction by WMATA employees or other parties whether accidental or intentional.

title: Senior Retail Sales Associate
description:
Are you passionate about coffee? Do you care about sustainability and quality? At Nespresso we place people, coffee and sustainable living at the heart of what we do, inspiring an engaging and meaningful place to work. We are seeking passionate and dynamic Senior Sales Associate for our world class team who can focus on driving sales, service, and sustainability through respectful, collaborative, agile, determined, and driven engagement with clients, team members, and management. Also to support management with opening/closing and cash duties.
A day in the life:
PEOPLE
• Perform Boutique tasks as delegated by management
• Share feedback & opinions respectfully & considerately with management team
• Participate in team meetings & contribute ideas/suggestions to improve Boutique operations 
• Respect team members & management by adhering to shift/work scheduling and attendance policy 
• Proactively cultivate new client relationships 
• Complete special projects per agreed-upon PDP plan as delegated by manger
SALES & SERVICE
• Greet & Engage: Welcome with enthusiasm and sincerity all Boutique customers as they enter the space & direct them through the customer journey 
• Listen & Learn: Prescribe appropriate machines & capsules by asking open ended questions and providing creative solutions 
• Share Knowledge: Demonstrate up-to-date knowledge of new products, current products, and promotions 
• Win the Sale: Utilize Nespresso Five Steps of Sales and Service (up, cross, new, and re), NES-Eloquence, and Storytelling to achieve individual & Boutique targets 
• Offer Tastings: Initiate customers into the art of coffee tasting & develop their curiosity about Nespresso products 
• Member Accuracy: Manage the member database, entering all customer data accurately  
• Compliance: Understand and adhere to cash operating procedures and returns policies 
• React with respect and provide excellent customer service at all times 
• Utilize Nespresso’s Six Customer Experience Principles to deliver a unique and customized customer experience 
• Share Nespresso’s community & sustainability missions with all customers 
• Maintain awareness of traffic levels & surroundings, adjusting pace, acknowledging new clients, etc.
OPERATIONS & SAFETY
• Adhere to the all Boutique opening and closing procedures as directed by management  
• Work with management team to ensure safe working conditions 
• Properly dispose of all recyclables, garbage, etc. 
• Execute tasks in an efficient & sustainable fashion as directed by management 
• Observe stock levels & refill/assist as necessary 
• Adhere to retail operations procedures and best practices as directed by management team  
• Adhere to compliance and quality standards in keeping with the Standard Operation Procedures 
• Adhere to cash management and return procedures as directed by management
Benefits and Perks: 
• Competitive pay 
• Quarterly and annual bonus
• Paid vacation time 
• Tuition reimbursement program 
• Referral bonus program 
• Recognition program with monetary rewards
• Nestle corporate discounts
• Complimentary uniforms and dry cleaning
• Free Machine and coffee allowance 
• 401K savings match
• Guaranteed minimum hours
Winning Skillsets: 
• High School Diploma or GED required
• 1+ years of sales or customer service experience in a premium or consumable environment preferred
• A real passion for coffee and respect for sustainability; ability to self-educate and educate others on the coffee culture
• The world is rapidly changing and we need people who are resourceful, agile and willing to evolve. 
• Flexible to work select shifts; days, nights, weekends and holiday

title: Research Associate II (REQ1212)
description:
Job ID: req1212
Employee Type: exempt full-time
Facility: Frederick: ATRF
Location: 8560 Progress Dr, Frederick, MD 21701 USA
The Frederick National Laboratory is a Federally Funded Research and Development Center (FFRDC) sponsored by the National Cancer Institute (NCI) and operated by Leidos Biomedical Research, Inc. The lab addresses some of the most urgent and intractable problems in the biomedical sciences in cancer and AIDS, drug development and first-in-human clinical trials, applications of nanotechnology in medicine, and rapid response to emerging threats of infectious diseases.
Our core values of accountability, compassion, collaboration, dedication, integrity, and versatility serve as a guidepost for how we do our work every day in serving the public's interest. 
 
 The Clinical Services Program's primary mission is to perform sequential studies using samples obtained from patients with cancer, AIDS, chronic granulomatous disease or other diseases associated with immunologic dysfunction, as well as to monitor viral load in patients with HIV. 
The Vaccine, Immunity and Cancer Program investigates immune responses to vaccines in preclinical and clinical studies, with a focus on HPV. 
 
The Vaccine, Immunity and Cancer Program is looking for Research Associate II to conduct serology testing for SARS-CoV-2. The aims of this project are to produce critical assay reagents and perform serology and other immune assays for assessment of immune responses to infection.

title: Infrastructure and Applications Support Specialist
description:
As a Infrastructure and Applications Specialist you will be responsible for providing leadership in designing and maintaining our complex environment of systems that we use to service our user base. You will be aware of our on-premise architectures and understand how to gather all pertinent requirements and then select the appropriate platform.
In addition, you will also be a Tier III escalation point for our 24x7x365 staffed engineers whom track all events related to all fault and performance monitoring of our critical hardware and software infrastructure. The role includes timely processing alerts and suppression requests for servers, OS’s, network devices, bandwidth, applications, databases and end-user experiences, as well as monitoring all associated elements including security, power and environmental conditions. Our engineers help plan, organize and oversee day-to-day operational activities for his or her work shifts. This position requires a strong background implementing and managing typical network management processes and procedures. This position demands strong interpersonal skills and routine interaction with sales, internal network engineering, field engineering, accounting, external service providers, equipment vendors and clients during normal service and provisioning activities.
Our engineers are one of our central points of contact for network trouble and problem escalation notifications. It is important and challenging work that helps drive the success of our users. On some days, the right person in the job can have a monumentally rewarding impact on the work lives of other people. We need people who want to take on that type of challenge.
 
 
Architect skill level on a few with Tier 3 skill on most others.
The following certifications are preferred: VMWare, MCSA/MSCE, CCNA/CCDA, CISSP, ITIL, Project+, Network+

title: SAP BASIS and Security Administrator
description:
Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios Inc. ("MGM") is seeking a passionate SAP BASIS and Security administrator to join the Media Technology Group. This individual will manage a portfolio of applications, maintain the security and resources focusing on SAP environments such as ERP, IPM/IS-Media, and Solution Manager. The responsibility of the position is to support, document, and secure the technical environments as required by SAP standards.
Individual must have solid understanding of SAP architecture and Security administration, its underlying database (Oracle), operating system, and hardware platform. This person will interact with the SAP development team, Info Sec team, various technical teams, and business stakeholders to optimize and maintain overall SAP reliability, availability, and performance. Must have excellent communication skills, technical aptitude and be a team player.

title: Data Entry
description:
Job Purpose:
Maintains database by entering new and updated customer and account information.
Duties:
* Prepares source data for computer entry by compiling and sorting information; establishing entry priorities.
* Processes customer and account source documents by reviewing data for deficiencies; resolving discrepancies by using standard procedures or returning incomplete documents to the team leader for resolution.
* Enters customer and account data by inputting alphabetic and numeric information on keyboard or optical scanner according to screen format.
* Maintains data entry requirements by following data program techniques and procedures.
* Verifies entered customer and account data by reviewing, correcting, deleting, or reentering data; combining data from both systems when account information is incomplete; purging files to eliminate duplication of data.
* Tests customer and account system changes and upgrades by inputting new data; reviewing output.
* Secures information by completing data base backups.
* Maintains operations by following policies and procedures; reporting needed changes.
* Maintains customer confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
* Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Skills/Qualifications:
Organization, Typing, Data Entry Skills, Attention to Detail, Confidentiality, Thoroughness, Decision Making, Independence, Analyzing Information , Results Driven, Energy Level, Oracle experience preferred.

title: Database Administrator
description:
Job Purpose:
Maintains database by identifying and solving database requirements; supporting users.
Duties:
* Identifies database requirements by interviewing customers; analyzing department applications, programming, and operations; evaluating existing systems and designing proposed systems.
* Recommends solutions by defining database physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications.
* Installs revised or new systems by proposing specifications and flowcharts; recommending optimum access techniques; coordinating installation requirements.
* Maintains database performance by calculating optimum values for database parameters; implementing new releases; completing maintenance requirements; evaluating computer operating systems and hardware products.
* Prepares users by conducting training; providing information; resolving problems.
* Provides information by answering questions and requests.
* Supports database functions by designing and coding utilities.
* Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
* Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.
* Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Skills/Qualifications:
Database Performance Tuning, Database Security, Promoting Process Improvement, Problem Solving, Presenting Technical Information, Quality Focus, Database Management, Data Maintenance, Operating Systems, Attention to Detail, Information Security Policies

title: Database Administrator
description:
TASKS AND DUTIES:
? Manages data requirements gathering and analysis for new and existing projects.
? Supports Microsoft SQL Server 2012/2014/2016 databases across all environments.
? Supports Microsoft SQL Server 2012/2014/2016 replication feature widely used by different applications.
? Supports Microsoft Windows 2012 and 2016 Enterprise Servers including configuration and maintenance.
? Implements and supports Microsoft Clustering Services both on the SQL Server and System levels.
? Installs and configures Microsoft SQL Server 2012/2014/2016 and Microsoft Windows 2012 and 2016 servers.
? Monitors Microsoft SQL Server activity on a proactive basis and tune the system for optimal performance.
? Creates, designs, manages and troubleshoots SSIS packages.
? Monitors and troubleshoots ETL jobs daily using BCP, DTSRUN, SSIS and other Performance Monitoring tools.
? Maintains error and system maintenance logs.
? Performs OLAP and OLTP Data modeling with the ERWIN data modeling tool.
? Supports Operational data model and data mapping.
? Supports the development and maintenance of DOE application data dictionary.
? Manages and supports DB2 relational system and troubleshoot issues on the DB2 System.
? Administers DB2 Connect, DB2 Gateway in different ETL set up.
? Investigates, analyzes and troubleshoots system performance and suggest/implement tuning as needed.
? Develop system tools and utilities (i.e. scripts, etc.) to simplify and support IT and business operations.
? Plan, implement and manage systems initiatives with IT and customer teams.
? Designs database tables utilizing import or export data from SQL Servers into other data sources on a daily basis through the development and coding of stored procedures and triggers, as needed.
? Establishes documents and maintains technical standards and server security policies.
? Patches servers, both software and firmware, on a scheduled basis as well as urgent security releases.
? Conducts performance monitoring, capacity planning, trend forecasting.
? Documents and improves upon processes, procedures, and best practices to align with industry standards and customer needs.
? Configures and optimizes Database System Configuration and Database Availability Reporting.
? Documents and improves upon processes, procedures, and best practices to align with industry standards and customer needs.
? Designs and implements database disaster recovery requirements to ensure business continuity requirements are met.
? Provides a high-level of customer satisfaction to internal and external customers, applying necessary sense of urgency and creativity in problem identification and prompt incident resolution.
? Provides advanced systems administration and support capability.
? Analyzes system performance; suggests and implements tuning as needed.
? Installs additional OpenSource and commercial software products as needed to develop, deploy, and support the platform.
Project Specific Technical Requirements: 
Proficiency in preparing, maintaining SQL server installation and configuration documents.
9+ years of experience in the following:
Query optimization experience with modification in TSQL queries, removing unnecessary columns, eliminating redundant and inconsistent data, normalizing database, establishing necessary joins, creating useful clustered index and non-clustered indexes.
8+ years of experience in the following: 
? Database Normalization, logical and physical modelling, capturing data lineage, table and column data definitions, valid values and others necessary information in the data models.
? Enforcing standards and best practices around data modelling efforts.
? SQL Server installation of SQL Server and updating with service packs and patches.
? SQL Server setup and configuration on Windows Servers and Linux.
? Installing and configuring SQL Server 2014/2016/2019 on the server and client machines, provide connections and manage databases.
? SQL Server installation on stand-alone and Windows Server Clustered environments.
? Administering the MS SQL Server security by creating user logins with appropriate roles, dropping and locking the logins, monitoring the user accounts, creation of groups, granting the privileges to users and groups.
? Installing and configuring MYSQL databases.
? Installing, authoring, and managing reports using SQL Server 2016 Reporting Services.
? Performing daily database tasks including backup and restore by using SQL Server native tools and third party software, including VERITAS net backups and Lite speed backups.
? Developing automated routine tasks for backup, restore and DBCC scripts for databases maintenance, optimization and transaction logs.
? Performing backup and data compression using different editions of SQL Server.
? Administering and monitoring MYSQL databases.
? Planning, gathering the pre-deployment information and deployment of the third party tools like IDERA SQL Diagnostic, Dynatrace AppMon, and Quest Foglight etc.
? Backup and recovery implementation Strategy for 24x7 operation support.
? Designing and implementing enterprise data warehouse solutions.
? Developing ETL Scripts to enable data processing into data warehouse.
? Working on developing robust data warehouse dictionary.
? Designing cubes in SSAS environment using Snowflake and Star Schemas.
? Configuring Report manager, PowerBI Servers, implementing role-based security to end users and developing report models for creating Ad-hoc reports using SSRS.
? Tuning queries and databases for better performance.
? Creating and maintaining Database Maintenance Plans.
? Performing SQL Server maintenance tasks including Database Integrity checks, update database Statistics and Re-indexing.
? Configuring data partitioning/table partitioning on huge tables containing millions of rows for better performance.
? Creating database objects including Stored Procedures, Triggers, Views and Functions for the application using T-SQL.
? Performance tuning experience, modification of Complex Stored procedures to improve efficiency of the system.
? Supporting day to day operational activities for the database platform like service requests and tickets, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting long running queries, locks, deadlocks and performance issue like CPU, I/O, Memory bottlenecks, Backup and Restore, SQL jobs.
5+ years of experience in the following:
Strong PowerShell experience for developing routine daily maintenance tasks.

title: Lead SQL DBA
description:
Responsibilities:
• Lead team of DBAs in maintaining operations and optimal performance of large SQL Server farm
• Identify system shortcomings and work with leadership to identify and plan for appropriate solutions
• Monitor database performance for integrity, quality, and security.
• Implement performance tuning including updating statistics, reindexing, structure modifications, capacity planning, and index analysis.
• Implement database backup and recovery procedures, including disaster recovery procedures.
• Perform upgrades, conversions, integrations, migrations, document/database imports/exports, and application integration projects related to the firm’s DMS system.
• Perform database administration tasks including setup and monitoring of error logs, backups, maintenance routines, and database optimization.
• Perform automation tasks, applying service packs, and cumulative updates.
• Advanced support of related systems including Knowledge Management Systems, and Full Text Indexing / Searching systems.
• Create and manage SQL scripts, SSIS packages, SSRS reports, stored procedures, spreadsheets, charts and diagrams.
• Provide technical training and knowledgebase articles for Application Analysts, Support personnel, System Administrators, and others.
• Work on various projects related to evaluating, testing, and deployment of new software systems/technology.
• Provide technical assistance to users and others in the Information Technology Department.
• Monitor and act on escalated issues.  Monitor and work on problem tickets and requests for relevant application and system areas.  This includes timely acknowledgement of tickets / requests -- providing a high level of responsiveness and Customer Service.
Requirements
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
• 5+ years of progressive responsibility in large corporate environments.
• 5+ years of experience installation SQL Server in data center environments.
• 5+ years of experience with performance tuning, SQL server administration, and day-to-day operations.
• 5+ years of experience providing third-level support in relation to management of large SQL Server environments.
• 5+ years of experience in troubleshooting, analyzing, and fixing problems related to SQL servers, SQL databases, SQL process/jobs and SQL based applications/systems.
• 5+ years of experience with SQL Syntax, T-SQL scripts, and SSIS / SSRS.
• 2+ years of experience working in AWS Cloud
• Security+ certification

title: Database Administrator
description:
This position designs, maintains, and controls the corporate databases and data dictionary. Establishes and enforces all database standards. Analyzes all informational requirements of new or production systems and develops database specifications. Establishes and enforces controls to ensure database integrity and security.
Analyzes and defines the properties required by a database management system (DBMS) that will meet the current and future needs of the company.
Analyzes the organizational structure of the company and defines the logical database structure for current and future application development.
Establishes, maintains, and controls the corporate data dictionary.
Develops, documents, and enforces the standards for access to the database.
Defines and implements security procedures to ensure the integrity and privacy of the database.
Designs, implements, and periodically tests the database backup and recovery procedures.
Defines procedures for testing and implementing new applications in the database environment.
Analyzes current and projected future database performance; fine-tunes or recommends equipment changes when necessary.
Develops database training guidelines for the analyst and end-user.
Acts as mediator with different users to resolve conflicts of data naming conventions and ownership/privacy of data.
Maintains knowledge of current and future DBMS technology through schools, seminars, and publications.
Interacts with the technical support team and DBMS vendor to schedule installation and maintenance of the DBMS software
Provides suggestions for changes, enhancements, and modifications to products
Must be organized, driven and highly motivated with the ability to work independently
Proven ability to think strategically about customer needs and develop creative solutions
Self-starter with strong initiative and natural leadership qualities
Results-oriented, driven, and organized
Has authority to set and enforce database security, design, and performance standards.
Establishes disaster recovery procedures to ensure retrieval on all data and system software.
Provides technical knowledge to system designers and applications programmers to assist in their application development.
Provides technical and Data Base Support to MIS organization 24 hours a day, seven days a week. 
Ensure projects are completed by the defined schedules.
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, mathematics or equivalent, and/or five years systems design and analysis and programming exposure.
Training in file structures and design, information retrieval techniques, file access methods and controls, and development and documentation of standards.
Previous experience with installation of a data dictionary and database system.
Requires a strong technical background in credit union software and business operations, and a successful track record in the development of credit union software applications.
5+ years experience with a software development company
Strong working knowledge of data processing programming, systems design, problem analysis, and hardware.
Must possess the ability to work independently and as part of a larger team. 
Communication skills including written, oral, and presentation skills are required.
Must be able to perform complex analysis and produce professional documentation and recommendations.
A strong bias for action is essential.
Proficient in Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Outlook). Must be proficient in technology applications including the Credit Union’s operating system and specialized software required for performance of position.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals. Ability to compute rates, ratios and percentages.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop kneel, crouch, crawl; talk or hear and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing functions of this job.
The noise level in the work environment is moderately quiet. It is a non-smoking environment.
The above job requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and abilities. The marginal functions have not been included. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
This job description in no way implies that these are the only duties to be performed. An employee will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and duties as requested by the supervisor and/or management.

title: Data Warehouse/ DBA
description:
US Tech Solutions is seeking a “Data Warehouse/ DBA” for a 12+ months contract with a client in Charlotte, NC
This position will manage and maintain Data Lake clusters infrastructure: installation, configuration, performance tuning and monitoring of Hadoop clusters
 
Experience in tuning and optimizing Hadoop environment in keeping clusters healthy and available for end users and applications with maximum cluster uptime as defined in SLA
 
Collaborate and assist developers in successful implementation of their code, monitor and fine tune their process for optimum resource utilization on cluster, ability to automate run time process
important role is to keep the cluster performing well and dependable
should possess experience in cluster management, perform cluster upgrade, migration and testing
 
Perform periodic updates to cluster and keeping the stack current
perform and monitor backups of critical data and able to restore data when in need
ability to expand clusters by adding new nodes and rebalance cluster storage systems
manage application databases, application integration, users, roles, permissions within cluster
collaborate with Unix, network, database and security teams on cluster related matters
must monitor cluster for maximum uptime, ability to research on cluster issues via logs and collaborate with support in a proactive way
 
Good communication skills with right attitude to blend in with team
 
BS degree, preferably in Computer science or equivalent
 
Minimum 5 years work experience in Hadoop ecosystems (Horton or Cloudera) and/or related technologies (MAP R, data bricks etc)
must have good exposure to Cloudera manager, Cloudera Navigator or similar cluster management tool
 
Must have good knowledge of HDFS, Ranger/Sentry, Hive, Impala, Spark, HBase, Kudu, Kafka, Ni-Fi, sqoop and other Hadoop related services
 
Exposure to Data Science collaborative tools such as data science workbench, anaconda, etc.
 
Should demonstrate strong concepts in Unix/Linux, Windows OS, cloud platforms (MS Azure, AWS)
should have strong Networking concepts: topology, proxy, F5, firewall
 
Strong security concepts: Active directory ,Kerberos, LDAP, SAML, SSL, encryption
programming language concepts: Java, Perl, python, PySpark and Unix shell scripting

title: Operational Database Administrator (ODBA)  / Epic Adminstrator
description:
Role: Operational Database Administrator
Location: Clayton, NC 27520
Job Type: Full Time
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Operational Database Administrator (ODBA) is a critical, hands-on role. This person installs and administers your operational database (ODB) environments. This person also performs environment setup and configuration, proactive monitoring, and maintenance. 
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Creating and managing the ODB environments that serve production, reporting, disaster recovery, training, and non-production needs 
Installing and maintaining the administrative and monitoring tools necessary for high levels of availability and performance of your Epic system 
Understanding performance metrics, monitoring system performance, and troubleshooting issues 
Managing the logins for different types of access, including login behavior and working environment configuration 
Applying Caché and Epic upgrades and updates to production and non-production environments 
Configuring and maintaining environment copies according to the environment strategy 
Responding to emergency and after-hours issues 
Engaging in capacity planning exercises to ensure adequate system resources 
Collaborating with your technical teams and Epic to ensure proactive support 
Writing and maintaining scripts to improve system management tasks 
Participating in your change control process for all planned application and technical activities 
Maintaining and testing processes related to business continuity 
Following vendor and Epic best practices for hardware and software configuration

title: Senior Oracle Application, DBA
description:
Installs, upgrades and manages ERP components on Linux systems to include proprietary ERP upgrade tool; installs, manages and tunes java components supporting the ERP and component / companion applications. Installs and upgrades companion applications including compilers, job scheduling software, address correction software and others.
Installs, configures, troubleshoots, and maintains application systems that interface with Oracle and other databases. Monitors and tunes those systems to ensure system integrity and provides high performance, high availability service.
Coordinates and provides middleware support of Tomcat and messaging servers. Manages tomcat servers, instances and configurations directly supporting the ERP system; monitors for errors and utilization; troubleshoots and resolves issues.
Implements new versions, updates, and patches fixes to application software systems. Maintains detailed knowledge of software trends and advancements regarding those systems.
Coordinates and monitors system security for the ERP. Analyzes audit logs and takes appropriate action to address anomalies. Responds to legitimate internal and external requests for security related information.
Routinely communicates with Information Technology and College directors and managers to codify institutional expectations into systems specifications for database architectures. Develops requests for proposals (RFPs) and coordinates solutions with third party vendors to ensure control of database projects.
In coordination with the Senior Oracle DBA, performs replication, backup, and recovery tasks on Oracle databases. Troubleshoots and permanently corrects platform problems in a timely manner to provide 24/7 availability of services. Responsible for managing problem escalation to Oracle and third party support teams as appropriate. Upgrades databases to new versions as directed; applies security updates and patching as appropriate. Performs database cloning, tuning and monitoring. Manages Oracle wallets.
Implements new versions, updates, and patches fixes to the database management systems. Maintains detailed knowledge of computer hardware and software trends and advancements.
Designs and implements business continuity and disaster recovery protocols. Operates, monitors and maintains redundant data center platforms for a disaster response. Tests disaster recovery protocols and platforms to ensure timely and reliable restoration of critical business activities.
Advises programming staff, Linux and Microsoft system administrators and technical staff on advanced technical aspects pertaining to relational databases and related application software. Trains and instructs functional leaders and users in the proper use of multiple software products to maximize available capabilities.
Participates in the formal system change management process and is responsible for ensuring that
Banner changes are tested and perform as intended. Responsible for the integrity and security of the application and must be vigilant in protecting the access from unauthorized changes and disruptive system processes. Coordinates modifications, upgrades, new implementation and decommissioning efforts with affected system users. Documents all activity.
Participates in and contributes to divisional performance measurements and process improvement initiatives. Leads team activities to review and enhance workflows.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or closely related discipline or equivalent work experience and education/training providing similar knowledge and skills in database design and administration is necessary.
Oracle Certified Professional Certification, Red Hat System Administrator, a plus. Eight (8) or more years in an enterprise computing environment, of comparable complexity, including five (5) years of directly related, full-time experience in administrating Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Oracle application beyond degree equivalence is required.
Experience managing specific technologies of java, tomcat. Experience in basic linux shell scripting.
Experience in current operating environment and use of container technologies will be given preference.
Certification in systems and applications to be supported may be considered an equivalency for experience requirements.
Applicants this job requisition will be published until filled.

title: Security Access (Server) Administrator
description:
Security Access Administrator manages access control for more than 3500 UNIX and Windows servers. This position requires hands-on UNIX (AIX, Solaris, Linux) experience as well as working with UNIX access management products including Centrify Identity and Access Management Solutions to manage access to UNIX platform. This position is responsible for processing requests for UNIX and Windows access in accordance with policies and service level agreements. Skills and experience with scripting using UNIX shell and PowerShell programming is highly desirable as well as understanding of UNIX user access management, SSH configuration, sudo and dzdo.
 
- IT security access management.
- A minimum of 1 year Information Technology (IT) experience including development, implementation, communication, monitoring and maintenance of information security policies and procedures.
- A minimum of 1 year UNIX skills (AIX, Linux, Solaris) with a focus on Identity Management
- Windows File Server experience
- Basic to intermediate understanding of UNIX Security concepts
- Basic to intermediate understanding of Active Directory Users and Computers
                                                                                               
- Process Incident tickets and Work Orders for UNIX / Windows account provisioning/de-provisioning
- Manage Active Directory accounts and privileges
- Manage UNIX/Centrify accounts and elevated privileges
- Create and manage Process IDs, Training IDs, and Test IDs
- Evaluate and remediate general security & access issues
- Recommends and/or assists in the development and implementation of Information Protection policies, standards, procedures, and guidelines
- Reviews security logs and violation reports and follows-up as appropriate
- Create and manage access to secured shared files and folders across Windows File Server platforms
- Configure and manage UNIX security access for the following projects:  BI Appliance, PDOA, BDO, BDA, ATLAS Data Lake, DIME, eDR, and SAS
- Collaborate with the UNIX Production Support teams to troubleshoot access and server configuration issues
- Collaborate with Core Intel Support with group policies which affect user access and other domains outside of the Corp domain.
- Work with leading industry technology including Varonis, Centrify, Cyber Ark Safe Manager, Change Auditor Tool
- Configure and Manage Exchange server mailboxes, distribution lists, conference rooms, and shared mailboxes
- IIS Administration for Open Deploy and Web developer access
- Create, maintain and provision access for all Process ID/Service account within the client Organization
- Manage and administer Mainframe access
- Create and migrate Home Drives and server data

description:
We are a remarkable company in remarkable times. Our business includes software and Lobster Marketing, together comprising a SaaS platform providing end-to-end office management software for field service providers in markets such as pest, pool, and lawn. Lobster Marketing adds market-facing web sites, buy online capability, dashboarding, and digital marketing services. Founded in 2012. Forbes just named us on their list of "2020 Best Start-up Employers" based on employee enthusiasm, fast growth, and financial strength. In January 2020, we joined the portfolio of Gryphon Investors and have outstanding financial support.
 On the software development team, code is released daily to tens of thousands of field service staff around the country (our customers service about 4% of homes in America)-the code you write in the morning could be deployed to thousands of users the same day. title: Oracle DBA
description:
Oracle Database Administrator
PROJECT: This position will provide direct support for the IKA Claims Platform Oracle System Databases/Hardware and any associated support platforms for the application.
IDEAL BACKGROUND: Healthcare experience is a plus but not a necessity. Ideally, the candidates that I look for typically would have a development background as this helps them connect the dots from the application to the system level side of things. Strong technical background as well as advanced troubleshooting and performance enhancement skills.
TOP REQUIREMENTS:
- Oracle 11g/12C experience
- RMAN, RAC, Dataguard, GoldenGate,
- Linux/PowerShell Scripting/SQL/PL-SQL
What are the top 5-10 responsibilities for this position? 
1. Responsible for installation, configuration, patching, maintenance and tuning of all Oracle database systems to include 11G and higher environments.
2. Maintain and ensure availability for multiple production and development Oracle Database environments.
3. Coordinate the activities related to running production/test/development Application environments.
4. Develop and implement solutions for database sizing/capacity, server requirements and space requirements.
5. Resolve help desk tickets as assigned and provide 24-hour on-call support for problem analysis and resolution to system problems on a rotational basis.
6. Work with development teams to implement change management for custom code migrated into environments.
7. Perform effective and independent incident and problem resolution for databases and applications.
8. As assigned - research, plan, and perform application of bug fixes, application upgrades, database upgrades to Oracle Database 12C, and the implementation of security patches.
9.In accordance with established guidelines design & develop processes/ procedures for loading data, interfaces, batch job operation, and perform high-level trouble-shooting of development / production systems independently.
10.Work in a team environment by providing training and ongoing support of these processes/ procedures.
What software tools/skills are needed to perform these daily responsibilities?
Oracle 10G/11G/12C
RMAN, RAC, OEM, DataGuard, GoldenGate, ASM, AWR, TOAD
SQL, PL/SQL, Unix Shell Scripting
RedHat Linux 6.0 and higher
What skills/attributes are a must have?
1. Must have hands-on experience with designing, building, installing, configuring and supporting database servers using Oracle Database 10g/11g/12c or higher on Linux.
(Required)
2. Must have a functional knowledge of Linux, UNIX shell scripting including vi and file management commands.
(Required)
3. Knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL (Required)
4. RMAN, RAC, OEM, GoldGate, DataGuard, ASM/AWR (Required)
4. Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field or equivalent. A combination of education and experience will be considered in lieu of degree.
What skills/attributes are nice to have?
1. Exadata experience is a plus
2. SQL Server Administration is a plus
3. IKA/Advantasure or similar claims processing system is a plus

title: DB2 z/OS Mainframe DBA
description:
DB2 z/OS Mainframe DBA Roles and Responsibilities:
 
Database Design Reviews
 
Description:  Review database design proposals and provide evaluation and alternatives.  Confirm that the design is functionally feasible. Establish and confirm user expectations in terms of responsiveness, performance, and capacity.  Provide a forum for technical discussion.  Identify areas of further investigation.
 
Measurement: Schedule meetings and perform the design reviews.  Provide written summaries, communications and collaborate on all enhancements.
 
 
 
Logical / Physical Database Design
 
Description: Translate detailed requirements specified by the business and application developers into physical objects in a database.  Develop logical models in coordination with application developer's needs as new corporate projects are approved for implementation.  Design databases, tables, primary keys, logical relationships.  Evolve existing models as new requirements develop and enhancements are requested.  Create objects according to internal standards including standardized attribute names.
 
Measurement:  Create schema definitions and alterations.  Adhere to standards.
 
 
 
Developer Support / SQL Code Review
 
Description: Review all new and updated SQL prior to production implementation.  Generate EXPLAINs and analyze SQL statement cost assessments.  Review column matching for optimal index access and create or modify indexes when necessary.   Recommend SQL modifications and improvements when required.   Check SQL for SELECT vs CURSOR, ensure DCLGENs are correctly used.   Ensure error handling has been specified and error SQL codes are being checked according to standard programming practices.  Check for missing NULL indicators where applicable.  Explain SQL and review predicted costs for optimal index access.  Prepare production BIND and EXPLAIN JCL.
 
Measurement:  Ensure all SQL is being reviewed prior to production implementation.  Advise and mentor developers.
 
 
 
Physical Database Implementation - Development
 
Description:  Support the application development process by timely implementation of all database schema additions and or modifications in the development environment.  Create and or modify the following objects - databases, tablespaces, tables, primary keys, indexes, check constraints, RI constraints, partitioning schemes.  Support multiple prototypes when required and rapid implementation of schema change as the design is tested and evolves through iterations.  Develop prototypes of processes that will extract from production and re-load into dev such that these can be handed over to developers and run independently.
 
Measurement:  Assist developers.  Implement and maintain development schemas.  Document project milestones and completions
 
 
Performance & Tuning of the Application during Development
 
Description:  Support the application development process from a performance and tuning perspective.  Check SQL efficiency using predictive tools like EXPLAIN analysis.  Monitor SQL efficiency using operational tracing tools like Platinum Insight.  Coordinate with developers and perform measurements and tracing when necessary.  Ensure indexes that are appropriate have been created.  Provide recommendations for modification & improvement as needed.
 
Measurement:  Document performance of the developed applications.
 
 
Production Deployment Support
 
Description:  Create RFCs to deploy all schema changes in production including tablespaces, tables, primary key, indexes, constraints, RI, compression, and column additions.  Assign a CTASK to the ATOS DBA and transfer model DDL as guidance.  Coordinate timing of the change with respect to acceptable outage windows and represent the change to the Change Control Board.  Monitor ATOS progress and review all JCL and DDL for the schema changes.  Ensure a back out strategy is in place and be prepared to execute it.   Monitor the deployment and review the changes as they are made to ensure that the request has been successfully completed.  Provide timely communication on the status of the deployment. Monitor the change post-deployment for any abends or unexpected results. 
 
Measurement:  Create the RFCs, obtain all approvals, monitor deployment, and communicate status upon completion.
 
 
Distributed Access Support
 
Description:  Assist with and/or install, configure, implement, monitor, and maintain all distributed methods of connecting to the DB2 subsystem. Provide developers with connection details for distributed access.  Provide guidance for acquisition and use of RACF credentials.  Configure DB2 Connect Gateway, distribute the Client Connection software.  Install and configure the HIT Driver Type 4 JDBC driver.  Assist with debug and diagnose of remote connection issues including gather traces and interfacing with product vendor support interfaces where applicable.
 
Measurement:  Keep all distributed access mechanisms up to date with respect to version, release, modification levels.
 
 
 
Production Rationalization
 
Description:  Collaborate with developers and ATOS DBA with rationalization efforts to optimize the DB2 environment.  Identify long running processes that are inefficiently consuming DB2 resources.  Engage in subsystem performance and tuning efforts, query optimization, using performance monitors, SQL profilers and other related monitoring and troubleshooting tools.  Determine reasonable strategies for running RUNSTATS & reorgs on an as-required basis.  Collaborate on efficient and effective use of computing resources.
 
Measurement:  Optimize the production environment by reducing consumption of DB2 resources.
 
 
Backup / Recovery - Database Integrity
 
Description:  Collaborate with ATOS DBAs to ensure that all production data is secured and backed up by jobs that run on a scheduled basis.  Identify frequency and guaranteed recovery (quiesce) points.  Determine appropriate backup methodology, SHRLEVEL CHANGE (online updates permitted) or SHRLEVEL REFERENCE (read only).  Review grouped quiesce points to ensure consistent recovery of referentially related objects.
 
Measurement:  Review and update documentation that identifies all backup schedules and recovery procedures.
 
 
 
Problem Resolution - Development
 
Description:  Assist developers with diagnosis of database related issues including unexpected SQL codes, referential integrity violations, bind setup, consistency token errors, missing synonyms, missing grants, unavailable resource, deadlocks, timeouts, load utility failures, etc.
 
Measurement:  Respond to requests for assistance and track requests via emails.

description:

Role Description
Applies hardware engineering and software design theories and principles in researching, designing, and developing database schemas, programming stored procedures, and developing and monitoring standard database practices.
Specifically, this position will perform support activities responsible for performing the tasks, executing established, standard methods and processes to ensure production application systems are on line and fully operational.
Dimensions of Position:
* Participates in Agile software development projects to design, code, and test database schemas and stored procedures to deliver quality services promptly.
* Works closely with out IT Operations DBAs to implement standard procedures for proper use of database systems.
* Translates user stories to tasks relating to process and data requirements.
* Designs applications technical infrastructure, such as specific databases, programming languages, utilities, and testing approaches.
* Constructs program flow charts to describe the processing of data and development of precise steps and processing logic across all platforms.
* Provides broad understanding of platforms and applications across multiple technologies.
* Execution and performance of production support tasks for multiple mortgage production applications strategic to
* Ensure all support tasks conform to established standards, this includes incident management, communications, IT compliance and risk management
* Ensure performance meets or exceeds business user/customer SLA and expectations
Skills & Requirements
* BS Degree in Computer Science or equivalent and at least 5-8 years work experience in all phases of development and supporting information systems and technologies and associated methodologies
* Agile development frameworks: Scrum and Kanban
* 7 + years of development experience using SSMS, SSRS, and SSIS.
* 7 + years of SQL and other database technologies (SQL Server or similar SQL DB systems, No-SQL systems such as MongoDB or Cassandra)
* Experience with DevOps and CI/CD technologies, such as JIRA, Confluence, Crucible, BitBucket (or other Git server), and Jenkins
* Strong Customer and Interpersonal Skills
* Experience estimating timelines and requirement discovery focused on web and a service Oriented Architecture environment
* Excellent computer platform skills including Microsoft and Linux workstation and server environments
* Demonstrable working knowledge of application design, testing, application development, query and database tools, and audit control
* Demonstrable working knowledge of various application software technology platforms; e.g. Client Server, Web, n_tier, SOA, and supporting programming languages

title: Database Administrator
description:
Apex Systems is seeking a Database Administrator (DBA) with extensive Teradata experience for a Managed Services project in Durham NC. 
If you feel that you are a qualified candidate then please send your resume to Ana Bechtel at Apex Systems: abechtel@apexsystems.com 
This role will assume a broad operational responsibility for a customer’s data warehouse environment under contracted Service Level Agreements, transferring service accountability and technology control to our experts when there is no client owned support function, or a client needs to supplement his own staff.
There are multiple DBA areas of specialization, including infrastructure and production operations, however the focus of this position is to provide Applications DBA services in support of ETL and BI development teams for a large customer with significant in process development projects.
Engagements typically last from one to three years and transitions to subsequent clients are usually identified 4-6 months in advance. Managed Services requires skills similar to PS consulting roles, however, the long term nature of our engagements eliminates the travel associated with typical consulting roles. Some assignments may require on-call night or weekend on call availability.
The Managed Services Applications DBA is a trained Consultant with a proven track record of Professional Service engagements and a history of successful performance within a Managed Services role. The DBA is responsible for client delivery including oversite and co-ordination of work with Managed Services offshore DBA’s. This position requires a combination of travel to customer locations as well as work from a virtual office. This person will work as part of a team and collaborate closely with customer applications developers and DBA’s in support of development projects and specific tasks that will be assigned to Managed Services. There will also be required interface with customer’s production DBA’s and our Global Consulting Center staff who provide offshore support. The ability to communicate well, determine requirements, co-ordinate and assign work, advise customer on Teradata development best practices, perform physical data modeling, primary and secondary index selection and then ability to provide recommendations on optimization of code is required
5 plus years experience in computer technology or related fields within the last 8
years.
BS/BA degree in Business Technology, Computer Science, or Management
Information Systems, Business Administration, Math, Statistics, or Engineering.
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office components and personal computers (for
generating the many reports required by the customer).
Excellent problem solving skills with demonstrated experience managing and resolving work requests and change requests.
Demonstrated knowledge of Teradata tools (listed below) and utilities, specifically:
Database Administration.

System Performance tuning and capacity planning experience, including production and interpretation of PMCP Reports in order to determine causes of poor performing code.
SQL tuning and performance optimization.
Expert knowledge of Teradata Database optimization techniques.
Experience with translating logical models to optimal physical models.
Experience advising developers and development teams from design UPthrough build phase.

title: Oracle Database Administrator
description:
The Oracle Database Administrator is a highly skilled technical position that involves intricate knowledge of the Oracle database internals with both 12c, 18c and 19c versions.  On call support will be required.
Database installations, configuration, tuning, maintenance, patching, backup and recovery, problem diagnosis and resolution are all critical functions that the database administrator performs. 
1. Manage all aspects of the physical database including schema’s, DDL, users, security, etc. in development, UAT and production environments 
2. Identify and resolve problems occurring in all database environments including performance related issues (i.e. database & SQL tuning).
3. Perform database software installs, configurations, patches, upgrades, and migrations.
4. Support DBA utilities, reorgs, index builds, export/import and DBA tools (Oracle Enterprise Manager) 
5. Assist with performance and Disaster Recovery testing.
Hyperion administration support for versions 11.1.x which  includes 
1. Coordinate patching of Hyperion environments 
2. Perform security maintenance and user provisioning for Hyperion applications
3. Assist Hyperion application team with performance and tuning issues
4. Perform code promotion across Hyperion environments
5. Work with Oracle support to resolve critical service requests
6. Provide off-hours/on-call support
Minimum 5 years experience working with mission critical Oracle 11g/12c databases in a high profile type of organization.
Minimum 5 years experience in the following areas: Database configuration, tuning, maintenance, patching, upgrades and problem diagnosis and resolution.
-Oracle RAC and RAC One Node
-Oracle RMAN
-Oracle Data Guard
-Oracle Golden Gate
-Enterprise Manager
-Disaster Recovery implementation and testing
- Experience with Hyperion Administration including:
     - Patching of Hyperion environments
     - Security maintenance and user provisioning
     - Perform code promotions
     - Cycling Hyperion services (Unix and Windows)
     - Perform application tuning and monitoring
- Experience in Linux, AIX, and Solaris platforms. 
- Experience with Shell scripting
- Experience with automation tools (Ansible, Puppet, Chef)
Minimum Bachelor's degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering or related field

title: Remote Oracle DBA
description:
Apex Systems, the nation’s 2nd largest Information Technology Staffing organization, has an opening for a Remote Oracle Database Admin to work within one of our large clients in the San Diego area. This position is a contract-to-hire role.
Please send your resume to Lindsay Maynard at lmaynard@apexsystems.com if you're interested in learning more about this role.
Senior Oracle Database Administrator – Including Data Warehouse Support
This Senior Oracle DBA will join an experienced and customer driven Database team to deliver excellent Database Administration services in support of production, development, and test database systems in a 24x7 mission critical environment.
The position is open to US Citizens or Green Card Holders.
We are looking for a highly motivated self-starter Senior Oracle DBA professional. Desired candidate must have excellent interpersonal, communication, problem solving and analytical skills. In addition, this individual will be expected to perform at an extremely high level with little learning curve and must thrive under pressure while enjoying working in a collaborative team environment.
• 6+ years of professional Oracle DBA support for installations on Oracle database versions 12c/19c and a Bachelor of Arts/Science or equivalent degree in Computer Science or related area of study. Without a degree, four additional years of relevant professional experience (10+ years in total).
• Able to provide all levels of application database support including off-hours on a rotating basis
• Able to discuss (within own area of expertise) requirements with customers, and to challenge and clarify when appropriate. From the requirements, able to develop a high-level design or plan, and then estimate the amount of effort required to deliver on time and budget
• Works collaboratively with other teams including Project Managers, Developers, and Architects to ensure project success
• Ability to communicate proactively to management any potential issues that may hinder the ability to meet project deadlines
• Excellent professionalism, communication, and interpersonal skills.
• Proficiency in setting up, configuring, and operationally supporting Oracle 12c/19c ASM, Oracle RAC, Data Guard, Partitioning, Golden Gate, Exadata, and Oracle Enterprise Manager
• Recent experience supporting Data Warehouse installations.
• Skilled with High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for Oracle
• Experience in Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
• Experience with backups, restores and recovery models including RMAN, hot and cold backups
• Experience in implementing operational automation using scripts
• Knowledge of indexes, index management, and statistics
• Must have excellent troubleshooting skills
• Extensive PL/SQL and UNIX shell scripting skills
• Well versed monitoring databases using OEM and custom scripts
• DBA support in WINTEL, UNIX, HP-UX, and Linux operating environments
• Monitor database security alerts for new vulnerabilities and remediation
• Manage the currency and security of technology platforms through the timely application of system patches and upgrades to software versions
• SQL and relational DBMS knowledge, including data modeling and ERD.
• Knowledge in providing analysis and support for ETL load and performance tuning/testing, including the writing and tuning of complex queries using SQL.
• Oracle 11g or higher DBA certification is highly desirable.

title: Database Administration Manager
description:
Database Administration Manager
 
The Manager of Database Administration is a member of the Enterprise Data Services team and reports to the Director of that unit. The position has responsibility for directing the efforts of the database administrators within that group. Responsibilities include oversight and administration of the Universities database platforms both on premise and in the cloud.
Details of responsibility include but are not limited to knowledge and expertise with Oracle, MySQL, MSSQL, and relational database concepts as well as Cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure or GCP. The manager should have sufficient expertise to be an effective owner of tasks related to the integration of local, cloud or hosted services (PaaS, IaaS), monitoring, analysis, security and application tools. This person is responsible for identifying security vulnerabilities and must understand how to communicate effectively to the team in order to remediate any threats. The Manager must be able to produce clear documentation of the systems being managed for all levels of leadership (peer through executive).
Security of data is the most critical aspect of this position, thus the candidate must be well versed in database security measures, literature and other sources for information regarding securing data.
This position is integral to the strategic planning and priority setting for the Division of Information Technology and the campus enterprise strategic initiatives. The manager oversees projects to successful completion, ensuring prompt customer service, staff management and staff skill development. The position includes responsibility for instituting the appropriate security controls, processes, and best practices to ensure compliance with State and University System audit requirements. The Manager must be able to communicate clearly both orally and in writing and must be a strong leader.
 
this position does not provide sponsorship for Visas.

description:

Here’s your opportunity to be a part of a growing company that values individuals and their contributions. title: Sr Compensation Analyst
description:
PenFed is continuing to hire and train exceptional individuals to help us serve our 2 million members both here and around the world.  In light of the current situation with novel coronavirus (COVID-19), we have modified our hiring, onboarding, training, and deployment protocols in order to comply with current local and state guidance around social distancing.
PenFed is committed to the safety of our teammates around the globe.  If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to us for more information.
 
PenFed Credit Union is hiring a Senior Compensation Analyst in Mclean, Virginia. The primary purpose of this job is to provide technical and analytical support to the design, implementation and maintenance of compensation programs at PenFed to ensure they are market competitive and align to PenFed’s strategy. This position will partner with HR Business Partners in consulting directly with managers and employees in both written and oral form on compensation strategies, tactics and methodologies.
 
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of job duties and the position will perform other duties as assigned.
*This role is responsible for ensuring business continuity. *
 
Equivalent combination of education and experience is considered
 
This position will not supervise employees.
 
There are no additional certifications required.
 
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to an indoor office setting with moderate noise.
*Most roles require working in an office setting with moderate noise and the ability to lift 25 pounds.*
 
Ability to travel to various worksites and be on-call may be required.
 
Established in 1935, PenFed today is one of the country’s strongest and most stable financial institutions with over 2 million members and over $25 billion in assets. We serve members in all 50 states and the District of Columbia, as well as in Guam, Puerto Rico, and Okinawa. We are federally insured by NCUA and we are an Equal Housing Lender. We are available to members worldwide, via the web, seven days a week, twenty-four hours a day.
Our mission isn’t simply to help our members get by. We exist to help them realize every ounce of their potential. We exist to educate, and to encourage. We exist to usher their dreams into the land of reality.
We provide our employees with a lucrative benefits package including robust medical, dental and vision plan options, plenty of paid time off, 401k with employer match, on-site fitness facilities at our larger locations, and more.
 
PenFed management will maintain and observe personnel policies which will not discriminate or permit harassment or retaliation against a person because of race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, military or veteran status or obligation, the presence of a physical and/or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, and all statuses protected by applicable state or local law in all recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, overtime, position classifications, work assignments, facilities, promotions, transfers, employee treatment, and in all other terms and conditions of employment. description:
* Provide daily support by assisting customers via diverse contact channels to include: inbound/outbound calls, email, live chat, and ITM with professionalism and urgency

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
The Senior Software Engineer uses various programming languages to develop, improve, test and/or maintain software that meets user needs. They mentor other software engineers, lead small development teams and act as an application owner. The Senior Software Engineer takes a lead role in design and code reviews, assists with delivery estimates and provides feedback about all aspects of the process.
We're America's largest mortgage lender, closing loans in all 50 states. J.D. Power ranked Quicken Loans "Highest in Customer Satisfaction in Primary Mortgage Origination" for the past 10 consecutive years, 2010 - 2019. The company was also ranked highest in the nation for client satisfaction among mortgage servicers by J.D. Power for 6 consecutive years, 2014 through 2019, each year the company was eligible. There's a simple reason we've been so successful: We care about the people we work with.
If you're tired of stuffy, bureaucratic workplaces, then you'll be delighted to find something different here. We strive to make a creative, fun and collaborative environment you simply won't find anywhere else. Quicken Loans was named #1 in ESSENCE Magazine's first ever list of "Best Places to Work for African Americans" in 2015. We've been on Computerworld's "Best Places to Work in IT" list for 13 years running, hitting #1 the last 5 years. We were also ranked #14 in FORTUNE Magazine's list of "100 Best Companies to Work For" in 2018, remaining in the top 30 for the past 15 years.

title: Cloud Security Engineer - work for a philanthropic company!
description:
If you are a Cloud Security Engineer with experience, please read on!
The Cloud Security Engineer is responsible for analyzing the security of web
applications and services, discovering and correcting security issues, and quickly
reacting to new threats. The successful Cloud Security Engineer has hands-on
expertise in many disparate technologies, ideally ranging from front-end user
interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between. The Cloud
Security Engineer is expected to constantly improve the security posture of our
fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment. The ideal candidate will be
knowledgeable in many domains of endpoint security and is willing to teach (and
learn from) anyone at the company. The cloud security engineer works closely
with development teams, relevant functional operations teams, network
engineers, database administrators, technology vendors and partners to ensure
the highest level of security.
? Conduct regular infrastructure audits, vulnerability assessments,
penetrations tests.
? Participate in security initiatives from brainstorming sessions to
implementation.
? Maintain, update and create policies and implement procedures and
technologies to achieve and maintain PCI compliance.
? Participate in post-mortem investigation of security incidents and prepare
incident reports documenting the findings.
? Work with cross-functional teams to incrementally improve systems,
network and application security.
? Security Review of Third Party Service Providers before onboarding
? Proactively review, recommend, and implement changes to the live
infrastructure after ensuring the right validation has been carried out.
? Keeping informed of emerging solutions to help mitigate security
vulnerabilities.
? Security Trainings.
? Security Tasks as assigned.
? Perform 24/7 on-call duties.
? 4+ years of experience in securing cloud infrastructures in AWS
? Experience in information security including experience with security
principles and techniques
? 3+ years of experience in networking technologies including TCP/IP, DNS,
DHCP, LAN/WAN, VPN, LDAP/Radius, wireless networking, routing,
switching, firewalls, IPv4/v6, and administration of routers and switches
? Knowledge of IDS/IPS, HIDS/HIPS, FIM, SIEM, Web Application Firewalls
? Knowledge of native AWS services and tools.
? Knowledge of vulnerability assessment, scanning and pen testing tools
? Knowledge in firewall configuration, management, and hardening
? Experience in a 24/7 high-traffic SaaS environments
? Experience in cyber threat and vulnerability analysis and remediation
? Experience with PCI or HIPAA compliance in an E-Commerce
environment
? Experience with software application security best practices (e.g. OWASP,
CWE/SANS)
? Familiarity with CI/CD platforms, Version Control Systems
? Knowledge of monitoring systems
? Strong working knowledge of Linux
? Scripting skills (Bash, Python, and Ruby preferred)
? Software development experience (Java, PHP, and Python preferred)
? BS in Computer Science, Information Systems Security, or equivalent
? Strong verbal and written communication skills
- Up to 2 days remote!
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Bonus
- 401k
So, if you are a Cloud Security Engineer with experience, please apply today!
CyberCoders will consider for Employment in the City of Los Angeles qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box) Ordinance.

title: Mongo DBA
description:
Job responsibilities of the position include :
*   Participate in the design, implementation and support of MongoDB databases and distributed systems in a client/server environment
*   Provide technical leadership for MongoDB related initiatives, database administration and maintenance activities
*   Installing, configuring and maintaining multiple MongoDB instances
*   Administer MongoDB Ops Manager, backups and automation.
*   Automate routine tasks with shell scripts and industry standard tools like Ansible
*   Participate in 24x7 on call support rotation
*   Manage mongo DB in AWS EC2 environment.
*   Work with Developers/Users to resolve data conflicts and inappropriate data usage
*   Implementation and support of HA Clustering/replica sets
*   Performance analysis tools related to KPI's like database storage I/O, CPU, Memory and TPS
*   Database reporting, Job Scheduling, routine MongoDB maintenance
*   Understanding of MongoDB database security access and authentication (LDAP and Active Directory)
*   Understanding of Operating System Technologies, mainly RedHat Linux
*   Upgrade and apply security patch across environmental lifecycle Dev - Prod.
*   Experience and troubleshooting some of the features like Sharding and Encryption.
*   Using Compass for remote connectivity.
*   Experience in hosting shared MongoDB instance in single server.

title: Certified Forklift Driver
description:
Job Purpose:
Controls warehouse inventory by coordinating movement of product from production to warehouse to shipping.
Duties:
* Picks-up product by monitoring production; loading and moving product.
* Stores product by designating storage areas; adjusting storage areas according to production and shipping requirements; updating location database.
* Prepares product for shipment by verifying location; directing movement to staging area; resolving problems.
* Verifies product inventory reports by comparing logs and reports; adjusting entries.
* Documents actions by completing forms, reports, logs, and records; maintaining databases.
* Monitors inventory by completing counts as required.
* Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities.
* Accomplishes distribution and organization mission by completing related results as needed.
Skills/Qualifications:
Teamwork, Coordination, Organization, Planning, Time Management, Reporting Skills, Inventory Control, Documentation Skills, Data Entry Skills, Dependability, Supervision

Navy Information System Technicians (IT specialists) are Enlisted Sailors who engage in a broad range of responsibilities, including network administration, database management and computer hardware and software implementation. Their responsibilities include:
                
                
A high school diploma or equivalent is required to become an Enlisted Sailor in the IT field in the Navy.
                Those seeking an Information Systems Technician position must be U.S. citizens who can meet eligibility requirements for a Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information security clearance. You should have a good working aptitude of math, an understanding of modern computing devices and the capability to do highly detail-oriented work.

title: Inventory Control Asst. II
description:
A career with CAES is more than just a job; it is the pathway to a bright future.
 
 Are you searching for a career with a company that offers challenging, diverse projects and opportunities? Are you looking for a position with a company that is growing and able to offer long-term professional advancement? Searching for a company that values a friendly work environment and that values YOU? Then look no further!! Consider Cobham.  #peoplefocusedmissiondriven #everymissionmatters
 
 We are Cobham Advanced Electronic Solutions (CAES), a technologically advanced electronics company employing more than 3,600 talented makers, thinkers, innovators, and doers nationwide. We build things that solve challenging problems from deep space to the depths of the ocean. We serve customers in spanning defense, aerospace, security, medical, and industrial markets.
 
 Cobham is seeking an Inventory Control Assistant II. The Inventory Control Assistant II monitors and maintains inventory, researches problems and tracks orders, records purchases, maintains databases, and performs physical count of inventory. This position may prepare statistical reports on inventory balance, prices and shortages. Receives, unloads and distributes goods. Processes and/or approves invoices for payment. Documents and processes returns. 
 
 
 Receives, stores, delivers, kits, moves, reports progress and inventories of materials and supplies.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Founded in 1934 by aviation innovator Sir Alan Cobham, our values of Trust, Talent and Technology have driven us to become a global leader in state-of-the-art aerospace and defense systems. It's the insights of our innovators today that will secure our collective future. Innovators like you!
 
 If you are authorized to work in the United States, then we encourage you to apply. We are unable to sponsor work visas. U.S. Citizenship required for positions requiring a Security Clearance.
 
 Cobham is one of the world's leading companies engaged in the development, delivery and support of leading-edge aerospace and defense systems in the air, on land and at sea. Our clients and partners trust Cobham to deliver the mission-critical technology they need, and we trust our employees to draw on their ingenuity and passion to deliver those solutions. This leads to an empowering culture for our people. Our Leadership team is open, sharing plans for the next five years, driving retention by offering demanding, exciting work, and providing full guidance and mentoring.
 
 
 
 Cobham is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Cobham to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information. Cobham will refrain from discharging, or otherwise discriminating against, employees or applicants who inquire about, discuss, or disclose their compensation or the compensation of other employees or applicants.
