title: Business Development Representative
description:
For over 65 years Raymond Handling Solutions has been leading the industry in quality products, expert service and unprecedented support. We are one of the largest Raymond dealers in North America. Raymond Handling Solutions pushes the boundaries of performance in the material handling industry. From advanced forklift technology to system integration, our dealership sets itself apart from the rest. Whether you are negotiating with Fortune 500 companies, solving space challenges for small businesses, or servicing an old piece of equipment, we develop new business opportunities by increasing the use of our product offerings. There is not a limit on the amount of money you are able to earn. 
The Business Development Representative provides a vital communication and sales link between our customers and our company to insure continuing customer satisfaction. The Business Development Representative is responsible for making cold calls in order to discover new business opportunities in our market. The Business Development Representative will work with senior Account Managers to develop leads and sell materials handling equipment. 
This position requires the majority of your time be in the field seeking new customers. The territory for this position will be in the San Diego-Tijuana region. It is essential to be fluent in English and Spanish. Must be able to cross the US/Mexico border without restrictions. 
Independently, the Business Development Representative will have the opportunity to sell pallet trucks, catalog items and can introduce rental equipment. 
The BDR also provides an outreach to users of our equipment who are not currently using our service or buying our parts in an effort to secure this business. 
Each BDR has a defined territory, which is his or her area of responsibility. The BDR has the responsibility for all current and potential customers within this defined area, both Raymond and non-Raymond equipment users. 
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. 
 
 
      •  Make cold-calls & warm calls and meeting with existing Raymond customers  
      •  Identify business opportunities through resources such as newspapers, Dunn and Bradstreet and internet sources. Network with commercial real estate companies and Chambers of Commerce 
      •  Generate sales leads through literature drops, mail, e-mail and campaigns 
      •  Increase market awareness through cold-calling 
      •  Create and manage prospective customer database 
      •  Digitize all contacts through Outlook for mail merge campaigns 
      •  Work closely with Marketing Department to develop new customers   
QUALIFICATIONS: 
 
      •  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
      •  Familiarity with all types of equipment Raymond Material Handling Solutions, Inc. sells and services. 
      •  Ability to deal with difficult people or circumstances with positive outcome. 
      •  Excellent organizational skills. 
      •  Excellent communication skills. 
      •  Willing to attend seminars and classes to update/improve various skills. 
      •  Capable of making sound decisions. 
      •  Present a neat, professional appearance. 
      •  Able to use time efficiently. 
      •  Capable of effective written communication. 
      •  Capable of communicating with people at all levels of management at Raymond Handling Solutions, Inc. as well as with customer management. 
      •  Willing to work odd hours when necessary. 
      •  Able to work in conjunction with other departments as needed. 
      •  Willing and able to learn quickly and perform accurately and neatly with a degree of flexibility. 
      •  Motivated to continuous self-development and training. 
      •  Willing to assume more responsibility as required. 
      •  Willing to comply with the employee handbook and policies.  
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: 
College degree (BA, BS) required, or three years related industry experience

title: Lead CAD Designer
description:
Wood Environment & Infrastructure Solutions is seeking a 
 to join our team in Wichita, KS. Wood is a global, top-ranked ENR design firm looking to grow its Kansas operation and seeks a talented CAD professional to join its team. Wood’s Wichita Office is a multi-discipline engineering/environmental team of 10+ staff, located in one of the most affordable cities in the US. 
 
Are you looking for an opportunity to work with an established engineering consulting firm that values its employee’s enthusiasm and technical contributions?  We encourage you to apply for this opportunity.  We are dedicated to providing the atmosphere to allow individuals to grow their career.  We’d love you to join our team of friendly, hard-working dedicated and collaborative professionals. Our ideal candidate has strong technical capabilities, is seeking challenging work and is committed to quality.
 
First and foremost, the candidate must be proficient in Autodesk AutoCAD Civil 3D and possess experience on civil infrastructure design projects to prepare construction drawings for the water/wastewater group. This includes knowledge of surfaces, profiles, and pipe networks. In addition, the candidate will have the opportunity to work closely with engineers on a variety of infrastructure projects, including drainage/flood control and environmental projects. 
 
The candidate will be responsible for all CAD plan production out of the Kansas operation, working with and assigning various tasks to Junior CAD drafters and Engineers as workload increases. The candidate must be able to clearly communicate with other members of the CAD team and provide training as necessary to ensure consistent and quality deliverables. 
 
The candidate will improve means and methods for delivery of its contract documents. This includes developing and improving existing CAD standards, quality control, delivery, presentation and efficient execution for all phases of a project from concept to project closeout. 
 
Key Responsibilities 
The selected candidate will lead the multi-disciplined engineering CAD design department providing engineering contract drawings and models for construction. The selected candidate will also be essential in developing efficient administration of the CAD system, files, and standards. The Candidate will assign the work of the department’s drafters. 
*MONEIS*
Wood is a global leader in the delivery of project, engineering and technical services to energy and industrial markets. title: Loan Officer Assistant - Florida (Tampa Orlando)
description:
Mortgage Loan Officer Assistant
If you like to work with people in a family atmosphere, enjoy great benefits and provide a high level of service that makes each mortgage run smoothly, consider a career with Bell Bank’s mortgage team.
 
Company Information:
Bell Bank Mortgage is backed by the financial strength of the 10th largest privately owned bank in the nation. Founded in 1966 and headquartered in Fargo, North Dakota, Bell Bank has more than $6 billion in assets and full-service banking locations in North Dakota, Minnesota and Arizona. Bell has empowered more than $14 million in charitable giving through its unique Pay It Forward initiative, through which every employee chooses each year how to help individuals, families and organizations in need.
Originally founded in 1880 by early Minneapolis civic leader David C. Bell, Bell’s mortgage division today has thousands of family mortgages to its name. Actively expanding, Bell Bank Mortgage has offices not only in the Midwest, but also in several other regions of the country.
  
Bell Bank has been recognized as a top workplace by American Banker, Forbes and Fortune and has been named among America’s top mortgage employers by National Mortgage Professional magazine.
 
If you want to work for an established, growing, forward-looking organization with world-class employees, this is the place for you. Let Bell Bank Mortgage be your destination workplace. 
Bell’s Values:
As stewards, dedicated to the growth and reputation of this independently owned organization, we are committed to:
* Promoting and sustaining our family atmosphere.
* Providing unequaled personal service to each and every customer.
* “Paying it forward” by giving back to the communities we serve.
Our Bottom Line:
Happy Employees! Happy Customers!
Job Summary:
Under supervision and management of the Loan Officer, this position helps build a team with the goal of growing and expanding the team’s business while ensuring the highest possible level of customer service to the team’s clients.
Primary Duties:
* Assist Loan Officer in managing new and existing loan volume.
* Assist the Loan Officer with marketing their services.
* Maintain customer database and assist in marketing to previous mortgage customer to increase volume.
* Assist and maintain contact with clients, realtors, builders and others to maintain and deepen relationships to foster new business opportunities.
* Keep informed of the trends and developments in the general real estate industry as well as the changing rules and regulations pertaining to all 1st mortgage origination. 
* Provide high level of assistance to internal and external customers in person and on the phone. 
* Review all documents for completeness and compliance with investor requirements.
* Follow up on missing documents.
* Maintain comprehensive understanding of the loan origination process and all functions within the processing and closing departments.
* Ensure adherence to lending compliance requirements and internal procedures.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
Job Skills Required:
* Minimum of two years of mortgage banking experience. 
* Working knowledge of standard loan products in the industry and familiarity with underwriting guidelines.
* Skills specific to mortgage origination and processing preferred.
* Excellent customer service and communication skills.
* Ability to work with Bell systems and procedures.
* Ability to support the loan officer in technology.
* Ability to function efficiently and effectively under deadlines and stress while maintaining a professional and mature profile.
Bell Bank Mortgage provides competitive compensation and an excellent benefits package. 
Bell Bank Mortgage 
Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Computer Operator
description:
Primary work location within the Washington D.C. area.  Qualified individuals should have knowledge of computer operating systems, software for error handling and recovery, and operating computer system peripheral devices. ELINT operational experience is highly desirable. Individuals must also exhibit the ability to operate and monitor multiple computer systems and peripheral devices concurrently, plan and schedule work priorities to meet deadlines and emergencies, analyze and resolve hardware/software problems, and provide self-assessed task completion and satisfaction status. Candidate is required to possess an active TOP SECRET/SCI clearance. Typical duties and responsibilities include preparing daily production schedule, handling data processing, managing computer resources efficiently to provide maximum throughput and adequate system response, maintaining operations by monitoring error and stoppage messages, scheduling automated processing tasks, and monitoring completion of schedules tasks. The individual(s) will communicate regularly regarding completion of data processing status, help to resolve computer related issues, and route data processing questions to other areas as appropriate. Additionally, the Computer Operator(s) will analyze and resolve hardware and/or software problems such as operational discrepancies, job aborts, and network issues and provide operational support for wide area and local area networks. They will refer problems to appropriate staff when operators’ best efforts cannot resolve and may occasionally develop software tools to enhance overall efficiency. The chosen individual(s) will be responsible for operating the computer efficiently to ensure production, packaging, and delivery of regular and special reports.  Other duties include maintaining operations database (i.e. jobs, scheduling, inventory, tape library, auto scheduler, etc.), correcting and documenting operational problems and discrepancies, including program changes and procedural changes as directed, and communicating changes in operating procedures and techniques to all operations personnel. They will ensure adherence to established policies and requirements relating to access to and security of the computer operations area. This includes responsibility for maintaining log files from the access control system. Daily and weekly responsibilities consist of performing emergency backup procedures and ensuring their accuracy, filing application and system recovery when needed, maintaining and upgrading the backup and recovery application and its associated database. Individual(s) will keep their technology skills up-to-date including training on new equipment and software, learning new or modified procedures, and reading technical manuals. Positions in this classification may perform all or some of the responsibilities above and all positions perform other related duties as assigned.
This position’s work environment includes high noise levels, proper handling of computer equipment and associated peripheral devices, including the proper use of cleaning materials and fluids. The individual(s) will work with electric, electronic, and mechanical equipment, and exposure to video display terminals on a regular basis. Individual(s) may be required to work various shifts and/or weekends to provide uninterrupted computer services. Physical capabilities include extended periods of standing and/or walking, and a learned physical skill which is required for keyboarding.  Chosen candidate must be responsive to alarms and able to log information.
Minimum qualifications include a high school diploma or equivalent, or an Associate’s degree in a computer-related discipline with two years of related training. Related experience may substitute for the degree requirement or training.  Two years of recent experience as a computer operator or related data center experience is required. Former USN enlisted personnel with NEC 9102 and/or 9141 is a plus.
Submit resumes to

title: ENVIRONMENTAL TECHNICIAN
description:
Monitors, controls, and processes biological, chemical, radioactive materials and associated hazardous wastes which includes but is not limited to: disposal, moving, storage, inventory, instrument calibration, surveys, and clean-up. Incumbent will move heavy objects.
$39,208 - $48,984 per year; DOE
15-May-2020
Assists with and may coordinate site visits (e.g., audits, consultations, inspections) of university areas that utilize hazardous processes or hazardous materials (e.g., biological, chemical, lasers, radiological materials) to ensure compliance with federal, state, local regulations, codes, and university requirements.
May assist in performing pollution prevention and sustainability education programs.
Uses a checklist as assigned to identify problems associated with the handling of hazardous materials and processes.
May conduct measurements with supplied equipment and training, and provides the data for required reports for tracking, decision-making and/or to satisfy compliance requirements.
Works with the department to communicate to customers on safety related matters.
Provides data to support compliance activities and to ensure environmental and safety programs are implemented and assists with implementing changes.
May perform routine and frequent labor-intensive tasks. Assists with on- and off-site handling, storage, packaging transport and/or disposal of hazardous materials.
May handle hazardous materials, including: biologicals, chemicals, lasers and radioactive materials and using specialized equipment (e.g., equipment used for gas detection, mercury vapor analysis, and radiation detection).
May assist in maintaining inventory and storage of hazardous materials (e.g. biologicals, chemicals, and radioactive and potentially radioactive substances).
Assists project teams with special studies to recommend solutions or alternatives.
Assists with developing training and workshop for staff in the use of data processing and management tools.
Maintains department databases keeping information current using various information systems or user specific software.
May assist with routine office functions including: answering phones and transferring calls, organizing data/files and filing documents, ordering supplies and maintaining inventories.
May assist with processing training records and inspection results and creating and updating documents to comply with ASU brand and marketing standards.
Works as a member of project team supporting the development or facilitation of high impact training materials and participates in logistics, planning, and communication.
Completes onsite data collection checklists for environmental sample analysis and equipment readings. Calibrates and maintains monitoring equipment as assigned.
May serve as a member of department emergency response team and participates in emergency drills and actual emergencies.
Associate degree in a science or technical field directly related to the position and two (2) years related experience; or High School diploma with a minimum of 4 years science or technical experience; Or, any equivalent combination of experience or education from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been achieved. 
Experience in hazardous materials management (2 Years).
Experience arranging for the safe handling or processing routine incoming hazardous materials, including biologicals, chemicals, and radioactive materials.
History of accomplishments through working both independently and within a team environment.
Activities are performed in an environmentally controlled office setting subject to extended periods of sitting, keyboarding and manipulating a computer mouse
Required to stand for varying lengths of time and walk moderate distances to perform work
Frequent bending, reaching, lifting, pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds
Regular activities require ability to quickly change priorities, which may include or are subject to resolution of conflicts
Work in laboratories, shops, waste facilities and other hazardous locations
Work in indoor and outdoor environments that may include extreme weather conditions; hot in summer and cold in winter
Participate in respiratory protection program; assists with respiratory fit testing and training
Participate in ASU medical surveillance programs, which may include vaccinations
With more than 70,000 students across four campuses, Arizona State University is a comprehensive public research university located in one of the fastest growing metropolitan areas in the United States. At the Polytechnic campus, students approach professional and technological programs through project based learning. title: Department Supv, Lab
description:
Description 
.JOB DESCRIPTION: Plans, organizes and directs the day to day operations of a technical laboratory or functional area including staff supervision, coordination with lab leadership and other hospital departments. Plans, administers and monitors the department's capital equipment, operations, and personnel budgets; regularly reviews year to date expenditures; and takes corrective action as necessary; establishes inventory control procedures. Evaluates vendor products; develops criteria for determining vendor selection; and recommends vendor which best meets defined criteria. Develops departmental short and long term goals and objectives. Meets with other staff members to discuss progress and to develop future courses of action. Analyzes departmental strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and constraints. Manages staff and employee performance. Resolves Human resource related issues, determines staffing needs, interviews and hires staff. Provides on-going performance feedback, addresses problems, orients and trains employees, verifies competency and identifies and suggests ways to develop skills. Provides formal and informal counseling to employees. Monitors workflow. Assists in developing laboratory wide policies and procedures. Establishes area specific procedures related to technical performance and specific job responsibilities in accordance with regulating agency.
Oversees quality control program within area(s) of responsibility. Monitors quality improvement standards. Monitors laboratory test results and patient reports as required. Implements and evaluates operational changes to improve productivity and the quality and efficiency of laboratory services. Monitors advance maintenance and troubleshooting of equipment and instruments. Coordinates correction of malfunctions with service representative. Researches and recommends purchase of new products or equipment. Approves and processes orders for supplies, reagents or equipment. Directs maintenance of LIS database and implementation of software enhancement and system checks. Monitors backup for data integrity and participates in recovery and restoration. Interprets applicable regulations to direct recordkeeping for complete and accurate documentation. Reviews accuracy and timeliness of patient test results; provides data for and prepares operational and statistical reports for management and regulatory agencies to comply with regulations. May serve on or chair laboratory and hospital committees or clinical pathways. Communicates operational changes to staff; seeks input and recommendations on ways to improve operations. Meets with laboratory administration, nursing and faculty regarding laboratory operations, research and customer services. Develops and presents training programs on employee safety, infection control, and leadership development and new employee orientation. Prepares laboratory for inspection or accreditation visits including staff compliance with policies and procedures and proficiency testing program. Monitors research and development activities within the laboratory; assists in the development and implementation of new procedures. Performs laboratory tests as required. Performs other related duties as required. 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in medical technology, clinical lab science or a chemical, physical or biological science. Other bachelor's degrees will be accepted if graduated from an accredited school of medical technology or if science and math coursework meet requirement of certifying agency. Bachelor's degree may be waived for a medical technologist who was ASCP certified in the years prior to the bachelor's degree requirement by ASCP and a HEW/HHS technologist certified by Health and Human Services. Four (4) years of medical technology experience required. Five (5) years of medical technology experience preferred. Supervisory experience preferred. MT (ASCP), MLS (ASCP) or categorical, MT (AMT), MT (HHS or HEW), CHT (ABHI), CHS (ABHI), CT (ASCP), HTL (ASCP), or HT (ASCP) required. 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS (Medium): 20-50 lbs; 0-33% of the work day (occasionally); 11-25 lbs, 34-66% of the workday (frequently); 01-10 lbs, 67-100% of the workday (constantly); Lifting 50 lbs max; Carrying of objects up to 25 lbs; Occasional to frequent standing & walking, Occasional sitting, Close eye work (computers, typing, reading, writing), Physical demands may vary depending on assigned work area and work tasks. 
 
 ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS: Factors affecting environment conditions may vary depending on the assigned work area and tasks. Environmental exposures include, but are not limited to: Blood-borne pathogen exposure Bio-hazardous waste Chemicals/gases/fumes/vapors Communicable diseases Electrical shock, Floor Surfaces, Hot/Cold Temperatures, Indoor/Outdoor conditions, Latex, Lighting, Patient care/handling injuries, Radiation, Shift work, Travel may be required. Use of personal protective equipment, including respirators, environmental conditions may vary depending on assigned work area and work tasks.

title: Mid-Level Application Security Administrator
description:
WMATA-0000007522
Application Security Administrator - Mid The Application Security Administrator has a primary focus on the establishment and management of user accounts for the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA). To include developing and implementing rolebased access controls through user profiles, which address need to know, separation of duties, and least privilege according to WMATA policy. The candidate will be responsible for the development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) user guidance and conducting annual user account recertification. This position will interact with various types of customers/users, ISSOs, ISSEs, etc. and must be able to effectively interact with each and provide strong customer support, ticket resolution, and reporting. Security Administration support includes, but is not limited to PeopleSoft, Maximo, Entrust, etc.
 
The desired candidate should have at least five (5) years of experience in designing, implementing, and supporting security processes in multiple PeopleSoft environments, including new implementations, security redesign or assessment of a security environment.
Experience in PeopleSoft HCM/ELM/FSCM with version 9.0 and higher, PeopleSoft EPM/CRM, PeopleTools with version 8.5x, knowledge of Maximo, Entrust Security and SQL developer is highly desired. 
 
Minimum Qualifications: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field with a minimum of five (5) years of experience in an information technology environment with a concentration on IT security administration and management of PeopleSoft applications. Or an equivalent combination of postsecondary school education and ten (10) years of progressively responsible experience an information technology environment with a concentration on IT security administration and management of PeopleSoft applications.
 
Job Summary/Duties: This classification requires a comprehensive in-depth knowledge of information contained in the PeopleSoft applications (i.e., FMS, HCM, EPM, CRM, etc.) and Oracle databases. The contractor will be responsible for the protection of WMATA¿s Peoplesoft and Oracle information assets against unauthorized use, modification, disclosure, or destruction by WMATA employees or other parties whether accidental or intentional.

title: Senior Retail Sales Associate
description:
Are you passionate about coffee? Do you care about sustainability and quality? At Nespresso we place people, coffee and sustainable living at the heart of what we do, inspiring an engaging and meaningful place to work. We are seeking passionate and dynamic Senior Sales Associate for our world class team who can focus on driving sales, service, and sustainability through respectful, collaborative, agile, determined, and driven engagement with clients, team members, and management. Also to support management with opening/closing and cash duties.
A day in the life:
PEOPLE
• Perform Boutique tasks as delegated by management
• Share feedback & opinions respectfully & considerately with management team
• Participate in team meetings & contribute ideas/suggestions to improve Boutique operations 
• Respect team members & management by adhering to shift/work scheduling and attendance policy 
• Proactively cultivate new client relationships 
• Complete special projects per agreed-upon PDP plan as delegated by manger
SALES & SERVICE
• Greet & Engage: Welcome with enthusiasm and sincerity all Boutique customers as they enter the space & direct them through the customer journey 
• Listen & Learn: Prescribe appropriate machines & capsules by asking open ended questions and providing creative solutions 
• Share Knowledge: Demonstrate up-to-date knowledge of new products, current products, and promotions 
• Win the Sale: Utilize Nespresso Five Steps of Sales and Service (up, cross, new, and re), NES-Eloquence, and Storytelling to achieve individual & Boutique targets 
• Offer Tastings: Initiate customers into the art of coffee tasting & develop their curiosity about Nespresso products 
• Member Accuracy: Manage the member database, entering all customer data accurately  
• Compliance: Understand and adhere to cash operating procedures and returns policies 
• React with respect and provide excellent customer service at all times 
• Utilize Nespresso’s Six Customer Experience Principles to deliver a unique and customized customer experience 
• Share Nespresso’s community & sustainability missions with all customers 
• Maintain awareness of traffic levels & surroundings, adjusting pace, acknowledging new clients, etc.
OPERATIONS & SAFETY
• Adhere to the all Boutique opening and closing procedures as directed by management  
• Work with management team to ensure safe working conditions 
• Properly dispose of all recyclables, garbage, etc. 
• Execute tasks in an efficient & sustainable fashion as directed by management 
• Observe stock levels & refill/assist as necessary 
• Adhere to retail operations procedures and best practices as directed by management team  
• Adhere to compliance and quality standards in keeping with the Standard Operation Procedures 
• Adhere to cash management and return procedures as directed by management
Benefits and Perks: 
• Competitive pay 
• Quarterly and annual bonus
• Paid vacation time 
• Tuition reimbursement program 
• Referral bonus program 
• Recognition program with monetary rewards
• Nestle corporate discounts
• Complimentary uniforms and dry cleaning
• Free Machine and coffee allowance 
• 401K savings match
• Guaranteed minimum hours
Winning Skillsets: 
• High School Diploma or GED required
• 1+ years of sales or customer service experience in a premium or consumable environment preferred
• A real passion for coffee and respect for sustainability; ability to self-educate and educate others on the coffee culture
• The world is rapidly changing and we need people who are resourceful, agile and willing to evolve. 
• Flexible to work select shifts; days, nights, weekends and holiday

title: Research Associate II (REQ1212)
description:
Job ID: req1212
Employee Type: exempt full-time
Facility: Frederick: ATRF
Location: 8560 Progress Dr, Frederick, MD 21701 USA
The Frederick National Laboratory is a Federally Funded Research and Development Center (FFRDC) sponsored by the National Cancer Institute (NCI) and operated by Leidos Biomedical Research, Inc. The lab addresses some of the most urgent and intractable problems in the biomedical sciences in cancer and AIDS, drug development and first-in-human clinical trials, applications of nanotechnology in medicine, and rapid response to emerging threats of infectious diseases.
Our core values of accountability, compassion, collaboration, dedication, integrity, and versatility serve as a guidepost for how we do our work every day in serving the public's interest. 
 
 The Clinical Services Program's primary mission is to perform sequential studies using samples obtained from patients with cancer, AIDS, chronic granulomatous disease or other diseases associated with immunologic dysfunction, as well as to monitor viral load in patients with HIV. 
The Vaccine, Immunity and Cancer Program investigates immune responses to vaccines in preclinical and clinical studies, with a focus on HPV. 
 
The Vaccine, Immunity and Cancer Program is looking for Research Associate II to conduct serology testing for SARS-CoV-2. The aims of this project are to produce critical assay reagents and perform serology and other immune assays for assessment of immune responses to infection. 
The Research Associate II will:

title: Infrastructure and Applications Support Specialist
description:
As a Infrastructure and Applications Specialist you will be responsible for providing leadership in designing and maintaining our complex environment of systems that we use to service our user base. You will be aware of our on-premise architectures and understand how to gather all pertinent requirements and then select the appropriate platform.
In addition, you will also be a Tier III escalation point for our 24x7x365 staffed engineers whom track all events related to all fault and performance monitoring of our critical hardware and software infrastructure. The role includes timely processing alerts and suppression requests for servers, OS’s, network devices, bandwidth, applications, databases and end-user experiences, as well as monitoring all associated elements including security, power and environmental conditions. Our engineers help plan, organize and oversee day-to-day operational activities for his or her work shifts. This position requires a strong background implementing and managing typical network management processes and procedures. This position demands strong interpersonal skills and routine interaction with sales, internal network engineering, field engineering, accounting, external service providers, equipment vendors and clients during normal service and provisioning activities.
Our engineers are one of our central points of contact for network trouble and problem escalation notifications. It is important and challenging work that helps drive the success of our users. On some days, the right person in the job can have a monumentally rewarding impact on the work lives of other people. We need people who want to take on that type of challenge.
 
 
Architect skill level on a few with Tier 3 skill on most others.
The following certifications are preferred: VMWare, MCSA/MSCE, CCNA/CCDA, CISSP, ITIL, Project+, Network+

title: SAP BASIS and Security Administrator
description:
Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios Inc. ("MGM") is seeking a passionate SAP BASIS and Security administrator to join the Media Technology Group. This individual will manage a portfolio of applications, maintain the security and resources focusing on SAP environments such as ERP, IPM/IS-Media, and Solution Manager. The responsibility of the position is to support, document, and secure the technical environments as required by SAP standards.
Individual must have solid understanding of SAP architecture and Security administration, its underlying database (Oracle), operating system, and hardware platform. This person will interact with the SAP development team, Info Sec team, various technical teams, and business stakeholders to optimize and maintain overall SAP reliability, availability, and performance. Must have excellent communication skills, technical aptitude and be a team player.

title: Data Entry
description:
Job Purpose:
Maintains database by entering new and updated customer and account information.
Duties:
* Prepares source data for computer entry by compiling and sorting information; establishing entry priorities.
* Processes customer and account source documents by reviewing data for deficiencies; resolving discrepancies by using standard procedures or returning incomplete documents to the team leader for resolution.
* Enters customer and account data by inputting alphabetic and numeric information on keyboard or optical scanner according to screen format.
* Maintains data entry requirements by following data program techniques and procedures.
* Verifies entered customer and account data by reviewing, correcting, deleting, or reentering data; combining data from both systems when account information is incomplete; purging files to eliminate duplication of data.
* Tests customer and account system changes and upgrades by inputting new data; reviewing output.
* Secures information by completing data base backups.
* Maintains operations by following policies and procedures; reporting needed changes.
* Maintains customer confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
* Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Skills/Qualifications:
Organization, Typing, Data Entry Skills, Attention to Detail, Confidentiality, Thoroughness, Decision Making, Independence, Analyzing Information , Results Driven, Energy Level, Oracle experience preferred.

title: Database Administrator
description:
Job Purpose:
Maintains database by identifying and solving database requirements; supporting users.
Duties:
* Identifies database requirements by interviewing customers; analyzing department applications, programming, and operations; evaluating existing systems and designing proposed systems.
* Recommends solutions by defining database physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications.
* Installs revised or new systems by proposing specifications and flowcharts; recommending optimum access techniques; coordinating installation requirements.
* Maintains database performance by calculating optimum values for database parameters; implementing new releases; completing maintenance requirements; evaluating computer operating systems and hardware products.
* Prepares users by conducting training; providing information; resolving problems.
* Provides information by answering questions and requests.
* Supports database functions by designing and coding utilities.
* Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
* Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.
* Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

title: Senior Database Administrator/Developer
description:
Kratos is a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment that is team oriented and relationship driven to foster innovation and creativity. Our motto, "From Strength to Success," reflects our commitment to continually leveraging our technical and intellectual strengths for the ultimate success of our customers.
Kratos Defense & Rocket Support Services Inc. division provides a full spectrum of solutions for complex C5ISR, engineering and operational requirements, and military weapon systems. We have years of experience in logistics, engineering, and target operations support, as well as international programs, rocket program services, technology initiatives, and advanced weapon system research and engineering.
Our in-depth understanding of our client missions, in conjunction with the strategic location of our employees, enables us to offer cost effective solutions tailored to our clients' specific requirements and consistent with their evolving mission objectives.
The Senior Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for Supply Analysis and Logistics Information Systems. The DBA will support the Product Support Manager and Fleet Sustainment Chief by performing multiple product oversight within Sustainment Logistics Automation systems. DBA will work with internal and external users to provide reporting, training, and issue resolution.
• Will establish reports for the government departmental heads, management, and key stakeholders.
• These reports have to be clear, convincing, informative, engaging, unambiguous, and uniquely tailored to suit different audiences.
• A definite responsibility for designing/implementing information system changes, logistics coding structures, and designing/running/analyzing reports to ensure uninterrupted flow of parts through the Supply chain.
• Establishes internal guidance, reports, roles, and procedures to maintain data accuracy across information systems.
• Set standards, training, and audits to ensure users are assigned appropriate roles and expertise within the automated logistics systems to accomplish their assigned Supply/Logistics functions, while limiting access to key transactions that would create conflicts of interest and/or program risk.
• Provides Subject Matter Expertise to working groups to establish plans to correct data and process issues impacting multiple platforms
• Setup and test databases in development environment
• Responsible for writing interface agreements between organization and outside agencies to ensure automated requisition flow, returns, Modification Work Orders (MWOs), and other supply related functions
• Development and enforcement of Performance Based Logistics (PBL) maintenance related policies, procedures, and regulations
• Makes formal and informal presentations to all management levels, outlining the history, current status, and objectives of the logistics information systems and related functions
• Responsible for ensuring data quality related to Material/Parts masters in multiple logistics systems
• Other duties as assigned
• US citizenship is required
• Possess 5+ years of Structured Query Language (SQL) and administrative/server maintenance experience in automated supply systems
• Demonstrative experience working in report creation, modeling, and trend forecasting
• Must be able to create, troubleshoot, and enhance the business’s data loadings
• Possess a clear understanding of key IT business systems, reporting/analytics, and data warehousing
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Maintain sensitive and confidential information as required by government standards
• Interact effectively and professionally with peers and supervisors and the public when necessary
• Operate independently with minimal supervision
• Experience working in a DOD field
• Experience working with COLTS, DPAS, GFEBS, LMP, AESIP, or GCSS-ARMY (Supply Chain Management Systems)
• Strong working knowledge of reporting tools such as Oracle Business Intelligence, Tableau, SSRS, or any similar tools
• Information Assurance Technology (IAT) Level 2 certification
• Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Logistics, or a related field
• 17 years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree, 14 years of experience with a Master's degree, and 12 years of experience with a PhD
• Comp TIA (Security Plus and 70-680 Microsoft Certificate) can be substituted for CISSP, GSEC, CISSP, CASP+, GICSP, GCIH, GCED, or CISA within 90 days of starting

title: Database Administrator
description:
TASKS AND DUTIES:
? Manages data requirements gathering and analysis for new and existing projects.
? Supports Microsoft SQL Server 2012/2014/2016 databases across all environments.
? Supports Microsoft SQL Server 2012/2014/2016 replication feature widely used by different applications.
? Supports Microsoft Windows 2012 and 2016 Enterprise Servers including configuration and maintenance.
? Implements and supports Microsoft Clustering Services both on the SQL Server and System levels.
? Installs and configures Microsoft SQL Server 2012/2014/2016 and Microsoft Windows 2012 and 2016 servers.
? Monitors Microsoft SQL Server activity on a proactive basis and tune the system for optimal performance.
? Creates, designs, manages and troubleshoots SSIS packages.
? Monitors and troubleshoots ETL jobs daily using BCP, DTSRUN, SSIS and other Performance Monitoring tools.
? Maintains error and system maintenance logs.
? Performs OLAP and OLTP Data modeling with the ERWIN data modeling tool.
? Supports Operational data model and data mapping.
? Supports the development and maintenance of DOE application data dictionary.
? Manages and supports DB2 relational system and troubleshoot issues on the DB2 System.
? Administers DB2 Connect, DB2 Gateway in different ETL set up.
? Investigates, analyzes and troubleshoots system performance and suggest/implement tuning as needed.
? Develop system tools and utilities (i.e. scripts, etc.) to simplify and support IT and business operations.
? Plan, implement and manage systems initiatives with IT and customer teams.
? Designs database tables utilizing import or export data from SQL Servers into other data sources on a daily basis through the development and coding of stored procedures and triggers, as needed.
? Establishes documents and maintains technical standards and server security policies.
? Patches servers, both software and firmware, on a scheduled basis as well as urgent security releases.
? Conducts performance monitoring, capacity planning, trend forecasting.
? Documents and improves upon processes, procedures, and best practices to align with industry standards and customer needs.
? Configures and optimizes Database System Configuration and Database Availability Reporting.
? Documents and improves upon processes, procedures, and best practices to align with industry standards and customer needs.
? Designs and implements database disaster recovery requirements to ensure business continuity requirements are met.
? Provides a high-level of customer satisfaction to internal and external customers, applying necessary sense of urgency and creativity in problem identification and prompt incident resolution.
? Provides advanced systems administration and support capability.
? Analyzes system performance; suggests and implements tuning as needed.
? Installs additional OpenSource and commercial software products as needed to develop, deploy, and support the platform.
Project Specific Technical Requirements: 
Proficiency in preparing, maintaining SQL server installation and configuration documents.
9+ years of experience in the following:
Query optimization experience with modification in TSQL queries, removing unnecessary columns, eliminating redundant and inconsistent data, normalizing database, establishing necessary joins, creating useful clustered index and non-clustered indexes.
8+ years of experience in the following: 
? Database Normalization, logical and physical modelling, capturing data lineage, table and column data definitions, valid values and others necessary information in the data models.
? Enforcing standards and best practices around data modelling efforts.
? SQL Server installation of SQL Server and updating with service packs and patches.
? SQL Server setup and configuration on Windows Servers and Linux.
? Installing and configuring SQL Server 2014/2016/2019 on the server and client machines, provide connections and manage databases.
? SQL Server installation on stand-alone and Windows Server Clustered environments.
? Administering the MS SQL Server security by creating user logins with appropriate roles, dropping and locking the logins, monitoring the user accounts, creation of groups, granting the privileges to users and groups.
? Installing and configuring MYSQL databases.
? Installing, authoring, and managing reports using SQL Server 2016 Reporting Services.
? Performing daily database tasks including backup and restore by using SQL Server native tools and third party software, including VERITAS net backups and Lite speed backups.
? Developing automated routine tasks for backup, restore and DBCC scripts for databases maintenance, optimization and transaction logs.
? Performing backup and data compression using different editions of SQL Server.
? Administering and monitoring MYSQL databases.
? Planning, gathering the pre-deployment information and deployment of the third party tools like IDERA SQL Diagnostic, Dynatrace AppMon, and Quest Foglight etc.
? Backup and recovery implementation Strategy for 24x7 operation support.
? Designing and implementing enterprise data warehouse solutions.
? Developing ETL Scripts to enable data processing into data warehouse.
? Working on developing robust data warehouse dictionary.
? Designing cubes in SSAS environment using Snowflake and Star Schemas.
? Configuring Report manager, PowerBI Servers, implementing role-based security to end users and developing report models for creating Ad-hoc reports using SSRS.
? Tuning queries and databases for better performance.
? Creating and maintaining Database Maintenance Plans.
? Performing SQL Server maintenance tasks including Database Integrity checks, update database Statistics and Re-indexing.
? Configuring data partitioning/table partitioning on huge tables containing millions of rows for better performance.
? Creating database objects including Stored Procedures, Triggers, Views and Functions for the application using T-SQL.
? Performance tuning experience, modification of Complex Stored procedures to improve efficiency of the system.
? Supporting day to day operational activities for the database platform like service requests and tickets, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting long running queries, locks, deadlocks and performance issue like CPU, I/O, Memory bottlenecks, Backup and Restore, SQL jobs.
5+ years of experience in the following:
Strong PowerShell experience for developing routine daily maintenance tasks.
ABBTECH is an EOE/Minorities/Women/Disabled Individuals/Veterans

title: Remote: PT Fundraising Database Administrator, non-profit
description:
Non-Profit in Midtown, Manhattan is looking to hire a PT Temporary Fundraising Database Administrator. The person in this role will work remotely from home. They are looking for someone who can work 8hrs per day 3 days per week. This role reports to the Director of Major Gifts and day to day the candidate in this position will be responsible for maintaining the integrity of the clients donor and prospect database (Raiser's Edge); working cross-functionally, you will perform data input, maintenance, cleansing and reporting. Specific responsibilities include: processing checks, online gifts, phone and in-person donations in a timely fashion, generating timely (24-48 hours) acknowledgement letters and tax receipts for all donations, generating mailing lists as needed, creating and running reports for reconciliation with finance department, CEO and development team, creating reports for Development and Finance teams and senior leadership to track progress against goals, coordinate with Blackbaud as needed to troubleshoot Raiser's Edge. In order to be considered you must have experience working in a Non-profit, fundraising Database management, and an expertise in Raisers Edge (prefer newest version NXT) and great Excel skills.

title: Lead SQL DBA
description:
Responsibilities:
• Lead team of DBAs in maintaining operations and optimal performance of large SQL Server farm
• Identify system shortcomings and work with leadership to identify and plan for appropriate solutions
• Monitor database performance for integrity, quality, and security.
• Implement performance tuning including updating statistics, reindexing, structure modifications, capacity planning, and index analysis.
• Implement database backup and recovery procedures, including disaster recovery procedures.
• Perform upgrades, conversions, integrations, migrations, document/database imports/exports, and application integration projects related to the firm’s DMS system.
• Perform database administration tasks including setup and monitoring of error logs, backups, maintenance routines, and database optimization.
• Perform automation tasks, applying service packs, and cumulative updates.
• Advanced support of related systems including Knowledge Management Systems, and Full Text Indexing / Searching systems.
• Create and manage SQL scripts, SSIS packages, SSRS reports, stored procedures, spreadsheets, charts and diagrams.
• Provide technical training and knowledgebase articles for Application Analysts, Support personnel, System Administrators, and others.
• Work on various projects related to evaluating, testing, and deployment of new software systems/technology.
• Provide technical assistance to users and others in the Information Technology Department.
• Monitor and act on escalated issues.  Monitor and work on problem tickets and requests for relevant application and system areas.  This includes timely acknowledgement of tickets / requests -- providing a high level of responsiveness and Customer Service.
Requirements
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
• 5+ years of progressive responsibility in large corporate environments.
• 5+ years of experience installation SQL Server in data center environments.
• 5+ years of experience with performance tuning, SQL server administration, and day-to-day operations.
• 5+ years of experience providing third-level support in relation to management of large SQL Server environments.
• 5+ years of experience in troubleshooting, analyzing, and fixing problems related to SQL servers, SQL databases, SQL process/jobs and SQL based applications/systems.
• 5+ years of experience with SQL Syntax, T-SQL scripts, and SSIS / SSRS.
• 2+ years of experience working in AWS Cloud
• Security+ certification

title: Database Administrator
description:
This position designs, maintains, and controls the corporate databases and data dictionary. Establishes and enforces all database standards. Analyzes all informational requirements of new or production systems and develops database specifications. Establishes and enforces controls to ensure database integrity and security.
Analyzes and defines the properties required by a database management system (DBMS) that will meet the current and future needs of the company.
Analyzes the organizational structure of the company and defines the logical database structure for current and future application development.
Establishes, maintains, and controls the corporate data dictionary.
Develops, documents, and enforces the standards for access to the database.
Defines and implements security procedures to ensure the integrity and privacy of the database.
Designs, implements, and periodically tests the database backup and recovery procedures.
Defines procedures for testing and implementing new applications in the database environment.
Analyzes current and projected future database performance; fine-tunes or recommends equipment changes when necessary.
Develops database training guidelines for the analyst and end-user.
Acts as mediator with different users to resolve conflicts of data naming conventions and ownership/privacy of data.
Maintains knowledge of current and future DBMS technology through schools, seminars, and publications.
Interacts with the technical support team and DBMS vendor to schedule installation and maintenance of the DBMS software
Provides suggestions for changes, enhancements, and modifications to products
Must be organized, driven and highly motivated with the ability to work independently
Proven ability to think strategically about customer needs and develop creative solutions
Self-starter with strong initiative and natural leadership qualities
Results-oriented, driven, and organized
Has authority to set and enforce database security, design, and performance standards.
Establishes disaster recovery procedures to ensure retrieval on all data and system software.
Provides technical knowledge to system designers and applications programmers to assist in their application development.
Provides technical and Data Base Support to MIS organization 24 hours a day, seven days a week. 
Ensure projects are completed by the defined schedules.
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, mathematics or equivalent, and/or five years systems design and analysis and programming exposure.
Training in file structures and design, information retrieval techniques, file access methods and controls, and development and documentation of standards.
Previous experience with installation of a data dictionary and database system.
Requires a strong technical background in credit union software and business operations, and a successful track record in the development of credit union software applications.
5+ years experience with a software development company
Strong working knowledge of data processing programming, systems design, problem analysis, and hardware.
Must possess the ability to work independently and as part of a larger team. 
Communication skills including written, oral, and presentation skills are required.
Must be able to perform complex analysis and produce professional documentation and recommendations.
A strong bias for action is essential.
Proficient in Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Outlook). Must be proficient in technology applications including the Credit Union’s operating system and specialized software required for performance of position.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals. Ability to compute rates, ratios and percentages.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop kneel, crouch, crawl; talk or hear and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing functions of this job.
The noise level in the work environment is moderately quiet. It is a non-smoking environment.
The above job requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and abilities. The marginal functions have not been included. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
This job description in no way implies that these are the only duties to be performed. An employee will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and duties as requested by the supervisor and/or management.

title: Data Warehouse/ DBA
description:
US Tech Solutions is seeking a “Data Warehouse/ DBA” for a 12+ months contract with a client in Charlotte, NC
This position will manage and maintain Data Lake clusters infrastructure: installation, configuration, performance tuning and monitoring of Hadoop clusters
 
Experience in tuning and optimizing Hadoop environment in keeping clusters healthy and available for end users and applications with maximum cluster uptime as defined in SLA
 
Collaborate and assist developers in successful implementation of their code, monitor and fine tune their process for optimum resource utilization on cluster, ability to automate run time process
important role is to keep the cluster performing well and dependable
should possess experience in cluster management, perform cluster upgrade, migration and testing
 
Perform periodic updates to cluster and keeping the stack current
perform and monitor backups of critical data and able to restore data when in need
ability to expand clusters by adding new nodes and rebalance cluster storage systems
manage application databases, application integration, users, roles, permissions within cluster
collaborate with Unix, network, database and security teams on cluster related matters
must monitor cluster for maximum uptime, ability to research on cluster issues via logs and collaborate with support in a proactive way
 
Good communication skills with right attitude to blend in with team
 
BS degree, preferably in Computer science or equivalent
 
Minimum 5 years work experience in Hadoop ecosystems (Horton or Cloudera) and/or related technologies (MAP R, data bricks etc)
must have good exposure to Cloudera manager, Cloudera Navigator or similar cluster management tool
 
Must have good knowledge of HDFS, Ranger/Sentry, Hive, Impala, Spark, HBase, Kudu, Kafka, Ni-Fi, sqoop and other Hadoop related services
 
Exposure to Data Science collaborative tools such as data science workbench, anaconda, etc.
 
Should demonstrate strong concepts in Unix/Linux, Windows OS, cloud platforms (MS Azure, AWS)
should have strong Networking concepts: topology, proxy, F5, firewall
 
Strong security concepts: Active directory ,Kerberos, LDAP, SAML, SSL, encryption
programming language concepts: Java, Perl, python, PySpark and Unix shell scripting

title: Operational Database Administrator (ODBA)  / Epic Adminstrator
description:
Role: Operational Database Administrator
Location: Clayton, NC 27520
Job Type: Full Time
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Operational Database Administrator (ODBA) is a critical, hands-on role. This person installs and administers your operational database (ODB) environments. This person also performs environment setup and configuration, proactive monitoring, and maintenance. 
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Creating and managing the ODB environments that serve production, reporting, disaster recovery, training, and non-production needs 
Installing and maintaining the administrative and monitoring tools necessary for high levels of availability and performance of your Epic system 
Understanding performance metrics, monitoring system performance, and troubleshooting issues 
Managing the logins for different types of access, including login behavior and working environment configuration 
Applying Caché and Epic upgrades and updates to production and non-production environments 
Configuring and maintaining environment copies according to the environment strategy 
Responding to emergency and after-hours issues 
Engaging in capacity planning exercises to ensure adequate system resources 
Collaborating with your technical teams and Epic to ensure proactive support 
Writing and maintaining scripts to improve system management tasks 
Participating in your change control process for all planned application and technical activities 
Maintaining and testing processes related to business continuity 
Following vendor and Epic best practices for hardware and software configuration

title: Senior Oracle Application, DBA
description:
Installs, upgrades and manages ERP components on Linux systems to include proprietary ERP upgrade tool; installs, manages and tunes java components supporting the ERP and component / companion applications. Installs and upgrades companion applications including compilers, job scheduling software, address correction software and others.
Installs, configures, troubleshoots, and maintains application systems that interface with Oracle and other databases. Monitors and tunes those systems to ensure system integrity and provides high performance, high availability service.
Coordinates and provides middleware support of Tomcat and messaging servers. Manages tomcat servers, instances and configurations directly supporting the ERP system; monitors for errors and utilization; troubleshoots and resolves issues.
Implements new versions, updates, and patches fixes to application software systems. Maintains detailed knowledge of software trends and advancements regarding those systems.
Coordinates and monitors system security for the ERP. Analyzes audit logs and takes appropriate action to address anomalies. Responds to legitimate internal and external requests for security related information.
Routinely communicates with Information Technology and College directors and managers to codify institutional expectations into systems specifications for database architectures. Develops requests for proposals (RFPs) and coordinates solutions with third party vendors to ensure control of database projects.
In coordination with the Senior Oracle DBA, performs replication, backup, and recovery tasks on Oracle databases. Troubleshoots and permanently corrects platform problems in a timely manner to provide 24/7 availability of services. Responsible for managing problem escalation to Oracle and third party support teams as appropriate. Upgrades databases to new versions as directed; applies security updates and patching as appropriate. Performs database cloning, tuning and monitoring. Manages Oracle wallets.
Implements new versions, updates, and patches fixes to the database management systems. Maintains detailed knowledge of computer hardware and software trends and advancements.
Designs and implements business continuity and disaster recovery protocols. Operates, monitors and maintains redundant data center platforms for a disaster response. Tests disaster recovery protocols and platforms to ensure timely and reliable restoration of critical business activities.
Advises programming staff, Linux and Microsoft system administrators and technical staff on advanced technical aspects pertaining to relational databases and related application software. Trains and instructs functional leaders and users in the proper use of multiple software products to maximize available capabilities.
Participates in the formal system change management process and is responsible for ensuring that
Banner changes are tested and perform as intended. Responsible for the integrity and security of the application and must be vigilant in protecting the access from unauthorized changes and disruptive system processes. Coordinates modifications, upgrades, new implementation and decommissioning efforts with affected system users. Documents all activity.
Participates in and contributes to divisional performance measurements and process improvement initiatives. Leads team activities to review and enhance workflows.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or closely related discipline or equivalent work experience and education/training providing similar knowledge and skills in database design and administration is necessary.
Oracle Certified Professional Certification, Red Hat System Administrator, a plus. Eight (8) or more years in an enterprise computing environment, of comparable complexity, including five (5) years of directly related, full-time experience in administrating Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Oracle application beyond degree equivalence is required.
Experience managing specific technologies of java, tomcat. Experience in basic linux shell scripting.
Experience in current operating environment and use of container technologies will be given preference.
Certification in systems and applications to be supported may be considered an equivalency for experience requirements.
Applicants this job requisition will be published until filled.

title: SQL / PostgreSQL DBA (AWS / Azure)
description:
SQL / PostgreSQL DBA (AWS / Azure) - Contract or CTP- Durham, NC 
The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.
A Financial Company is seeking a SQL / PostgreSQL DBA (AWS / Azure) in Durham, NC. 
Role Description
* To lead the Database Application support functions team with in-depth knowledge of SQL Server and experience working in other databases PostgreSQL in cloud environment - AWS and Azure
* Deliver Cloud Infrastructure in AWS and Azure to meet application demands.
* Provide Cloud user management, security, capacity, monitoring and configuring application tools
* Deploy, configure and maintain database on Azure Managed Cloud and AWS RDS
* Assist in all aspects of cloud migration initiatives including Data movement
* To identify and execute improvements in database services, through automation, self-service enablement and process improvements including Performance & Tuning and SQL Tuning
* Enable solutions to business problems through deep domain expertise and delivery
* Provides technical supervision on multiple applications for PostgreSQL and SQL Server
* Design, document, script, test and implement internally developed or vendor applications
* Participates in design reviews and unit testing
* Work with the systems analysts to define requirements
Skills & Requirements
* Bachelor or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Equivalent
* 10+ years of IT experience with at least 5+ years of SQL Server and PostgreSQL experience including performance & Tuning and Infrastructure engineering and development support, large projects and programs.
* Traditional Database Technologies - Oracle, PostgreSQL and SQL Server
* Industry standards on commercial DB technologies
* Knowledge on web services and Rest API, DevOps, JSON and XML
* Azure Product knowledge, experience coordinating, migrating and optimizing Azure.
* Experience in data movement tools to migration data from on premise to cloud
* AWS Solid understanding and experience coordinating, migrating databases.
* Strong Expertise in Database Technologies - PostgreSQL or SQL Server
* Experience in a UNIX environment: shell, sed, awk, perl, python etc.
* Excellent troubleshooting and error analysis skills
* Full solid understanding of Information Security concepts
* Experience in multi-vendor environments

title: MongoDB Database Administrator
description:

·       BS or higher education in Computer Science, Software Engineering or IT-oriented degree program.
·       6+ years admin experience, preferably in a DB Admin and DB DevOps.
·       In depth hands-on experience of the concepts, architecture and administration of NOSQL - MongoDB database.
·       Experience in installing and configuring databases along with security, performance tuning, backup, replication and monitoring.
·       Familiarity and awareness of implementing and supporting databases in an AWS Cloud Infrastructure environment.
·       Financial Services experience and ability to understand the product and business value of the Application DBA technical lead role.

title: Security Access (Server) Administrator
description:
Security Access Administrator manages access control for more than 3500 UNIX and Windows servers. This position requires hands-on UNIX (AIX, Solaris, Linux) experience as well as working with UNIX access management products including Centrify Identity and Access Management Solutions to manage access to UNIX platform. This position is responsible for processing requests for UNIX and Windows access in accordance with policies and service level agreements. Skills and experience with scripting using UNIX shell and PowerShell programming is highly desirable as well as understanding of UNIX user access management, SSH configuration, sudo and dzdo.
 
- IT security access management.
- A minimum of 1 year Information Technology (IT) experience including development, implementation, communication, monitoring and maintenance of information security policies and procedures.
- A minimum of 1 year UNIX skills (AIX, Linux, Solaris) with a focus on Identity Management
- Windows File Server experience
- Basic to intermediate understanding of UNIX Security concepts
- Basic to intermediate understanding of Active Directory Users and Computers
                                                                                               
- Process Incident tickets and Work Orders for UNIX / Windows account provisioning/de-provisioning
- Manage Active Directory accounts and privileges
- Manage UNIX/Centrify accounts and elevated privileges
- Create and manage Process IDs, Training IDs, and Test IDs
- Evaluate and remediate general security & access issues
- Recommends and/or assists in the development and implementation of Information Protection policies, standards, procedures, and guidelines
- Reviews security logs and violation reports and follows-up as appropriate
- Create and manage access to secured shared files and folders across Windows File Server platforms
- Configure and manage UNIX security access for the following projects:  BI Appliance, PDOA, BDO, BDA, ATLAS Data Lake, DIME, eDR, and SAS
- Collaborate with the UNIX Production Support teams to troubleshoot access and server configuration issues
- Collaborate with Core Intel Support with group policies which affect user access and other domains outside of the Corp domain.
- Work with leading industry technology including Varonis, Centrify, Cyber Ark Safe Manager, Change Auditor Tool
- Configure and Manage Exchange server mailboxes, distribution lists, conference rooms, and shared mailboxes
- IIS Administration for Open Deploy and Web developer access
- Create, maintain and provision access for all Process ID/Service account within the client Organization
- Manage and administer Mainframe access
- Create and migrate Home Drives and server data
- Interacting with Production teams (Unix, Core Intel) with projects and other access related support
- Scripting including reports, Bulk Changes, and Automation

description:

Shortlist Criteria: 1. 6+ Years’ experience administering Sybase databases running REDHAT LINUX on physical or virtual servers 2. Proven track record of administering databases running ASE 16 3. Strong experience with Rep Server and other Sybase features and tools 4. Strong experience with database performance testing and tuning, user configuration, security and support processes 5. Delivering required database functionality that meets project requirements on or before defined due date
Quals--

Qualifications: • 6+ Years’ experience administering Sybase databases running REDHAT LINUX on physical or virtual servers; • Proven track record of administering databases running ASE 16; • Proven track record of administering Sybase databases in a challenging, deadline-driven, enterprise environment; • Strong experience with Rep Server and other Sybase features and tools; • Strong experience in applying vendor software patches and the ability to troubleshoot errors encountered during patching; • Strong experience with database performance testing and tuning, user configuration, security and support processes including gathering statistics; • Strong perl dbi and shell scripting skills; • Experience with configuring and administering the Bradmark Surveillance product; • Experience with performing database backups / restores / recoveries; • Ability to provide technical direction to others, including application developers; • Ability and willingness to follow established IT / DBA policies and procedures required; • 4-year degree (BA or BS) or equivalent work experience in a related field of study.

description:
Please note that this is a 6 months contract position. 
Candidate should be willing to submit a skill summary questionnaire. 
Job Responsibilities:
• Work with Project Team to review project intent and flush out technical requirements.
• Perform complex database work with minimum guidance, such as design and develop new or enhance existing database schema, create stored procedure, views for application or database system.
• Work with Tech lead and other developers to create optimized database interface for applications, end users or downstream systems.
• Responsible for performance tuning and optimization of stored procedures and indexes.
• Mentor junior database dev for complex development or troubleshooting work.
• Advocate database standard and best practice and contribute ideas to enhance them
• Production Support: Support of Operations Team with data manipulation and ad-hoc reporting. Work with IT team and end-users to help troubleshoot problems. Participate in on-call rotation and respond to critical database incidents. After-hours support for application release and change management activities.
• Perform code review of colleagues work to ensure consistency and viability of logic.
• Efficient in using TFS source control and auto build/deployment process.
Required Skills:
• Bachelor's in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or equivalent preferred
• Minimum 10+ years overall IT experience, including hands-on expertise with recent relational database development and integration.

• Experience in ETL tools (SSIS, Informatica) and database integration with Oracle, SQL Server and other databases
• Expertise using T-SQL for developing complex database objects such as stored procedures, functions, complex query
• Must have experience in data analysis and business requirements gathering (experience in writing business-driven user stories will be an advantage)
• Advanced skill in performance tuning for indexes, and stored procedure/query optimization
• Advanced knowledge of RDBMS such as OLTP & OLAP systems, especially SQL server; good at utilizing SSAS, SSIS or SSAS
• Solid analytical and problem-solving skills for troubleshooting database related issues
• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
• Excellent in creating visually dynamic presentations to demonstrate before and after results
• Ability to understand business problems and articulate a corresponding solution
• Ability to manage mission critical or highly available platforms or applications
• Proactive team player with a can-do attitude.
• Experience in Agile methodology is a plus.

• Able to learn new technologies
• Insurance domain experience preferred

title: MySQL Database Administrator
description:
We are a remarkable company in remarkable times. Our business includes software and Lobster Marketing, together comprising a SaaS platform providing end-to-end office management software for field service providers in markets such as pest, pool, and lawn. Lobster Marketing adds market-facing web sites, buy online capability, dashboarding, and digital marketing services. Founded in 2012. Forbes just named us on their list of "2020 Best Start-up Employers" based on employee enthusiasm, fast growth, and financial strength. In January 2020, we joined the portfolio of Gryphon Investors and have outstanding financial support.
 On the software development team, code is released daily to tens of thousands of field service staff around the country (our customers service about 4% of homes in America)-the code you write in the morning could be deployed to thousands of users the same day. Our office software runs on a LAMP stack deployed across self-hosted cloud servers running the same codebase, and our app uses React Native with a continuous integration solution for a clean, build-less release process.
  There are lots of differently shaped problems to take on and we are looking for engineers who like challenges, are good problem solvers, and can build on an existing framework to optimize for scale. Whether you're interested in front-end user experience, mobile app development, query optimization, dev-ops, application security, or something else entirely, you'll be able to find your place.
•Provision MySQL instances, both in clustered and non-clustered configurations
•Ensure performance, security, and availability of databases
•Prepare documentation and specifications
•Handle common database procedures, such as upgrade, backup, recovery, migration, etc.
•Profile server resource usage, optimize and tweak as necessary
•Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders
•Identify or create tools to detect and remedy data integrity/corruption issues 
The essential functions of this role include:
•working in a smoke free environment
•Experience level: Experienced
•Minimum 8 years of experience
•Education: Bachelors
•MySQL (5 years of experience is required)
•SQL Database admin (3 years of experience is required)
•Redis (1 year of experience is required)
