title: DB2 z/OS Mainframe DBA
description:
DB2 z/OS Mainframe DBA Roles and Responsibilities:
 
Database Design Reviews
 
Description:  Review database design proposals and provide evaluation and alternatives.  Confirm that the design is functionally feasible. Establish and confirm user expectations in terms of responsiveness, performance, and capacity.  Provide a forum for technical discussion.  Identify areas of further investigation.
 
Measurement: Schedule meetings and perform the design reviews.  Provide written summaries, communications and collaborate on all enhancements.
 
 
 
Logical / Physical Database Design
 
Description: Translate detailed requirements specified by the business and application developers into physical objects in a database.  Develop logical models in coordination with application developer's needs as new corporate projects are approved for implementation.  Design databases, tables, primary keys, logical relationships.  Evolve existing models as new requirements develop and enhancements are requested.  Create objects according to internal standards including standardized attribute names.
 
Measurement:  Create schema definitions and alterations.  Adhere to standards.
 
 
 
Developer Support / SQL Code Review
 
Description: Review all new and updated SQL prior to production implementation.  Generate EXPLAINs and analyze SQL statement cost assessments.  Review column matching for optimal index access and create or modify indexes when necessary.   Recommend SQL modifications and improvements when required.   Check SQL for SELECT vs CURSOR, ensure DCLGENs are correctly used.   Ensure error handling has been specified and error SQL codes are being checked according to standard programming practices.  Check for missing NULL indicators where applicable.  Explain SQL and review predicted costs for optimal index access.  Prepare production BIND and EXPLAIN JCL.
 
Measurement:  Ensure all SQL is being reviewed prior to production implementation.  Advise and mentor developers.
 
 
 
Physical Database Implementation - Development
 
Description:  Support the application development process by timely implementation of all database schema additions and or modifications in the development environment.  Create and or modify the following objects - databases, tablespaces, tables, primary keys, indexes, check constraints, RI constraints, partitioning schemes.  Support multiple prototypes when required and rapid implementation of schema change as the design is tested and evolves through iterations.  Develop prototypes of processes that will extract from production and re-load into dev such that these can be handed over to developers and run independently.
 
Measurement:  Assist developers.  Implement and maintain development schemas.  Document project milestones and completions
 
 
Performance & Tuning of the Application during Development
 
Description:  Support the application development process from a performance and tuning perspective.  Check SQL efficiency using predictive tools like EXPLAIN analysis.  Monitor SQL efficiency using operational tracing tools like Platinum Insight.  Coordinate with developers and perform measurements and tracing when necessary.  Ensure indexes that are appropriate have been created.  Provide recommendations for modification & improvement as needed.
 
Measurement:  Document performance of the developed applications.
 
 
Production Deployment Support
 
Description:  Create RFCs to deploy all schema changes in production including tablespaces, tables, primary key, indexes, constraints, RI, compression, and column additions.  Assign a CTASK to the ATOS DBA and transfer model DDL as guidance.  Coordinate timing of the change with respect to acceptable outage windows and represent the change to the Change Control Board.  Monitor ATOS progress and review all JCL and DDL for the schema changes.  Ensure a back out strategy is in place and be prepared to execute it.   Monitor the deployment and review the changes as they are made to ensure that the request has been successfully completed.  Provide timely communication on the status of the deployment. Monitor the change post-deployment for any abends or unexpected results. 
 
Measurement:  Create the RFCs, obtain all approvals, monitor deployment, and communicate status upon completion.
 
 
Distributed Access Support
 
Description:  Assist with and/or install, configure, implement, monitor, and maintain all distributed methods of connecting to the DB2 subsystem. Provide developers with connection details for distributed access.  Provide guidance for acquisition and use of RACF credentials.  Configure DB2 Connect Gateway, distribute the Client Connection software.  Install and configure the HIT Driver Type 4 JDBC driver.  Assist with debug and diagnose of remote connection issues including gather traces and interfacing with product vendor support interfaces where applicable.
 
Measurement:  Keep all distributed access mechanisms up to date with respect to version, release, modification levels.
 
 
 
Production Rationalization
 
Description:  Collaborate with developers and ATOS DBA with rationalization efforts to optimize the DB2 environment.  Identify long running processes that are inefficiently consuming DB2 resources.  Engage in subsystem performance and tuning efforts, query optimization, using performance monitors, SQL profilers and other related monitoring and troubleshooting tools.  Determine reasonable strategies for running RUNSTATS & reorgs on an as-required basis.  Collaborate on efficient and effective use of computing resources.
 
Measurement:  Optimize the production environment by reducing consumption of DB2 resources.
 
 
Backup / Recovery - Database Integrity
 
Description:  Collaborate with ATOS DBAs to ensure that all production data is secured and backed up by jobs that run on a scheduled basis.  Identify frequency and guaranteed recovery (quiesce) points.  Determine appropriate backup methodology, SHRLEVEL CHANGE (online updates permitted) or SHRLEVEL REFERENCE (read only).  Review grouped quiesce points to ensure consistent recovery of referentially related objects.
 
Measurement:  Review and update documentation that identifies all backup schedules and recovery procedures.
 
 
 
Problem Resolution - Development
 
Description:  Assist developers with diagnosis of database related issues including unexpected SQL codes, referential integrity violations, bind setup, consistency token errors, missing synonyms, missing grants, unavailable resource, deadlocks, timeouts, load utility failures, etc.
 
Measurement:  Respond to requests for assistance and track requests via emails.

description:
The Oracle Database Administrator is a highly skilled technical position that involves intricate knowledge of the Oracle database internals with both 12c, 18c and 19c versions.  On call support will be required.
Database installations, configuration, tuning, maintenance, patching, backup and recovery, problem diagnosis and resolution are all critical functions that the database administrator performs. 
1. Manage all aspects of the physical database including schema’s, DDL, users, security, etc. in development, UAT and production environments 
2. Identify and resolve problems occurring in all database environments including performance related issues (i.e. database & SQL tuning).
3. Perform database software installs, configurations, patches, upgrades, and migrations.
4. Support DBA utilities, reorgs, index builds, export/import and DBA tools (Oracle Enterprise Manager) 
5. Assist with performance and Disaster Recovery testing.
Hyperion administration support for versions 11.1.x which  includes 
1. Coordinate patching of Hyperion environments 
2. Perform security maintenance and user provisioning for Hyperion applications
3. Assist Hyperion application team with performance and tuning issues
4. Perform code promotion across Hyperion environments
5. Work with Oracle support to resolve critical service requests
6. Provide off-hours/on-call support
Minimum 5 years experience working with mission critical Oracle 11g/12c databases in a high profile type of organization.
Minimum 5 years experience in the following areas: Database configuration, tuning, maintenance, patching, upgrades and problem diagnosis and resolution.
-Oracle RAC and RAC One Node
-Oracle RMAN
-Oracle Data Guard
-Oracle Golden Gate
-Enterprise Manager
-Disaster Recovery implementation and testing
- Experience with Hyperion Administration including:
     - Patching of Hyperion environments
     - Security maintenance and user provisioning
     - Perform code promotions
     - Cycling Hyperion services (Unix and Windows)
     - Perform application tuning and monitoring
- Experience in Linux, AIX, and Solaris platforms. 
- Experience with Shell scripting
- Experience with automation tools (Ansible, Puppet, Chef)
Minimum Bachelor's degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering or related field
Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.
We offer a diverse work experience that empowers colleagues for career success. In addition to skill and experience, we also seek to attract and retain colleagues whose beliefs and behaviors are in alignment with our core values of collaboration, innovation, caring, integrity and accountability.
CVS Health is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.  Gender/Ethnicity/Disability/Protected Veteran – we highly value and are committed to all forms of diversity in the workplace. title: Remote Oracle DBA
description:
Apex Systems, the nation’s 2nd largest Information Technology Staffing organization, has an opening for a Remote Oracle Database Admin to work within one of our large clients in the San Diego area. This position is a contract-to-hire role.
Please send your resume to Lindsay Maynard at lmaynard@apexsystems.com if you're interested in learning more about this role.
Senior Oracle Database Administrator – Including Data Warehouse Support
This Senior Oracle DBA will join an experienced and customer driven Database team to deliver excellent Database Administration services in support of production, development, and test database systems in a 24x7 mission critical environment.
The position is open to US Citizens or Green Card Holders.
We are looking for a highly motivated self-starter Senior Oracle DBA professional. Desired candidate must have excellent interpersonal, communication, problem solving and analytical skills. In addition, this individual will be expected to perform at an extremely high level with little learning curve and must thrive under pressure while enjoying working in a collaborative team environment.
• 6+ years of professional Oracle DBA support for installations on Oracle database versions 12c/19c and a Bachelor of Arts/Science or equivalent degree in Computer Science or related area of study. Without a degree, four additional years of relevant professional experience (10+ years in total).
• Able to provide all levels of application database support including off-hours on a rotating basis
• Able to discuss (within own area of expertise) requirements with customers, and to challenge and clarify when appropriate. From the requirements, able to develop a high-level design or plan, and then estimate the amount of effort required to deliver on time and budget
• Works collaboratively with other teams including Project Managers, Developers, and Architects to ensure project success
• Ability to communicate proactively to management any potential issues that may hinder the ability to meet project deadlines
• Excellent professionalism, communication, and interpersonal skills.
• Proficiency in setting up, configuring, and operationally supporting Oracle 12c/19c ASM, Oracle RAC, Data Guard, Partitioning, Golden Gate, Exadata, and Oracle Enterprise Manager
• Recent experience supporting Data Warehouse installations.
• Skilled with High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for Oracle
• Experience in Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
• Experience with backups, restores and recovery models including RMAN, hot and cold backups
• Experience in implementing operational automation using scripts
• Knowledge of indexes, index management, and statistics
• Must have excellent troubleshooting skills
• Extensive PL/SQL and UNIX shell scripting skills
• Well versed monitoring databases using OEM and custom scripts
• DBA support in WINTEL, UNIX, HP-UX, and Linux operating environments
• Monitor database security alerts for new vulnerabilities and remediation
• Manage the currency and security of technology platforms through the timely application of system patches and upgrades to software versions
• SQL and relational DBMS knowledge, including data modeling and ERD.
• Knowledge in providing analysis and support for ETL load and performance tuning/testing, including the writing and tuning of complex queries using SQL.
• Oracle 11g or higher DBA certification is highly desirable.

title: Database Administration Manager
description:
Database Administration Manager
 
The Manager of Database Administration is a member of the Enterprise Data Services team and reports to the Director of that unit. The position has responsibility for directing the efforts of the database administrators within that group. Responsibilities include oversight and administration of the Universities database platforms both on premise and in the cloud.
Details of responsibility include but are not limited to knowledge and expertise with Oracle, MySQL, MSSQL, and relational database concepts as well as Cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure or GCP. The manager should have sufficient expertise to be an effective owner of tasks related to the integration of local, cloud or hosted services (PaaS, IaaS), monitoring, analysis, security and application tools. This person is responsible for identifying security vulnerabilities and must understand how to communicate effectively to the team in order to remediate any threats. The Manager must be able to produce clear documentation of the systems being managed for all levels of leadership (peer through executive).
Security of data is the most critical aspect of this position, thus the candidate must be well versed in database security measures, literature and other sources for information regarding securing data.
This position is integral to the strategic planning and priority setting for the Division of Information Technology and the campus enterprise strategic initiatives. The manager oversees projects to successful completion, ensuring prompt customer service, staff management and staff skill development. The position includes responsibility for instituting the appropriate security controls, processes, and best practices to ensure compliance with State and University System audit requirements. The Manager must be able to communicate clearly both orally and in writing and must be a strong leader.
 
this position does not provide sponsorship for Visas.
  on call 24×7×365. Occasional lifting and transporting of computer hardware; availability to work weekends and holidays when necessary.

title: Application Administrator
description:
Trinisys is looking for an Application Administrator to join our fast growing team.  The Application Administrator will setup, install, upgrade and support Trinisys customer environments to ensure the smooth operation and performance of Convergence and ClearView systems in order to provide maximum performance and availability for users, customers and Trinisys Professional Services.
An Inc. 500 award winning company, Trinisys revolutionizes the way businesses collect and process information. Clients have drastically reduced the time and cost involved in acquiring data from paper and the web with Trinisys’ innovative data capture software. The Trinisys Integration Engine enables companies to automate complex business processes and get data to the systems they use every day.
Here’s your opportunity to be a part of a growing company that values individuals and their contributions. The Trinisys team is a tightly-knit, collaborative group of creative, enthusiastic and thoughtful people. Trinisys offers an impressive benefits package, great flexibility and an amazing working environment.
Being part of an expanding company recognized nationally for its growth by Inc. 500, Best Place to Work by the Nashville Business Journal & Company of the Year by the Nashville Technology Council. Sharpening your skills as a member of one of the most talented organizations in Nashville. Working in a laid-back, collaborative and fun environment. Unmatched benefits including health/dental/vision, disability and life insurance plus a 401k with a company contribution and much more!

title: Sr Compensation Analyst
description:
PenFed is continuing to hire and train exceptional individuals to help us serve our 2 million members both here and around the world.  In light of the current situation with novel coronavirus (COVID-19), we have modified our hiring, onboarding, training, and deployment protocols in order to comply with current local and state guidance around social distancing.
PenFed is committed to the safety of our teammates around the globe.  If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to us for more information.
 
PenFed Credit Union is hiring a Senior Compensation Analyst in Mclean, Virginia. The primary purpose of this job is to provide technical and analytical support to the design, implementation and maintenance of compensation programs at PenFed to ensure they are market competitive and align to PenFed’s strategy. This position will partner with HR Business Partners in consulting directly with managers and employees in both written and oral form on compensation strategies, tactics and methodologies.

*Most roles require working in an office setting with moderate noise and the ability to lift 25 pounds.*
 
Ability to travel to various worksites and be on-call may be required.
 
Established in 1935, PenFed today is one of the country’s strongest and most stable financial institutions with over 2 million members and over $25 billion in assets. We serve members in all 50 states and the District of Columbia, as well as in Guam, Puerto Rico, and Okinawa. We are federally insured by NCUA and we are an Equal Housing Lender. We are available to members worldwide, via the web, seven days a week, twenty-four hours a day.
Our mission isn’t simply to help our members get by. We exist to help them realize every ounce of their potential. We exist to educate, and to encourage. We exist to usher their dreams into the land of reality.
We provide our employees with a lucrative benefits package including robust medical, dental and vision plan options, plenty of paid time off, 401k with employer match, on-site fitness facilities at our larger locations, and more.

title: Cloud Security Engineer - work for a philanthropic company!
description:
If you are a Cloud Security Engineer with experience, please read on!
The Cloud Security Engineer is responsible for analyzing the security of web
applications and services, discovering and correcting security issues, and quickly
reacting to new threats. The successful Cloud Security Engineer has hands-on
expertise in many disparate technologies, ideally ranging from front-end user
interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between. The Cloud
Security Engineer is expected to constantly improve the security posture of our
fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment. The ideal candidate will be
knowledgeable in many domains of endpoint security and is willing to teach (and
learn from) anyone at the company. The cloud security engineer works closely
with development teams, relevant functional operations teams, network
engineers, database administrators, technology vendors and partners to ensure
the highest level of security.
? Conduct regular infrastructure audits, vulnerability assessments,
penetrations tests.
? Participate in security initiatives from brainstorming sessions to
implementation.
? Maintain, update and create policies and implement procedures and
technologies to achieve and maintain PCI compliance.
? Participate in post-mortem investigation of security incidents and prepare
incident reports documenting the findings.
? Work with cross-functional teams to incrementally improve systems,
network and application security.
? Security Review of Third Party Service Providers before onboarding
? Proactively review, recommend, and implement changes to the live
infrastructure after ensuring the right validation has been carried out.
? Keeping informed of emerging solutions to help mitigate security
vulnerabilities.
? Security Trainings.
? Security Tasks as assigned.
? Perform 24/7 on-call duties.
? 4+ years of experience in securing cloud infrastructures in AWS
? Experience in information security including experience with security
principles and techniques
? 3+ years of experience in networking technologies including TCP/IP, DNS,
DHCP, LAN/WAN, VPN, LDAP/Radius, wireless networking, routing,
switching, firewalls, IPv4/v6, and administration of routers and switches
? Knowledge of IDS/IPS, HIDS/HIPS, FIM, SIEM, Web Application Firewalls
? Knowledge of native AWS services and tools.
? Knowledge of vulnerability assessment, scanning and pen testing tools
? Knowledge in firewall configuration, management, and hardening
? Experience in a 24/7 high-traffic SaaS environments
? Experience in cyber threat and vulnerability analysis and remediation
? Experience with PCI or HIPAA compliance in an E-Commerce
environment
? Experience with software application security best practices (e.g. OWASP,
CWE/SANS)
? Familiarity with CI/CD platforms, Version Control Systems
? Knowledge of monitoring systems
? Strong working knowledge of Linux
? Scripting skills (Bash, Python, and Ruby preferred)
? Software development experience (Java, PHP, and Python preferred)
? BS in Computer Science, Information Systems Security, or equivalent
? Strong verbal and written communication skills
- Up to 2 days remote!
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Bonus
- 401k
So, if you are a Cloud Security Engineer with experience, please apply today!

title: Mongo DBA
description:
Job responsibilities of the position include :
*   Participate in the design, implementation and support of MongoDB databases and distributed systems in a client/server environment
*   Provide technical leadership for MongoDB related initiatives, database administration and maintenance activities
*   Installing, configuring and maintaining multiple MongoDB instances
*   Administer MongoDB Ops Manager, backups and automation.
*   Automate routine tasks with shell scripts and industry standard tools like Ansible
*   Participate in 24x7 on call support rotation
*   Manage mongo DB in AWS EC2 environment.
*   Work with Developers/Users to resolve data conflicts and inappropriate data usage
*   Implementation and support of HA Clustering/replica sets
*   Performance analysis tools related to KPI's like database storage I/O, CPU, Memory and TPS
*   Database reporting, Job Scheduling, routine MongoDB maintenance
*   Understanding of MongoDB database security access and authentication (LDAP and Active Directory)
*   Understanding of Operating System Technologies, mainly RedHat Linux
*   Upgrade and apply security patch across environmental lifecycle Dev - Prod.
*   Experience and troubleshooting some of the features like Sharding and Encryption.
*   Using Compass for remote connectivity.
*   Experience in hosting shared MongoDB instance in single server.

*   Experience and troubleshooting some of the features like Sharding and Encryption.
*   Using Compass for remote connectivity.

title: Certified Forklift Driver
description:
Job Purpose:
Controls warehouse inventory by coordinating movement of product from production to warehouse to shipping.
Duties:
* Picks-up product by monitoring production; loading and moving product.
* Stores product by designating storage areas; adjusting storage areas according to production and shipping requirements; updating location database.
* Prepares product for shipment by verifying location; directing movement to staging area; resolving problems.
* Verifies product inventory reports by comparing logs and reports; adjusting entries.
* Documents actions by completing forms, reports, logs, and records; maintaining databases.
* Monitors inventory by completing counts as required.
* Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities.
* Accomplishes distribution and organization mission by completing related results as needed.

Teamwork, Coordination, Organization, Planning, Time Management, Reporting Skills, Inventory Control, Documentation Skills, Data Entry Skills, Dependability, Supervision

title: Inventory Control Asst. II
description:
A career with CAES is more than just a job; it is the pathway to a bright future.
 
 Are you searching for a career with a company that offers challenging, diverse projects and opportunities? Are you looking for a position with a company that is growing and able to offer long-term professional advancement? Searching for a company that values a friendly work environment and that values YOU? Then look no further!! Consider Cobham.  #peoplefocusedmissiondriven #everymissionmatters
 
 We are Cobham Advanced Electronic Solutions (CAES), a technologically advanced electronics company employing more than 3,600 talented makers, thinkers, innovators, and doers nationwide. We build things that solve challenging problems from deep space to the depths of the ocean. We serve customers in spanning defense, aerospace, security, medical, and industrial markets.
 
 Cobham is seeking an Inventory Control Assistant II. The Inventory Control Assistant II monitors and maintains inventory, researches problems and tracks orders, records purchases, maintains databases, and performs physical count of inventory. This position may prepare statistical reports on inventory balance, prices and shortages. Receives, unloads and distributes goods. Processes and/or approves invoices for payment. Documents and processes returns. 
 
 
 Receives, stores, delivers, kits, moves, reports progress and inventories of materials and supplies.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Founded in 1934 by aviation innovator Sir Alan Cobham, our values of Trust, Talent and Technology have driven us to become a global leader in state-of-the-art aerospace and defense systems. It's the insights of our innovators today that will secure our collective future. Innovators like you!
 
 If you are authorized to work in the United States, then we encourage you to apply. We are unable to sponsor work visas. U.S. Citizenship required for positions requiring a Security Clearance.
 
 Cobham is one of the world's leading companies engaged in the development, delivery and support of leading-edge aerospace and defense systems in the air, on land and at sea. Our clients and partners trust Cobham to deliver the mission-critical technology they need, and we trust our employees to draw on their ingenuity and passion to deliver those solutions. This leads to an empowering culture for our people. Our Leadership team is open, sharing plans for the next five years, driving retention by offering demanding, exciting work, and providing full guidance and mentoring.
 
 
 
 Cobham is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Cobham to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information. description:
The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. title: Sr. Admin Associate
description:
Requisition ID:  60443  
Job Function/Category:  Engineering  
Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time  
 
 
Perform various routine/non-routine administrative functions for the Engineering Department.
 
•Assist managers and supervisors on individual projects or special assignments. •Maintaining and updating databases, personnel records, calendar and payroll records. •Compile, organize and type correspondence, forms and reports. •Answer telephone, direct callers and provide information as required. •Review SAP/CATS time entry reports for unapproved time and accurate cost assignments. •Coordination of engineering duty contact list, phone list, and organizational charts. Maintain controlled documents, order stationery supplies, process expense sheets. •Perform administrative coordination of various meeting bodies including writing meeting minutes. Attention to detail, customer/client focused and flexibility/adaptability essential.  
 
Senior Administrative Associate for Hope Creek Engineering - Perform various routine/non-routine administrative functions for the Hope Creek Engineering Director and Department. Responsibilities include assisting the Director, Sr. Manager and Branch Managers with individual projects or special assignments as needed. Maintain and update databases, personnel records, calendar, payroll records, Empower, and FMS. Compile, organize and type correspondence, forms and reports. Answer telephones, direct callers and provide information as required. Review SAP/CATS time entry reports for time approval and accurate cost assignments and attendance tracking. Coordination of contact lists (both internal and external), organizational charts, and department roster. Maintain controlled documents, order and maintain office supplies, process expense sheets and travel requests and reports. Perform administrative coordination of various meetings to include assembly of meeting packages and support information, and writing meeting minutes which require close coordination with the Department Training Coordinator and Human Resources personnel. Organize meetings, schedule, and required travel for the Director and Sr. Manager. Compile and assemble information/data/presentations for various meetings and external stakeholder visits. Essential attributes: Attention to detail, customer/client focused, flexibility/adaptability, able to support refueling and mid-cycle outage schedules, and excellent verbal and written communication skills,
 
HS diploma or equivalent. Proficient in SAP, Empower, FMS, and Microsoft Applications to include Word, Excel, Access, Publisher, and Power Point. SAP proficiency must include work management modules, payroll, and in creating / processing notifications and corrective action program documents. 2+ years experience as an Administrative Associate. Must meet Nuclear's requirements for unescorted access and fulfill an Emergency Response Organizational position.
2+ years experience as an Administrative Associate at PSEG Nuclear. Business Administration or Secretarial Science Degree and/or College Level business or secretarial courses.

title: OCONUS Senior Satcom Engineer (AEHF)
description:
Comtech’s Command & Control Technologies Government Services Division is currently seeking an experienced Advanced Extremely High Frequency (AEHF) Senior Satellite Communications (SATCOM) for a new and exciting effort located in Belgium.  Applicants should be well versed with the advanced engineering and administration of AEHF SATCOM systems and associated networks. In addition, the candidate will support any sub-1m to 9m antenna systems. Candidate will work as part of a team and must display a rigorous work ethic and possess the initiative and independent thinking to thrive in a dynamic environment.
At our core, Comtech employees are driven by innovation. We are leaders in the advanced global commercial and government communications market. A career at Comtech enables you to design, develop, produce, and market innovative products, systems and services for advanced communications solutions. You will facilitate and enhance the way people, businesses, and governments communicate around the world.
Comtech Command & Control Technologies is a leading provider of mission critical solutions to government and civilian agencies with a focus on C4ISR solutions using any type of network, whether mobile, fixed, static, terrestrial, marine, airborne or in space.  In order to help our customers, combat a growing number of cyber-attacks on their systems, we provide training and certification and vulnerability compliance assessment.  Comtech designs, develops, produces, and markets innovative products, systems and services for advanced communications solutions.  We are technology leaders in the markets that we serve and conduct our business through Government solutions.  Our market segments consist of: Tactical Communications, Space & Component Technology, Mobile Datacom, and Cyber Security Solutions.
This position be responsible for designing, installing, maintaining, and supporting LAN, WAN and VoIP infrastructures. Provide high-level technical support for voice and data network systems, creates, and maintains network documentation, maintains hardware and software standards, and works projects as needed in order to upgrade to new and/or improved communication equipment and procedures.
This position will perform the following tasks:
Minimum of ten (10) years of experience in support of installations, repair, troubleshooting or maintenance of satellite communications electronic systems or equipment.
Minimum of ten (10) years of experience operating in a tactical satellite environment operating/maintaining antenna controllers, SSPA, LNA/LNB, up and down converters, Fiber optic/Coax/Ethernet Cable, Frequency Division Multiple Access (FDMA) and Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA) modems (satellite modems) and Modem Hub operations.
Prior DoD/Military experience operating and maintaining Secure Mobile Anti-Jam Reliable Tactical Terminals (SMART-T) and Single Channel Anti Jam Man Portable (SCAMP)
Familiarity with EHF Constellation (Milstar and AEHF)
Bachelor’s degree in related field, preferred
In lieu of a bachelor’s degree in related field, candidate must meet either of the following:
Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Comtech offers a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits and flexible paid time off options, for eligible employees:

title: Project Assistant
description:
Policy Research, Inc. (PRI) is seeking a full-time Project Assistant to support multiple projects. The primary project would be the newly funded five-year SAMHSA grant to operate the Homeless and Housing Resource Center (HHRC). PRI is a small, woman-owned, not-for-profit corporation located in upstate New York and incorporated in 1995.  PRI and its sister company, Policy Research Associates, conduct behavioral health services research and provide technical assistance. We are recognized leaders in the behavioral health field and have the capacity to provide a broad range of services and to administer large-scale projects including other large technical assistance centers.
Our researchers, training and technical assistance providers, and support personnel are known for their expertise in the overlap of mental health and the areas of behavioral health/addictions, criminal and juvenile justice, homelessness, recovery supports, accessing benefits, veterans, and issues pertaining to family members and consumers. We are proud of the diversity of our employees’ experience and expertise and our proven performance record.
The Project Assistant will support PRI projects in the areas of homelessness and criminal justice, as well as others as needed. They will provide support to PRI staff and consultants with responsibilities including, but not limited to:
Salary level of position is commensurate with candidate experience. 
 
, and offers competitive salary and excellent benefits package, including medical, dental and vision care, 401k and employer-contributed retirement, student loan assistance, tuition reimbursement, wellness programs and casual work attire. title: Data Architect III/Dashboard Developer
description:
Ke`aki Technologies is looking for qualified Data Architect III / Dashboard Developer to support the Defense Health Agency (DHA) contract by providing 24/7 expertise in the areas of Data Architecture, Information Architecture, and Dashboard Development. 
 
    
  
Develop scope and understand technical requirements with input from stakeholders. 
Collaborate with designers to develop interface functionality. 
Present concise stages of interface design development to stakeholders. 
Develop software requirements specification documents for applications on DHA servers. 
Design and maintain SAS BI web reporting pages, portals and all other related applications. 
Support the following SAS Software, BI (BI) capabilities on: 
DHA servers, portals and dashboards 
Interactive business visualization 
Web-based reporting and authoring 
Advanced data exploration 
Microsoft Office integration 
Guided analysis 
Centralized metadata management 
Quality Indicators through up-to-date SAS codes provided by AHRQ and generate required tables and charts 
Develop, implement, administer and maintain policies and procedures to ensure the integrity of DHA Analytics databases, data marts, software programs and hardware systems. 
Follow all DHA/MHS protocols and procedures and obtain appropriate and required access and approval to develop/implement/maintain and administer data/databases within the DHA/MHS environments. 
Optimize and support data warehousing components, analytical cubes, stored procedures and complex SQL queries to support dashboards and reports. 
Develop process and queries to support recurring reports/requests. 
Identify and communicate database requirements in support of DHA Analytics initiatives and implement upgrades of hardware and software as necessary to enhance database performance. 
Implement data models, database designs and data access business rules to ensure that analysts, data miners and developers can utilize data effectively. 
Monitor database, operating system and user activities and perform database maintenance to include removal/archiving of obsolete data.
    
  
Three (3) years’ experience in project management of Information Systems projects. 
Three (3) years’ experience in business analysis. • Three (3) years’ experience in development of technical requirements in interactive media design. 
Three (3) years’ experience in development of product support documents. 
Three (3) years’ experience in development of requirements in interactive media design. 
Three (3) years’ experience in workflow development and documentation of workflow processes. 
Three (3) years’ experience in data visualization/information architecture. 
Three (3) years’ experience working with MHS Clinical Data. 
Three (3) years’ experience working with SQL, relational databases and their management systems. 
Two (2) years’ experience developing, testing and maintaining BI products (Tableau/Tableau Creator, Qlik, SSRS) 
Proficiency in SharePoint or related services. 
Prior experience developing databases and/or dashboards using Tableau/Tableau Creator software. 
Web Services data call skills required
Webmaster skills are highly desirable. 
Three (3) years’ experience using the following software (latest version), Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Office, Microsoft BI Stack, and SAS BI Software or similar. 
Proven ability to synthesize disparate facts from multiple sources and coalesce into an accurate and useful analytic product, incorporating Service and MHS strategic goals for use by leadership in both tactical and strategic decision making. 
Demonstrated ability to provide accurate and timely analytical products containing well-reasoned and cogent discussion points providing leadership with substantiated options or courses of action. 
Demonstrated ability to organize/participate/lead working groups to develop analytic products and byproducts or to develop/understand processes leading to effective optimization of analytic efforts. 
Demonstrated ability to effectively and clearly communicate analytical discoveries and appropriate recommendations/mitigation strategies to all levels of customers including Senior DHA leadership. 
Demonstrated advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products PLUS additional software/hardware skills and capabilities. 
Ability to critically examine and evaluate, problem-solve. • Demonstrated ability to undertake and complete multiple tasks with multiple deadlines simultaneously.
Ability to deliver products on time, on schedule, within budget. 
Flexibility and ability to adapt to rapidly changing and often time-constrained environment. 
Ability to acquire skills/capabilities necessary to meet growing needs/demands of systems/software/hardware.
    
  
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Biostatistics, Informatics, Mathematics or similar/related field. 
Other significant related public/population health experience such as previous participation in a data analytics/informatics fellowship may be considered as an appropriate substitute for education.
    
  
Ke`aki Technologies LLC is a fast-growing government service provider. Employees enjoy competitive salaries; a 401K plan with company match; medical, dental, disability, and life insurance coverage; tuition reimbursement; paid vacation and sick time; and 10 paid holidays. title: Parts Manager
description:
Parts Manager

We are currently seeking an experienced Parts Manager to join our team in Westbury, NY.

About us:
Aero is a leading snow removal company and an innovator in snow melting performing commercial snow removal/melting in major airports, cities, municipalities, shopping malls, sports complexes, shipping terminals and commercial sites for more than 30 years.  In addition, through its other lines of business and brands including American Sweeping, Dejana Industries and Spartan Paving, Aero performs street sweeping and catch basin cleaning services, solid waste management and recycling as well as paving and paving services for commercial businesses and municipalities.

About the role:
The Parts Manager forecasts Company goals and objectives for the Parts Department and strives to meet them. 

What you’ll do:
* Working with the Service Manager to ensure timely turnaround of parts needed for internal jobs. 
* Prepare and administer cost savings budget for the parts department.
* Understand and comply with all federal, state and local regulations that may affect parts sales. 
* Hire, train, motivate and mentor performance of all parts staff. Provide technical assistance to all direct reports. 
* Monitor and maintain parts department inventory adjustments to minimize shortages and cost, and any other duties that may be assigned by management. 
* Monitor and maintain parts departments productivity and payroll records. 
* Must be able to work 24/7 during snow events, have a valid driver's license and be able to obtain an airport ID. 

Our ideal candidate:
* 5+ years of progressive Parts Management experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. 
* Experience with database management. 
* Experience with creative development. 
* Periodic travel either locally or nationally may be required. 
* Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills. 
* Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning). 
* Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization and lines of business, as well as, internal and external clients. 
* Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment. 
* Ability to work with and influence peers including the senior leadership team. 
* Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting. 
* High degree of proficiency with MS Excel, Outlook & Internet applications. 
* Must possess a competitive spirit and mindset. 

What we offer:
* Competitive salary; commensurate with experience
* Benefits package includes: Medical benefits, 401K, PTO, Short term & Longterm Disability, Accidental Death & Dismemberment
* The opportunity to grow with a company as they grow

Aero Operating LLC ("Aero") is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Web Developer
description:
Spectra Tech is searching for a Developer to support a project for six months.  The Developer will support the current staff of twenty full time employees, made up of designers, developers, and product owners, work in teams of one to six and apply Agile methodologies to incrementally deliver fixes and features to our catalog of applications.  We are in need of developer assistance to support a surge of work.  The Developer will work as a part of a Scrum team to develop complex database applications for administrative and research projects. Participate in team meetings to continually improve the development process.
 
The Developer must have 5 or more years of experience developing web-based database applications with 2 years solid development experience using Microsoft .NET technology and 2 years of experience developing SQL Server databases. All applications use .NET, MVC, Entity Framework, and jQuery so proficiency in these is required.  Experience using web APIs for interface with other applications is preferred.  Code writing, peer review of code, testing/QA, and participation in team meetings are all required aspects of this position.
 
Work will likely be conducted remotely due to COVID-19 considerations but some in-person meetings at the Oak Ridge office may be required if conditions become suitable.
Spectra Tech, Inc. is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce.  We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer.  It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.  We are also an E-verify employer.

title: Brentwood Branch Service Representative
description:
More than 30 years ago, E*TRADE pioneered the online brokerage industry by executing the first-ever electronic individual investor trade. While the landscape of our industry has changed dramatically, our culture of innovation and drive to make online trading accessible to everyone continues to drive us forward. We believe in challenging the status quo, fostering an environment of curiosity and learning, and, above all, putting our customers first.
The Branch Service Representative utilizes excellent customer service and problem solving skills to confidently provide information and education to E*TRADE FINANCIALs customers in a timely, efficient, professional manner. The Branch Services Representative position serves as one of the first points of branch contact for walk in customers and prospects. This position will be responsible for initiating customer relationships through walk-ins and phone contacts. This position will be required to greet clients, handle customer service inquiries, direct clients to the appropriate channels, process checks and assist with documents.
RESPONSIBILITIES
â- Responsible for providing customer service and assistance to walk-in customers while managing the front reception daily, as assigned.
â- Provide direction to new customers by being responsive to their needs, inquiries and requests.
â- Address routine and non-routine inquiries from customers and prospects.
â- Oversee resolution of service issues as needed.
â- Develop service to sales opportunities for Financial Consultants in the branch.
â- Proactive inbound/outbound sales.
â- Seek referral opportunities and follow up on leads.
â- Partner with Financial Consultant on complex client/prospect business opportunity.
â- Participate in execution of local marketing development plan.
â- Sales skills including product knowledge, presenting multiple options and proactive outbound calling efforts, ability to compare and contrast investments.
â- Interacts with internal cross-functional partners to resolve client issues and escalations (Research & Resolution, Operations and Retirement and Tax).
REQUIREMENTS
BUSINESS REQUIREMENTS
â- 1-Year+ customer service experience, or 1-year call center experience, or equivalent combination
â- Bachelor's Degree (Finance, Business Management/Administration/Business related discipline strongly preferred) or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. (1 year of work experience can substitute 1 year of education)
â- Series 7 and 63 licenses, if not already held, must be obtained within 90 days of hire.
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS
â- Integrity and the ability to handle sensitive information and maintain confidentiality
â- Excellent listening, written, and verbal communication skills
â- Effective conflict resolution and problem solving skills
â- Approachable, flexible, dependable, and conscientiousness
â- Demonstrates self-confidence and the ability to maintain composure in difficult situations
â- Basic understanding of relationships created by diverse customer and employee groups.
â- Proactive and anticipates situations, develops proposals, and positive solutions.
â- Appropriately identifies when to seek assistance or escalate.
â- Ability to set and achieve goals, and work independently.
â- Capacity to learn new skills and knowledge on an independent level to enhance personal development and achieve career goals.
â- Demonstrated PC skills including familiarity with word processing, MS Office, spreadsheets and database management.
â- 4-Year Degree preferably in Finance, Business Management/Administration, or related field.
â- Experience in the Financial Services industry, including banking and business management.
We offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Please visit https://www.etradecareers.com/why-work-at-etrade/employee-benefits/ to learn more about the opportunities.

title: Purchase Coordinator
description:

Under general direction, reviews and places orders received from various inputs (email, phone, etc.). Sources and expedites orders to meet operation and organizational needs. Adheres to Johnson Controls purchasing standards. Maintains related records.

·       Receive requests for materials via email, decide if the request should generate a transfer vs. ordering, and prepare purchase requisitions to support our service organization

title: Configuration Data Management Specialist
description:
There are two elements associated with this job description: Configuration Management and Data Management.  Data Management involves interpreting contracts and determining programmatic and technical data needed during a product’s life cycle. Configuration Management involves applying and implementing the five elements of configuration management; CM Planning, Configuration Identification, Configuration Control, Configuration Status Accounting, and Configuration Verification and Audit for each program here at KUAS.
 
 
Data Management
Determines the contract requirements regarding the management and delivery of all contractual data deliverables.
Analyzes contract requirements to determine if current data management needs to be modified; recommends changes/new procedures to management and implements approved changes.
Verifies that the data item deliverable requirements are met and comply with contractual data requirement specifications and schedule requirements. 
Trains data item owners on data item contractual requirements.
When required by contract, maintains the Data Accession List (DAL) and library of KUAS/Kratos internal data which has been generated in compliance with the work effort described in the Statement of Work (SOW).
Assesses the data deliverable schedules and identifies impact to future deliveries.
Supports the Configuration/Data Manager, as needed.
Delivers scheduled data deliverable packages in accordance with each customer's requirements. Records and maintains configuration and data management records, as required.
Performs data management audits, analyzes findings and prepares reports as required.
Prepares reports for internal and external customers on configuration and data management activities, including formal Configuration Status Accounting reports to support a product's final configuration.
 
Configuration Management
Works in a government/contractor team environment to establish and execute a configuration management program for multiple systems/programs in various stages of design, development or operations.
Supports configuration management, data management, and planning efforts required to final delivery to the customer of assigned programs.
Contributes to the development, documentation, and incorporation of design and product changes.
Monitors the incorporation of configuration change items.
Maintains configuration control databases and provides status accounting of engineering changes to IPTs and program management.
Performs ‘As designed/As built’ reconciliation.
Establishes baseline identification of products through release of specifications, drawings, and requirements flow down.
Controls configuration of baselines through Configuration Control Boards.
Performs duties for both hardware and software.
Plans and/or facilitates internal/external configuration audits.
 
 None
Ability to maintain sensitive and confidential information as required by government standards
Ability to interact effectively with peers and supervisors
Ability to adhere to workplace rules
Ability to effectively communicate professionally in writing or verbally with all levels of personnel
Ability to gather detailed requirements from customers, when necessary
Demonstrated high level of proficiency to organize document content and data
Must be a strong team leader, good professional communicator, and be comfortable facilitating CCB meetings
Must have the ability to think analytically and draw logical conclusions while performing work assignments
Is required to obtain and maintain a U.S. security clearance at the appropriate level (requires U.S. Citizenship)
 
Configuration/Data Management activities
Jira/Confluence experience a plus
4 years directly related experience
 
Office environment
Ability to stand and sit for long periods of time
Ability to perform repetitive motion (keyboarding, 10-key, phones)
Ability to lift up to 25 pounds

title: Navy - RMF - Washington, DC
description:
Navy
Washington, DC
 Long term
 US Citizen with an Active TS Clearance
 
SONA Networks, LLC is 8(a) and Hub Zone certified small business that provides Infrastructure Solutions, Software Development, Cyber Security and Project Management services to federal, state, and local agencies. 
 
:
 
Naval Surface Warfare Center Carderock Division (NSWCCD) requires Risk Management Framework (RMF) services for the Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA) Enterprise. These services include the creation of RMF authorization packages, providing RMF maintenance services, and Navy Qualified Validator (NQV) support.  
This requirement requires a wide range of packages to be created and maintained using RMF.  This range is broken down into three categories, which are defined below:
- Category I - made up of Information Systems (IS) that consist of up to five operating systems, up to 10 servers, and up to 200 workstations
- Category II - made up of Information Systems (IS) that consist of six or more operating systems, 11 or more servers, and more than 200 workstations
- Category III - Inheritance Provider packages that are made up of no ISs.  They consist of physical, environmental, and procedural controls associated with ISs associated by type or location
The candidate shall be capable of creating RMF packages in all categories, provide RMF package maintenance on all RMF packages created, and provide NQV validator for all categories. Additionally, the candidate shall be capable for creating Platform Information Technology (PIT) and Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation (RDT&E) packages throughout the RMF process. PIT consists of computer resources, both hardware and software, that are physically part of, dedicated to, or essential to the mission performance of special-purpose systems.  It does not include general purpose systems. The candidate shall develop and update documents as required by Department of Defense (DOD), Department of Navy (DON), NAVSEA, and Navy Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Services (eMASS).  The candidate shall be capable of scanning for and applying remediation in accordance with the Defense Information Security Agency (DISA) Security Technical Implementation Guides, Security Requirements Guide, Security Readiness Reviews and generate DISA checklists and artifacts.  The candidate shall register new systems in the Vulnerability Remediation Asset Manager (VRAM) database, import ACAS scans and maintain the VRAM database for all ISs in accordance with DOD, DON, and NAVSEA.
-  Level III NQV validators, with active validator certifications 
-  Perform RMF package creation and NQV services
- Master Proficiency Level in Category Specialist Area 451 of the DON Cybersecurity Workforce Qualification Matrix of the SECNAV M-5239.2, Cyberspace Information Technology and Cybersecurity Workforce Management and Qualification Manual
 - Master Proficiency Level in Category Specialist Area 441 of the DON Cybersecurity Workforce Qualification Matrix of the SECNAV M-5239.2 
 
 
If interested, please contact hr@sonanetworks.com for more information.
 
We look forward to receiving your application!
 
SONA Networks, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
 
SONA Networks, LLC
Executive Plaza I, Suite 409
11350 McCormick Road
Hunt Valley, MD 21031-1044
Email: hr@sonanetworks.com 
Web: www.sonanetworks.com

description:
At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. We have built a foundation of high-trust by treating all people with dignity, making and keeping commitments, and consistently striving to do the right thing. Our leaders optimistically share future possibilities to inspire and motivate others toward their full potential. We expect our employees to find ways to embrace positive change, be curious and challenge the status quo, and provide solutions to unmet problems. #LI-JS1
 Our employees are collaborative, self-aware, and ethical. It is our expectation to do the right thing and follow through on commitments.

If you think this sounds like you, let’s chat. We would love to tell you more!
 
Delta Dental covers more Americans than any other dental benefits provider. As an employee you’ll take part in our mission to become the trusted health partner by collaborating with our communities and employees to reimagine and deliver new possibilities in an ever-changing environment. Our Enterprise Strategy focuses on pillars of Growth and Diversification, supported by the platforms of Culture and People, Process and Technology. Our employees take pride working for a purpose-driven organization and live our values of Trust, Service, Excellence and Innovation.
 
We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation’s largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.
 
Delta Dental provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.  20 to 25 hours per week.

  Resume by 5 PM on June 17th to Glenn Bailey, Crossroads Urban Center, 347 S. 400 East, SLC, 84111, glenn@crossroadsurbancenter.org.

title: QA Tester
description:
Job Purpose:
Evaluates software by planning and executing performance and functional tests.
Duties:
* Determines test objectives and standards by studying software requirements; writing test cycle plans, test cases, and test scripts.
* Meets test objectives by determining testing methods, cycles, phases, and conditions; setting up testing environment and equipment.
* Identifies software capability and reliability by conducting functional, system, and performance tests.
* Resolves testing problems by modifying testing methods during tests; conferring with management to revise test objectives and standards.
* Completes tests by training and directing testers.
* Maintains testing database by developing defect tracking and regression testing information requirements; designing information system; enters test outcomes; secures data.
* Reports test outcomes by collecting, analyzing, interpreting, summarizing, and displaying data; recommending software changes.
* Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.
* Maintains test environment by developing test environement; enforcing and complying with procedures, rules, and regulations.
* Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Skills/Qualifications:
Automated Testing, Developing Standards, Black Box Testing, White Box Testing, Reporting Research Results, Software Debugging, Software Testing, Software Quality Assurance Process, Attention to Detail, Process Improvement, C

title: Proposal Writer
description:
Proposal Writer 
ACCEL Corporation is agency which provides IT, administrative, financial services to various government and private agencies. ACCEL is looking for a Proposal writer that will manage the beginning and end of government contract proposal process to expand the contracts that ACCEL currently has 
Proposal Writer Job Responsibilities:
• Prepares proposals by determining concept, gathering and formatting information, writing drafts, and obtaining approvals.
• Determines proposal concept by identifying and clarifying opportunities and needs, studying requests for proposal (RFPs), and attending strategy meetings.
• Meets proposal deadline by establishing priorities and target dates for information gathering, writing, review, approval, and transmittal.
• Enters and monitors tracking data.
• Gathers proposal information by identifying sources of information, coordinating submissions and collections, and identifying and communicating risks associated with proposals.
• Develops proposal by assembling information including project nature, objectives/outcomes/deliverables, implementation, methods, timetable, staffing, budget, standards of performance, and evaluation.
• Writes, revises, and edits drafts including executive summaries, conclusions, and organization credentials.
• Prepares presentation by evaluating text, graphics, and binding and coordinating printing.
• Maintains quality results by using templates; following proposal-writing standards including readability, consistency, and tone; maintaining proposal support databases.
• Obtains approvals by reviewing proposal with key providers and project managers.
• Improves proposal-writing results by evaluating and re-designing processes, approach, coordination, and boilerplate.
Qualifications / Skills:
• Presentation skills
• Written communication
• Graphic design skills
• Technical documentation
• Layout skills
• Problem solving
• Deadline-oriented
• Process improvement
• Coordination
• Strategic planning
• Market knowledge
Education, Experience, and Licensing Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Media, or related field
• Minimum of 3-5 year experience in proposal writing, prospect research, general fundraising or a minimum of 2 years comparable and transferable skills acquired in a professional setting

title: Director of Information Technology
company: U.S. District Court and U.S. Probation Office EDNC
description:
The United States District Court and United States Probation Office for the Eastern District of North Carolina are seeking qualified applicants for a full-time Director of Information Technology (IT). This position is responsible for managing the consolidated Information Technology Department of the United States District Court and United States Probation Office. The combined agencies encompass ten locations with approximately 170 users.  The incumbent leads a team of technology professionals responsible for the planning, acquisition, application, operation, integration, security, documentation, and maintenance of all court systems; support and coordination of national programs; and support and training for judges and staff who use those systems. The systems include servers, networks, desktops, peripherals, telephones, digital office equipment, and audio-visual technology used for court operations.
 
The Director must possess excellent leadership, project management, analytical, and communication skills; successfully direct the planning, acquisition, and deployment of all automation systems; and coordinate and oversee operations and delivery of IT services. The Director reports directly to the Clerk of Court and the Chief United States Probation Officer and is a member of the management teams of the Clerk's Office and Probation Office.
This position is being advertised at a grade CL 30 and has promotional potential to a CL 31. 
The Director of IT performs duties and responsibilities which include, but are not limited to, the following:
 
Applicants must be United States citizens or lawful permanent residents actively seeking citizenship.  Judicial Branch employees are considered "at will" employees and are not subject to the employment regulations of competitive service.  Salary will be based on experience and qualifications.  Electronic Fund Transfer (EFT) for payroll deposit is required.
Applicants will be required to submit to a background investigation (including references, criminal history, and credit history) prior to an offer of employment being made. The person selected for this position will also be required to submit fingerprints for an FBI background check. As a condition of employment, the selected candidate must successfully complete a ten-year background investigation with periodic updates every five years thereafter.
All interested persons should apply online by visiting https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/nced and submit an application package which is to include:  the completed application, a cover letter, resume, a copy of the last two performance evaluations, a copy of the official or unofficial college transcripts, a narrative statement, not to exceed one page, outlining management philosophy, and a list of three professional references.   
Travel and relocation expenses will not be reimbursed. The court provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. All employees are required to adhere to the "Code of Conduct for Judicial Employees" which is available for review upon request. The court reserves the right to modify the conditions of this job announcement, to withdraw the job announcement, or to fill the position at any time before the closing date, any of which actions may occur without any prior written or other notice. Due to the volume of applications received, only candidates in consideration for this position will be contacted.
 
-THE COURT IS AN EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER-

title: Associate Director of Institutional Research
description:
The Associate Director of Institutional Research independently manages the predictive analytics and data visualization domains within the institutional research department to advance and support Samuel Merritt University' s decision-making and strategic planning. 
The Associate Director independently manages research assignments and projects, applies appropriate statistical methods and advanced database management skills in all areas of institutional research and reporting. 
The Associate Director plays a key role in managing the data collection, database structures and reporting related to WSCUC regional accreditation efforts, specialty accreditation, program evaluation and student success. 
The position is also responsible for initiating and resolving systems and data quality issues related to the institutional common data set and institutional databases used for mandated state and federal reporting. 
1. Knowledge of relational databases and experience designing, maintaining and reporting from large databases and multiple tables. Ability to query enterprise databases using SQL queries, multilevel joins and parameters. 
2. Solid knowledge and experience in advanced statistical tests and models. 
3. Ability to independently manage multiple projects and priorities while maintaining outstanding service and meeting deadlines 
4. Advanced knowledge of Tableau. 
5. Advanced SPSS skills. 
6. Expert knowledge of Excel, including charting, pivot tables, functions, merging data. 
7. Demonstrated knowledge of survey design and research methodologies. 
8. Ability to exercise sound judgment and discretion in relation to confidential and proprietary information. 
9. Effective presentation, communication and problem solving skills. 
*Master' s degree in Social Sciences or quantitative discipline, with intermediate to advanced course work in statistics. 
*Minimum of five years of progressive work experience in information gathering, processing, analysis, and reporting, preferably in Institutional Research. 
*Minimum of three years of experience in applying quantitative research methodology and multivariate statistics. 
*Knowledge of institutional research or higher education reporting requirements. 
*Must have ability to move about on foot to accomplish tasks across campus. 
*Ability to read and write complex documents. 
*Ability to sit doing deskwork for prolonged periods of time. 
The University has an institution-wide commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. We strive to build a welcoming and supportive campus environment, and acknowledge that diversity is an educational imperative to achieve excellence.

title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPERS
description: SOFTWARE DEVELOPERS: Exton, PA & various unanticipated locations throughout the U.S.: JOB#1: Conduct rqmt analysis, handle test cases, & test scenario reviews. Manage scope, plan, track, & change control aspect of projects. Prepare test strategy docs, test plans, & estimate test efforts. Create & dsn automation scripts. Review functional specification docs & log defects. Prepare traceability matrix & validate test coverage. Dvp SQL scripts as needed to validate data between source & target systems. Dvp Unix scripts to test & automate data conversion job loads. Skills req’d: SQL, Oracle, Java, J2EE, Selenium, Cucumber, SOAP UI, Agile, & Jira. Master’s in Sci, Tech, Comp Apps or Engg (any) w/1yr exp in job offered or related occup is req’d.. JOB#2: Gather rqmts, analyze, dsn, code, test, & deploy apps. Provide effort estimation & implementation. Handle change requests, map buss rqmts, & dsn logical data model. Dvp data validation & error handling. Conduct performance tuning for mapping, dvp transformation logic & dsn various mapping. Skills req’d: Oracle, Unix, Informatica Power Center, XML, Core Java, SQL Server, & Teradata. Master’s in Sci, Tech, or Engg (any) w/1yr exp in job offered or related occup is req’d. for JOB#1 &2, Bachelor’s w/5yrs exp is acceptable in lieu of Master’s +1yr exp. JOB#3: Gather rqmts & dvp projectspecs . Create user interface mockups & prototypes for various web apps based on project rqmts. title: Payroll Support Analyst - 5243
description:
Clearance Required:
Education Required:
US Citizenship:
 The MIL Corporation seeks a Payroll Support Analyst to support a Federal Government client at one of our Charleston, SC locations. The Payroll Support Analyst will provide payroll support and timekeeping services in the Post Support Unit (PSU). PSU has high-visibility and very important responsibility in providing Time and Attendance support services to participating overseas missions. The contractor will work closely with client post personnel to accumulate and process the data for the post's American and locally engaged (LE) staff through the time and attendance software to the official payroll systems for payment on a bi-weekly basis.
Time and attendance data submitted on individual timesheets is monitored, screened for apparent errors, and verification of appropriate supervisory authorizations. T&A submissions are processed and summarized in a report which is sent to post for supervisor signature and annotation of changes. Any corrections prior to T&A submissions noted by supervisors or employees are promptly processed. The Payroll Support Analyst provides support to the PSU customers with specific duties to be assigned by the Manager. 
• Work with embassy time coordinators and client personnel to accumulate and process data, maintain time and attendance records to ensure proper payments are processed on a bi-weekly basis. Maintain the database for all employees working in various embassies
 •Respond promptly and accurately to requests and inquiries from customers, following up on incoming communications within two workdays. Maintain diplomacy during times of pressure. Strive to improve both internal and external customer satisfaction 
 •Work closely with CGFS payroll units in Charleston and Bangkok to resolve payroll discrepancies and issues for client posts 
 •Maintain on a regular basis, the employee database of all employees working in the various posts in the document imaging system (DIS). 
 •Comply with all appropriate controls and procedures to protect organizational integrity and prevent unauthorized use or misappropriation of all sensitive but unclassified material and equipment in assignment area(s); report instances of security violations/problems to the appropriate supervisory/management official; assume personal responsibility for safeguarding sensitive (but unclassified) material and equipment within assignment area(s). 
 •Communicate professionally, tactfully, and courteously to customers, co-workers, and management regarding all aspects of the job, including system problems, user procedures, error correction, account problems, training, and overview briefings 
 •Promptly share information that may impact work processes with appropriate personnel either verbally, in writing or by email. Advise supervisor on difficult problems or anomalies that cannot be resolved and on issues which may be escalated or need to be escalated. 
 •Demonstrate through successful execution of work processes that Analyst understands and applies the Global Financial Services; ISO-9001 Quality Policy, Quality Manual, Quality Procedures, Process Definitions and Work Instructions applicable to the job 
 •Extract payroll data and consolidate various reports as requested by supervisor and/or customers. 
• AA/AS degree or at least two years of experience working with U.S. Embassy overseas
 • Shall possess superior organizational, oral and written communication skills and the ability to follow directions 
 • Significant experience with Microsoft office products (Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook) 
 • Excellent demeanor and interpersonal skills. Ability to understand work requirements/instructions 
 • Use greater judgment and initiative to determine the approach or action to take in routine and non-routine situations. 
 • Ability to comprehend, interpret and adapts guidelines, including unwritten policies, precedents, and practices, which are not always completely applicable to changing situations 
 • Ability to work in a close-knit team with a diverse, multicultural environment 
 • Experience with Time and Attendance (T&A) recording keeping 
 • Familiarization with DOS standard regulations (DSSR), 3FAM/FAH and DOS Time and Attendance systems 
 • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
 BA/BS degree 
 All applicants for this position must be able to obtain an MRPT/Public Trust clearance; please note that the clearance process takes into account financial background aspects 
 MIL is a dynamic workforce of industry professionals who deliver world-class solutions in cyber, engineering, financial management, and information technology - and we are looking for candidates like you. Whether you're fresh out of college or the military or well into your professional services career, MIL has great job opportunities that might be right for you. 
Here at The MIL Corporation, we pride ourselves on the family-like environment instilled amongst our team. Our employees love working here, and it truly shows through our various recognitions & awards. Last year alone, we earned: 
 
 
 Whether your goal is to help defend our country through the cyber efforts of the Department of Defense or ensure proper financial management/accountability with the Department of State, The MIL Corporation welcomes you. Become a part of something greater, where you, the people, make the difference.
