title: Product Manager/Analyst - B2B Marketplace (eCommerce)
description:
If you are a Product Manager/Analyst - B2B Marketplace (eCommerce) with experience, please read on!

We are a rapidly growing Series A B2B marketplace with offices in San Jose and Seattle but we are 100% remote-friendly as we want to bring on the most talented team members regardless of where you are living. Currently, we are looking to bring on a Product Manager/Analyst who has proven experience in B2B/Enterprise eCommerce environments, ideally working in a fast-growing startup.
- Series A startup growing rapidly - recently raised $14 million 
- Compensation is very competitive 

- Flexibility to work remotely 

- Medical, dental, vision benefits plus many add-on options available

- Equity participation
Our Product Manager/Analyst will be a hands-on role where you will analyze high-level business requirements and translate them into a product requirements doc for our engineering team. In this role, will collaborate with various members of the Product and Engineering teams to clearly research and define the detailed interactions and business logic needed to improve our eCommerce marketplace platform. Flow charts, data grids, conditional logic definitions, data dictionaries, feature specifications, PRDs, TRDs, user stories and use cases are just some of the tools a technical product analyst employs so all the details are understood, thought through, ironed out and fully documented for the engineering and QA teams as they go into building new features and then testing them before release.

This role will become the repository of all the business rules, edge cases and logic flows that underpin the B2B eCommerce system.
- A bachelors degree or equivalent experience, preferably in software engineering, computer science or a related field
- Experience with B2B eCommerce concepts and processes

- Experience capturing and documenting business & technical requirements; application analysis, design, and configuration

- 6+ years business systems analyst experience; requirements elicitation, analysis, solution, modeling scenarios/uses cases; new application, integration, reporting, data access design & development; translating functional requirements into test cases & leading testing; SQL scripting; familiar with SQL database arch & admin; proficiency with MS Office suite including developing Excel pivot tables and Visio process mapping

- Strong knowledge of user experience/user-centered design processes and methodology in a plus

- Experience designing B2B application and/or familiarity with common B2B business processes

- Experience developing specifications for new and enhanced systems & workflow processes
So, if you are a Product Manager/Analyst - B2B Marketplace (eCommerce) with experience, please apply today!

title: Systems Administrator
description:
Kratos is a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment that is team oriented and relationship driven to foster innovation and creativity within the space industry. Our motto "From Strength to Success" reflects a commitment to continually leveraging our technical and intellectual strengths for the ultimate success of our customers. The Federal Solutions Group is a leader in satellite command and control solutions focused on DoD, Civil (NOAA/NASA), and classified customers. We are an agile and innovative solutions provider in that we integrate Kratos-developed products with 3rd party software, as well as design and develop new tools and applications to provide end-to-end systems that solve mission unique requirements.
Kratos is seeking a System Administrator for our Federal Software Engineering team. The position is in support of dynamic, agile projects implementing a SecDevOps approach across all phases of the software development lifecycle, including design, development, test, and customer support. As part of a small team, this System Administrator will design network configurations, support network/OS/software installation upgrades and troubleshooting, monitor and improve network performance, support network/OS security implementation and improvements, and generate system documentation updates. The candidate will work closely with system and hardware engineers, developers, testers, and on-site user support personnel to support system updates, analyze and resolve system issues, and ensure project objectives are met.        
The candidate must be self-motivated, be a self-learner, and be able to work within a dynamic schedule.  Candidate must be able to organize & report status of tasks being worked and document software installation and system administration procedures.  Candidate must show ability to effectively communicate with various team members as well as communicate with vendor support.
-Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Network Engineering or related. Master's degree is a plus.
-Minimum of 4 years of technical experience in Systems Administration.
-Administration and configuration of Windows Active Directory with integrated DNS server and domain policies
-Configuration and administration of Windows 7+ workstations and Windows 2012+ Servers
-Design, implementation, and configuration of physical & virtual networks and associated hardware / software
-Creation, configuration, and administration of VMware virtual machines
-Experience with Linux, Solaris, clustering technologies, and relational database management is highly desired.
-Candidate should be comfortable with the utilization of scripting (e.g., Unix Shell, Windows batch, Windows Script Files, PowerShell, Ansible) to automate software integration and system infrastructure tasks. Candidate should also have experience with monitoring and engineering backup routines as well as the utilization of storage technologies and appliances. Knowledge of Risk Management Framework (RMF), cybersecurity guidelines, system security, controls and accreditation processes is a plus. 
-Position located in Lanham, MD.
U.S. Citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government Security Clearance is required.
Kratos offers challenging work, an excellent environment, & great benefits! Kratos is an affirmative action / equal opportunity employer that recognizes the importance of diversity. We are committed to maintaining an inclusive environment and strongly encourage minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities to apply.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. Please, no phone calls, agencies or recruiters.

title: Inventory Control Asst. II
description:
Founded in 1934 by aviation innovator Sir Alan Cobham, our values of Trust, Talent and Technology have driven us to become a global leader in state-of-the-art aerospace and defense systems. It's the insights of our innovators today that will secure our collective future. Innovators like you! 
 If you are authorized to work in the United States, then we encourage you to apply. We are unable to sponsor work visas. 
 Cobham is one of the world's leading companies engaged in the development, delivery and support of leading-edge aerospace and defense systems in the air, on land and at sea. Our clients and partners trust Cobham to deliver the mission-critical technology they need, and we trust our employees to draw on their ingenuity and passion to deliver those solutions. This leads to an empowering culture for our people. Our Leadership team is open, sharing plans for the next five years, driving retention by offering demanding, exciting work, and providing full guidance and mentoring. 
 Cobham Advanced Electronic Solutions is part of the Cobham family of companies and joins over 10,000 employees on five continents, with customers and partners in more than 100 countries and annual revenues in excess of $3B. CAES Lansdale manufactures custom microwave antennas and components supporting the Aerospace and Defense Industries.
Cobham is seeking an Inventory Control Assistant II. The Inventory Control Assistant II monitors and maintains inventory, researches problems and tracks orders, records purchases, maintains databases, and performs physical count of inventory. This position may prepare statistical reports on inventory balance, prices and shortages. Receives, unloads and distributes goods. Processes and/or approves invoices for payment. Documents and processes returns.
:
Receives, stores, delivers, kits, moves, reports progress and inventories of materials and supplies. 
 
 
 Prepares assembly kits to meet pre-scheduled release dates using pick list. Selects stock using first in-first out system, checks and records solderability date, vendor date code (when required) and quantity issued. Interfaces with materials and production personnel to resolve materials shortages. Inspects completed kit to ensure that any engineering change orders affecting parts are incorporated and releases to production floor.
Responds and researches requests for materials needed for engineering or production programs. Works from computerized reports, parts lists, engineering drawings, engineering change orders and written instructions to identify sources for parts and materials required.
Reviews or records debits or credits to material inventories to track materials returned, transferred or removed from inventory. Re-labels stock to reflect changes.
Audits inventory records for accuracy on a regular basis. Checks actual stock against amounts recorded. Notifies inventory coordinator or supervisor of unresolved discrepancies.
Responds to telephone, computerized or window requests for materials needed as the result of shortages on the production floor or engineering areas. Verifies inventory availability, locates material and package parts for pickup or delivery to other facilities.
Receives materials/supplies and counts to verify that quantity received matches receiving document. Records receipt of material on-line, manually or via a batch transaction to ensure timely updates to inventory.
Anticipates or responds to material shortages due to loss, change management, damage or defect in order to prevent work stoppages within assigned production areas.
Ensures that materials are properly packaged or repackaged in accordance with MCS 525 and 542, when necessary, in electrostatic bags or as otherwise specified. Labels and stocks in specified bins or fills back-order requirements, both for the assembly floor or kits in process.
Maintains and updates job progress and status records, and notifies management of impending delays. Prepares periodic or special reports on schedule, compliance, orders, status, etc., as required.
Ensures that all required materials are properly identified with safety stickers in conformance with Company and OSHA guidelines. Maintains and updates MSDS documentation.
Delivers completed assembly kits to assembly floor and releases to work-in-process (WIP).
Performs other duties and responsibilities as required.
High School Diploma or equivalent
Two (2) years' experience inventory control
Ability to lift and move materials weighing up to fifty (50) pounds.
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Basic Microsoft Office
In order to be considered for this opportunity, you must obtain and maintain security clearance, which requires USA Citizenship.
 
 
Experience with electronic equipment, hand tools, and fixturing
Preference given to those in Aerospace or Defense Industry 
 Employment Transparency:

title: Project Management Specialist
description:
Project Management Specialist

	We are currently seeking an experienced Project Management Specialist to join our team in our Atlanta, GA 30303 location.   This is not an IT Project Management role.

	Who We Are:

	We are a non-profit organization that provides training and leadership development to a national network of defense attorneys.

	About the Role:

	The Project Management Specialist is a resourceful, organized, and collaborative team member working in the Programs Department. The Project Management Specialist will work closely with the Program Director and key staff.  S/he has experience with supporting project development including planning, executing, and closing projects. This individual will support the implementation of all our organization’s training and the development of strategic partnerships.

	What you’ll do:

	Core duties and responsibilities include the following: 

	Assist with Training Project Management:
 	* Utilize project management tools and techniques to support our organization’s training and manage training logistics.
 	* Assist with the development and implementation of comprehensive project plans while documenting detailed processes.
 	* Assist with the scheduling of travel and accommodations for our organization’s faculty and guest speakers participating in training events.
 	* Assist with planning and implementing virtual learning initiatives.

	Manage Programs Related Technology:
 	* Assist with management of training registration databases and reporting.
 	* Develop and utilize spreadsheets, diagrams, timeliness, and process maps required for project completion.
 	* Assist with compilation and analysis of training participant data including attendance, assessments, and evaluations.
 	* Assist with the organization, management, and uploading to a shared Programs Department database.

	Program Support and Partnership Development:

 	* Maintain and update all information related to partner offices.
 	* Identify strategies for marketing the Summer Law Clerk and Law School Project Partnership programs.
 	* Develop and/or enhance key partnerships with Law Schools and Public Defender offices.
 	* Develop, create, and/or enhance partnerships that assist with building the organization’s community of law students, new lawyers, graduates, law clerks, and leaders.
 	* Manage the application and submission process for CLE credits before, during, and after training.
 	* Manage large scale communication efforts sent on behalf of the Programs Department included, but not limited to, application launches, training registration, Law School Partner Project recruitment etc.
 	* Establish and cultivate professional relationships with Chiefs, the organization’s alumni, CORE 101 class members, and other key staff in partner offices.
 	* Assist with securing vendors for lodging, supplies, materials, food, and event space for all the organization’s training.
 	* Assist with the interview process for potential class members for CORE 101 which may include scheduling interviews, conducting interviews, and uploading materials. 
 	* Assist with management of the organization’s application and MOU processes for class participants. 
 	* Other project management and administrative duties as assigned.

	Our Perfect Candidate

	Education and Experience:
 	* Bachelor’s degree or higher in a related field
 	* Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification is a plus
 	* Minimum of 3 years work related experience
 	* Prior experience working with a Non-Profit organization is REQUIRED

	Required Abilities and Skills:
 	* Documented experience managing large- and small-scale projects utilizing project management tools and methodology
 	* Ability to work collaboratively with team members and deliver optimum performance in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment
 	* Skilled with prioritizing tasks, meeting deadlines, organizing project deliverables, and managing competing priorities
 	* Exceptional administrative, technology, and audio-visual skills including a strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite and meeting scheduling tools
 	* High degree of flexibility and diplomacy when interacting with staff, program participants, our organization’s community, and volunteers
 	* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

	Company Offers:

	* Salary based on a Non-Profit range will commensurate with experience and education 
	* Comprehensive benefits package available: (healthcare, vision, dental and life insurances; 401k plan; paid vacation, sick days and holidays).

	To Apply:

	Please submit your cover letter, and resume

	via the ‘Apply Now’ button!

	We are an Equal Opportunity Employer!

	Keywords:  supporting project development including planning, executing, and closing projects; project management tools and techniques; development and implementation of comprehensive project plans; project management tools and methodology; exceptional administrative, technology, and audio-visual skills

	charitable organization, 501c2, non-profit, nonprofit, stewardship, fundraising, fund raising, Raiser's Edge (software), donor database, donor-ship, major gifts, philanthropy

description:

DHA servers, portals and dashboards 
Interactive business visualization 
Web-based reporting and authoring 
Advanced data exploration 
Microsoft Office integration 
Guided analysis 
Centralized metadata management 
Quality Indicators through up-to-date SAS codes provided by AHRQ and generate required tables and charts 
Develop, implement, administer and maintain policies and procedures to ensure the integrity of DHA Analytics databases, data marts, software programs and hardware systems. 
Follow all DHA/MHS protocols and procedures and obtain appropriate and required access and approval to develop/implement/maintain and administer data/databases within the DHA/MHS environments. 
Optimize and support data warehousing components, analytical cubes, stored procedures and complex SQL queries to support dashboards and reports. 
Develop process and queries to support recurring reports/requests. 
Identify and communicate database requirements in support of DHA Analytics initiatives and implement upgrades of hardware and software as necessary to enhance database performance. 
Implement data models, database designs and data access business rules to ensure that analysts, data miners and developers can utilize data effectively. 
Monitor database, operating system and user activities and perform database maintenance to include removal/archiving of obsolete data.
    
  
Three (3) years’ experience in project management of Information Systems projects.

Web Services data call skills required
Webmaster skills are highly desirable. 
Three (3) years’ experience using the following software (latest version), Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Office, Microsoft BI Stack, and SAS BI Software or similar. 
Proven ability to synthesize disparate facts from multiple sources and coalesce into an accurate and useful analytic product, incorporating Service and MHS strategic goals for use by leadership in both tactical and strategic decision making. 
Demonstrated ability to provide accurate and timely analytical products containing well-reasoned and cogent discussion points providing leadership with substantiated options or courses of action. 
Demonstrated ability to organize/participate/lead working groups to develop analytic products and byproducts or to develop/understand processes leading to effective optimization of analytic efforts. 
Demonstrated ability to effectively and clearly communicate analytical discoveries and appropriate recommendations/mitigation strategies to all levels of customers including Senior DHA leadership. 
Demonstrated advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products PLUS additional software/hardware skills and capabilities. 
Ability to critically examine and evaluate, problem-solve. • Demonstrated ability to undertake and complete multiple tasks with multiple deadlines simultaneously.
Ability to deliver products on time, on schedule, within budget. 
Flexibility and ability to adapt to rapidly changing and often time-constrained environment. 
Ability to acquire skills/capabilities necessary to meet growing needs/demands of systems/software/hardware.
    
  
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Biostatistics, Informatics, Mathematics or similar/related field. 
Other significant related public/population health experience such as previous participation in a data analytics/informatics fellowship may be considered as an appropriate substitute for education.

title: Associate Technology Architect
description:
Requisition ID:  58761  
Job Function/Category:  Information Technology  
Employment Type:  Exempt Full Time  
 The Mobile Technology Architect leads the mobile computing efforts to develop, maintain and govern mobile computing across the organization. The position leads, prioritizes and develops the overall approach for the organization. The Mobile Technology Architect has purview into (and directly manages) other architecture-related activities and the respective roles (such as business, information, solution and technical). The Mobile Technology Architect plays a role in orchestrating IT's delivery of business value from mobile technologies, working closely with product management. This position is a direct report to the Group Product Manager and requires an understanding of business goals, business processes and mobile technology architecture and device management. 
• Lead and Influence
 o Leads the creation or evolution of the mobile technology program/function.
 o Promotes the business value of the mobile computing program/function and its process, and the results of the mobile computing program to business and IT leaders/executives.
 o Leads the development of an implementation plan for mobile technologies based on business strategy and requirements.
 o Seeks opportunities to highlight how digital business initiatives will potentially impact enterprises' economic architecture and metrics.
 o Consults with infrastructure, project and product teams to ensure consistency with the mobile technology architecture, as well as to identify when it is necessary to modify the mobile technology architecture.
 o Identifies organizational requirements for the resources, structures and cultural changes necessary to support the mobile technology architecture.
• Identify Ecosystems and Develop Business Models
 o Understands the business's economic and financial levers that are susceptible to digital transformation, so as to effectively support and guide mobile technology investment decisions.
 o Designs and constructs future- and current-state business models so as to practically apply new and emerging mobile technologies to drive them.
 o Details potential competitive threats from digital enterprises that are generally considered outside of your traditional realm of competition.
 o Presents a gap analysis and/or IT investment road map that reflects the status of the existing IT estate, namely, its ability to contribute to future-state business capabilities around ecosystems and mobile digital platforms.
• Focus on Strategy and Execution
 o Demonstrates the business value of mobile computing as an enabler of strategy formulation, and as support for technology innovation, which drives the organization's top and bottom lines.
 o Formulates, translates, advocates, supports and executes business strategy to achieve the organization's targeted business outcomes.
 o Constructs mobile technology-enabled operating models, and provides viable options and visibility into execution issues.
 o Develops diagnostic and actionable deliverables that help guide investment decisions in support of executing business strategy.
 o Leads the development and execution of a communication and education plan for mobile technology architecture.
 o Leads the development of an implementation plan for the mobile technology based on business requirements and IT strategies.
• Research and Understand Technology and Non-Technology Trends
 o Research and assess for major disruptive technology and non-technology trends (trend spotting) that affect business. Provides practical advice and best practices to overcome these challenges and successfully delivers the expected business outcomes.
 o Contextualizes the technology trends based on social, economic, political and other non-technology trends.
 o Leads the analysis of business and operating models, market trends and the mobile technology industry to determine their potential impact on the mobile technology business strategy, direction and architecture.
 o Oversees the documentation of all mobile technology design and analysis work.
 o Creates and oversees the documentation of all mobile technology architecture design and analysis work.
• Enable mobile technology Ideation and Innovation
 o Tracks and applies innovative and existing technologies, anchoring them in the business model to assess their potential, and use rapid prototyping approaches to evolve innovations.
 o Runs mobile technology experiments, helping to create new products and services and integrating the best of theses into steady-state operations for the organization.
 o Provides perspective on the readiness of the organization to change and innovate.
• Determine and Help Orchestrate the Delivery of Business Outcomes
 o Works with business peers and leads the identification and analysis of mobile technology business outcomes and drivers to derive useful business context, and in response to disruptive forces. Leads analysis of the IT environment to detect critical deficiencies and recommends solutions for improvement.
 o Guides and advises stakeholders about disruptive technologies and trends.
 o Determines the relationship between people, processes, information, and technology and trends of the enterprise, and their relationships to one another and to the external environment.
 o Works with business peers to develop and present business capability models and roadmaps to facilitate discussion and decision making with stakeholders across the enterprise.
 o Leads analysis of the business' future-state capabilities and future (and current) IT environment to detect critical deficiencies and recommend solutions for improvement and driving the business forward.
• Leads and facilitates the creation of governance, assurance and standards to guide mobile computing decision making.
 o Ensures that the optimal governance structure and compliance activities are associated with mobile computing compliance.
 o Oversees the evaluation and selection of mobile computing standards, as necessary.
 o Oversees mobile computing implementation and ongoing refinement activities.
 o Oversees mobile computing implementation, continuous improvement and ongoing refinement activities.
Required Skills:
• Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or STEM. Without a bachelor's degree, must have a minimum of 6 years of technology solution engineering
 • Experience in disciplines such as business, information, solution or mobile technical architecture, MDM application development, middleware, information analysis, database management or operations in a multi-tier environment.
This is a multi-level position and the successful candidate will be based on job performance, skills, knowledge and experience. 
• 9668-Associate Technology Architect: 2-4 years of technology solution engineering. Without a bachelor's degree, must have a minimum of 6 years of technology solution engineering
• 9669-Technology Architect: 4-6 years of technology solution engineering. Without a bachelor's degree, must have a minimum of 8 years of technology solution engineering
• 9670-Senior Technology Architect: 6-8 years of technology solution engineering. Without a bachelor's degree, must have a minimum of 10 years of technology solution engineering
• 9671-Principal Technology Architect: 8 or more years of technology solution engineering. Without a bachelor's degree, must have a minimum of 12 years of technology solution engineering
Key Skills and Knowledge:
 • Knowledge of business models, operating models, financial models, cost-benefit analysis, budgeting and risk management.
 • Familiarity with information management practices, system development life cycle management, IT services management, infrastructure and operations, and mobile computing and ITIL frameworks.
 • Knowledge of business ecosystems, SaaS, infrastructure as a service (IaaS), platform as a service (PaaS), SOA, APIs, open data, microservices, event-driven IT and predictive analytics.
 • Exposure and understanding of existing, new and emerging mobile technologies, and processing environments.
 • Exceptional soft and interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation and negotiation.
 • Strong leadership skills.
 • Excellent analytical and technical skills.
 • Excellent written, verbal, communication and presentation skills.
 • Excellent planning and organizational skills.
 • Knowledge of all components of holistic mobile technology architecture.
 • Knowledge of business engineering principles and processes.
 • Familiarity with basic graphical modeling approaches, tools and model repositories.
 • Organizationally savvy, and understanding of the political climate of the mobile technology and how to navigate obstacles and politics.
 • Ability to balance the long-term ("big picture") and short-term implications of individual decisions.
 • Ability to translate business needs into mobile computing requirements.
 • Ability to estimate the financial impact of mobile computing alternatives.
 • Ability to apply multiple solutions to business problems.
 • Ability to rapidly comprehend the functions and capabilities of new technologies.
 • Capable and comfortable with balancing time between foundational mobile computing (Mode 1: ensures efficiency and predictability) and vanguard mobile computing efforts (Mode 2: concerned with speed, agility and flexibility to achieve a unified and flexible mobile computing that meets the organization's needs).
 • Ready to think, behave and act in an innovative consulting manner to drive the organization's digital business strategies.
 • Understand and speak the language of the business.
 • Influential in the organization and a team player.
 • Effective at driving short-term actions that are consistent with long-term goals.
 • Trusted and respected as a thought leader who can influence and persuade business and IT leaders
 • Comfortable, experienced and accomplished at working with business executives, and able to push back in a professional and diplomatic way.
 • Highly collaborative and supportive of business and of its ideals and strategies.
Desired Skills:
• Experience with VMWare Airwatch, SCCM, and/or Citrix
 • Master's degree or MBA

title: Clinical Study Manager - Oncology
description:
Developing innovative therapies is one of the most challenging, most essential and personally rewarding fields in science. This is the most exciting time to be a part of Astellas, a company with a uniquely collaborative and patient-focused culture. 
There's something special about working at Astellas. It's reflected in our focus on the people we serve, the way we treat each other and the results we achieve together as a company. 
Astellas is announcing a Clinical Study Manager - Oncology opportunity in Northbrook, IL. 
  
Position & Scope: 
 
*  Plan, initiate and execute assigned clinical studies with operational excellence 
*  Be accountable for effective management of budgets, timelines and resources for assigned clinical studies and implementation of appropriate standards and processes to ensure clinical study quality 
*  Be responsible for effective training and management of interactions with study team, study sites and vendors for assigned clinical studies 
*  The scope of this position is Phase 1 through 4 APGD-sponsored clinical studies.  
Essential Job Responsibilities: 
 
*  Manage and lead the day-to-day operations of assigned studies to ensure completion per established project team goals and objectives in compliance with applicable GCP/ICH guidelines and other regulatory requirements 
*  Manage and lead cross-functional study teams, including vendors 
*  Provide accurate and up-to-date study information within CTMS and other relevant tracking systems and provide regular updates of study progression to Clinical Program Management and other stakeholders; proactively identify and resolve issues that arise during study conduct; manage escalation of study-related issues 
*  Lead development of study plans and system set-up; participate in preparation and ensure operational excellence of protocol, CRF, CSR and other key study team deliverables 
*  Implement appropriate systems, standards and processes to ensure quality at the level of investigative sites, vendors and data 
*  Lead preparation of vendor requirements and project scope and selection of study vendors; effectively manage interactions with vendor study team 
*  Lead feasibility assessment and selection of countries and sites for study conduct 
*  Oversee the clinical aspects of timely data cleaning, data analysis and the availability of top line results; participate in data reviews and review of statistical analysis plans 
*  Ensure set-up and implementation of effective investigator and site monitor training; coordinate operational and therapeutic area training for internal and external study team members. 
*  Provide oversight and direction to study team members for study deliverables; may provide direction to Associate Clinical Study Managers and Clinical Trial Associates for assigned studies.  
Quantitative Dimensions:  
Responsible for the preparation and management of budgets, timelines and resources for assigned clinical studies. Responsible for study budgets up to $100M. 
  
Organizational Context: 
Reports to the Senior Manager, Clinical Study Management or above. This position has no direct reports but may provide oversight and direction to study team members for study deliverables and may provide supervision to Associate Clinical Study Managers and Clinical Trial Associates.  
 
Qualification 
Requirements: 
 
*  BA/BS degree with at least five years multi-country clinical trial experience or advanced degree (MS/PhD/PharmD) with at least 3 years clinical trial experience 
*  Must have strong knowledge of ICH/GCP guidelines. 
*  Must have strong knowledge of protocol and clinical drug development processes, clinical study design, study planning and management, and monitoring. 
*  Requires proven project management skills and study leadership ability. 
*  Must have excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, administrative skills and computer ability. 
*  Fluent in English. Moderate (25%) travel required.

title: Accountant
description:
Job Duties include preparing balance sheets, profit and loss statements and other financial reports. Responsibilities also include analyzing trends, costs, revenues, financial commitments and obligations incurred to predict future revenues and expenses. The accountant also prepares reports on the organization's finances to management and offers suggestions about resource utilization, tax strategies and assumptions underlying budget forecasts.
This position requires a bachelor's degree in area of specialty and 2-4 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiarity with standard concepts, practices and procedures within the restaurant industry is important as there is more to this role than traditional financial reporting.  Creating key reports that are based in managerial accounting that help the franchisees and managers focus on the key actions needed to drive improved, sustainable profitability. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Perform a variety of tasks. Work under general supervision. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. We are an entrepreneurial organization at this time and need to have the right accounting disciplines in place so that as we grow, the disciplines prevent problems later. This person reports to a remote supervisor primarily to address the technical accounting questions plus add perspective overall with a strong dotted line to the president of the company.

Prepares residential drawings and files plans with the building department.

* Modifies drawings by studying changes.

title: Shipboard Systems - Subject Matter Expert II
description:
Candidate will be required to develop engineering and technical documentation on marine equipment/systems in support of surface and/or amphibious landing watercraft. Have a basic understanding of US Navy Hull, Mechanical and Electrical Systems (HM&E), Electronics Systems, Combat Systems or marine systems with 10 years’ experience.
 
Analyzes product failures for root causes, proposes corrective actions, prepares failure and analysis report and maintains reliability control database on product success/failure history. Utilizes statistical methods such as linear regression and standard deviation to evaluate compliance with reliability numerical requirements. Participates in design reviews of new products and continues review of proposed changes affecting product baseline data. Prepares reliability section of technical proposals, including labor estimates and scheduling. Reviews preliminary reports and waivers, deviations and engineering change proposals for compliance with contractual requirements and presents to DCASMA-QARS for concurrence and transmittal.
 
Bachelor’s Degree in Manufacturing Engineering or Process Engineering or equivalent experience. 2 to 4 years related engineering experience.
- Must be experienced and knowledgeable with; all facets of Integrated Support for shipboard Hull, Mechanical and Electrical Systems (HM&E), Electronics Systems, Combat Systems or marine systems.
- Have the ability to read and interpret various ship drawings for HM&E Systems, Electronics Systems or Combat Systems.
- Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite of programs required.
- Current experienced in AutoCAD is a plus.
- At least 4 years of Ship Repair experience or Shipboard experience in Naval Service.
- Must have a working knowledge of NAVSEA Standard items, General Specs for Overhaul of Surface Ships and familiarity with Naval Ship Tech Manual.
 
Candidates must be a citizen of the United States of America and be able to obtain a Common Access Card (CAC).

title: Inventory Control Coordinator
description: Provide support to the maintenance department performing a variety of cross-functional duties.  Work closely with Asst. Plant Engineer, Maintenance Supervisor and all maintenance mechanics. This individual also has a responsibility to ensure and maintain a food safe environment through compliance to all requirements of programs/policies for Food Safety, Good Manufacturing Practices, HACCP, Quality, Workplace Safety, SQA, OSHA, Environmental, and as may be required by Plant, Company, Local, State and Federal mandates or programs.

title: Software Acquisition Management Analyst
company: U.S. Army Ground Vehicle Systms Center (GVSC)
description:
Senior Software Engineer or Software Engineer III with GVSC’s Software Engineering Center, Department of Army, Warren, MI.
 
The U.S. Army Ground Vehicles Systems Center (GVSC) is a major element of Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC) and partner in the Tank Automotive and Armaments Command (TACOM) Life Cycle Management Command (LCMC). As a full life-cycle engineering support provider-of-first-choice for all Department Of Defense (DoD) ground combat and tactical vehicles, weapons and support systems, GVSC develops and integrates the right technology solutions to improve Current Force effectiveness and provide superior capabilities for the Future Force.  GVSC’s Software Engineering Center (SEC) provides software engineering and software life cycle management services to ground systems acquisition and technology development programs. GVSC’s Software Engineering Center is responsible for developing, acquiring, integrating, assessing, supporting and maintaining software products. For more information visit 
.
 
The Software Acquisition Management Analyst will have a hands-on role with the acquisition support of software for the Army’s current and future ground combat and tactical vehicles, weapons and support systems; and will require involvement in all stages of the development cycle.
 
 
Please email your resume to:

title: Clinical Research Coord (23784B)
description:
Coordinates the implementation, quality control and completion of research studies while assisting the Principal Investigator in determining and accomplishing study objectives. Oversees research studies in an administrative and operational capacity while maintaining compliance with guidelines set by governing agencies.
University of Utah Job ID PRN23784B - 00268 – Neurosurgery
COMPENSATION: $39,300 to $52,500/annual
WORK SCHEDULE: Full Time, 40 hours per week, Day, Monday through Friday, 8AM to 5PM; some evening and weekend hours may be required
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:
This job description is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in a health sciences or related field with two years professional research experience and completion of University RATS Clinical Certification within one year of hire required. Exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and demonstrated human relations and effective communication skills also required.
Knowledge of Good Clinical Practices, FDA, HIPAA and IRB regulations; an understanding of research procedures; and the ability to function independently is preferred.
Departments may require IRB CITI Course or IATA DGR training within a specified timeframe.
Departments may prefer a nursing degree for this position, which requires the incumbent to have two years related experience and possess a nationally recognized research compliance certification.
This position is patient-sensitive and must fulfill all associated requirements. We protect our patients, coworkers and community by requiring all patient-sensitive employees to be immunized according to CDC standards and hospital policy. Limited exemptions may be made for documented medical contraindications or religious beliefs that object to vaccinations.
Applicants must demonstrate the potential ability to perform the essential functions of the job as outlined in the position description.
 
TO APPLY, VISIT: 
 
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
The University of Utah is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer. Upon request, reasonable accommodations in the application process will be provided to individuals with disabilities. Please contact the Office of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action, 201 S. Presidents Cr., Rm 135, (801) 581-8365 (V/TDD), for further information or to request an accommodation. The University of Utah is committed to diversity in its workforce. Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.

title: Linux Systems Administrator*
description:
The BMDS Integration Group supports the Missile Defense Agency in the development, deployment, testing, and enhancement of the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS). This group performs detailed systems and component engineering, flight and ground test analysis, and advanced capability development using the BMDS Analysis Enclave (BAE). There is a need for dedicated IT System Administrator to support the BAE who is experienced with Linux/Windows computing environments. Qualified candidates will demonstrate experience in server performance optimization leveraging GPU technology, robust enterprise storage design, central authentication using IPA, SE Linux cyber security configuration, maintenance patching, HBSS, ACAS, DAR, scripting /software development, automation, and disaster recovery.
Linux Systems Administrator with experience in modern environments and understanding in system architecture and design. Responsible for performing administration primarily of Linux RHEL 6 & 7 servers, Red Hat Identity Management (IdM) or Free IPA server, storage and occasionally, various Windows platforms to include Windows 10 and Server 2012/2016.
• Define, Architect, Assemble, Test, and deploy mobile BAE systems.
• Define, Architect, install, test, BAE systems in facilities
• Design, install, configure, storage across servers (Linux, Windows)
• Maintain, upgrade, and monitor exist BAE systems
• Troubleshoot server problems, storage problems, and user access problems
• Perform security patch management, IAVA’s, and STIG’s.
• Maintain compliance with all required Information Assurance (IA) requirements
• Work with the ISSO for reporting and verification utilizing tools like ACAS and SCAP
• Work with BAE ISSO renew BAE ATO
• Collaborate with ISSO for all modifications to the accredited BAE baseline
• Coordinate IT efforts with the System Network Engineering and Configuration/Project Management personnel to resolve Incident Requests, Configuration Control Board Requests and Engineering Review Board Requests.
• Occasional extended and/or off-nominal hours work may be required.
• MDA event support and other duties as assigned
• Configuration and Maintenance of KVM Solution
• Provide regular reports on server performance, application and system operations, reliability
• Perform routine backups
• Interact with users and evaluates vendor products.
• Provide recommendations for the purchase of hardware and software.
• Account creation and management
• Must be a U.S. citizen with an active secret clearance
• Ph.D. plus 5 years minimum experience, or MS plus 8 years minimum experience
• MS in Computer Science or related field and 8 years’ experience or Ph.D. Computer Science and 5 years’ experience
• Strong knowledge of Red Hat 6/7 Linux to include System Administration, Red Hat patch management, User Management, Security Requirements, Backup procedures, Disk and File Management
• Experience with Red Hat Identity Management (IdM) or Free IPA server.
• Current DoD 8570 IAT Level II Certification (GSEC, Security+ CE, SSCP, CCNA-Security)
• Must have Linux Certification or equivalent.
• Active Top Secret Clearance
• Experience using sophisticated digital cameras is preferred
• Knowledge of Virtualization Technologies to include VM management, snapshots, SANs and iSCSI storage systems
• Strong experience managing Big Data to both CIFS and NFS clients
• Strong backup experience and proven ability to protect mission critical data
• Capable of supporting occasional CONUS and OCONUS travel.
• RH Certified Sys Admin, RH Certified Engineer, Oracle Solaris Sys Admin, Oracle Linux Administrator, Oracle Linux Certified Expert, Linux+, or LPCI-1 a plus
• Understanding of Windows patch management
• Applied understanding of DoD STIG’s and SCAP
• Configuration of distributed environments, including NFS for storage
• Configure and maintain a number of Linux systems utilizing scripting languages and automation tools as appropriate
• Configuring and managing centralized logging and audit capabilities
• Centralized account management
• Network support including SSH server implementation, Linux networking configuration, host based firewall, web server
• Modeling and Simulation
• Installing and commissioning IT systems at customer sites
• Real-time Linux kernels, tuning and performance analysis
• GPUs (i.e. Cuda Processing)
• High Performance Computing Systems (rack mount, blade servers, etc.)
• Cisco Networking (Router/Switch/Firewall) knowledge
• Enterprise VMWARE experience
• Some Windows Server experience
• Raritan KVM experience
• Experience with missile defense system elements such as C2BMC, THAAD, GMD, Aegis and/or AN/TPY2.
• PKI, Multi-Factor Authentication, and PIV Technologies
• Location: Lexington, MA
• Travel: Non-Anticipated 
• Employment Status: Full-Time Employee with full benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, PTO, Retirement)
• Other: All candidates must also successfully pass a Commercial Background Investigation (CBI).

description:
Our growing and successful business comprises of over 800 talented individuals globally, in an environment where everybody counts and is instrumental to our success.  With state-of-the-art manufacturing and clinical facilities in the UK and USA, we deliver a full range of drug development solutions around the globe saving our clients both time and money.

We are passionate about helping our customers get new medicines to market.
 
 
 
In return you will receive a competitive salary, a generous benefits package, excellent training and development, as well as an exciting career within a fast paced and dynamic business.

title: Linux Systems Administrator
description:
Execute efforts supporting incremental software deliveries that could require reconfiguration and continuous restructuring / builds of the current infrastructure as new baselines are delivered. title: Claims Assistant- Intake Coordinator
description:
Under close supervision performs clerical and data entry tasks that assist in administration of claims. This position requires considerable interaction with client and others on the phone, with management and other claims examiners, therefore, consistently being on time to the work office is inherently required of this position.
• Sets up new claims in database systems and paper files, ensuring all documentation is present and correct.
• Documents all work product and claim activity in the claim file.
• Prepares, schedules, and processes benefit and medical payments on claim files as directed by the Claims Examiner.
• Post or attach information to claim file and maintain filing system.
• Maintain vehicle inventories. 
• Answers phone calls, transfers calls, take messages and responds appropriately.
• Perform administrative and clerical procedures such as filing, distributing mail, sorting, alphabetizing, faxing and copying.
• Utilize Microsoft Office programs daily, including Excel, Word and Outlook.
• Other duties as assigned.
EQUIPMENT OPERATED/USED: Computer, 10-key, printer, copier, phone, fax/scanner machine and other office equipment.
SPECIAL EQUIPMENT OR CLOTHING: Business casual clothing attire required.
Education/Experience: High school diploma or GED required: a minimum of two (2) years related experience preferably in a claims department or TPA; or equivalent combination of advanced education and experience.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Knowledge of claims handling concepts, practices and techniques, including but not limited to coverage issues and product line knowledge. 
• Ability to effectively operate computer equipment and applications.
• Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, Outlook and Internet Explorer are required.
• Ability to communicate effectively and clearly, both orally and in writing.
• Ability to manage relationships in a fast paced environment, while demonstrating problem solving and decision making skills to work on –site with our customer.
• Ability to carry out detailed written or verbal instructions, ability to respond to requests effectively and efficiently and exhibit good common sense.
• Time management skills, organizational skills and ability to prioritize issues and complete tasks in a timely and accurate manner.
• Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision and exhibit flexibility and creativity in solving day to day issues.

title: Enterprise Account Executive
description:
Honeywell is charging into the Industrial IoT revolution with the establishment of Honeywell Connected Enterprise (HCE), building on our heritage of invention and deep, on-the-ground industry expertise. HCE is the leading industrial disruptor, building and connecting software solutions to streamline and centralize the assets, people and processes that help our customers make smarter, more accurate business decisions. Moving at the speed of software, we are creating, innovating and delivering solutions fast, challenging the way things have always been done, piloting new ways for all of us to work, and expecting our successes to set new standards for our customers and for Honeywell.
Honeywell is looking for a Digital Transformation Sales Leader will lead all aspects of engagements with existing and new customers for our organization. This candidate will build relationships and understand customer business in order to provide appropriate products or solutions. He or she will define sales and growth strategy toward key customers while aligning with critical sales business objectives. This leader will identify opportunities and build credibility with customers and utilize prior product knowledge to deliver the value proposition to the customers. The ideal candidate will be located in Northeast Region, but will consider candidates located anywhere close to a major airport. Increase overall performance of the organization by creating strong customer relationships and new customer partnerships within your organization Develop and maximize Honeywell presence and market share in designated accounts and territory Drive continuous improvement and lead change in a premiere Sales Organization
YOU MUST HAVE
·       Minimum 5 years experience selling into the process industries direct to end user customers and or EPCs

·       Bachelor's degree

title: Technology Consultant
description:
As a Technology Consultant in our Client Services team based in Sofia, you will be working with our sophisticated financial software solutions for Performance Measurement and Client Reporting focused on 3 main areas:
We have a long-term project to migrate all our existing clients using our Performance and Reporting solutions that are currently hosted on different infrastructure providers and data centers to FactSet's AWS solution. You will work closely with our clients during this migration project and coordinate your work with the assigned Project Manager.
You will be expected to assist our clients in production with their business and technical requests, questions and queries from the Performance, Attribution, Reporting Teams of our clients who are usually big Asset or Wealth managers.
  
You will be responsible for implementing all different modules of our software: Total Return & Statistics, GIPS, Equity Attribution, Fixed Income Attribution, Client Reporting, etc. The process will follow the project plan and tasks will involve gathering initial requirements, making all the necessary configurations, loading market data and the client’s portfolio data, testing, results reconciliation, training and all the required steps for completion of the implementation according to client requirements.
You will be taking part in many core components of our Specialty Sales process, supporting the global team in activities including:
Preparation of detailed Proof of Concepts (POC) using prospect data
Creation of Requests for Proposal (RFP) and formalization of a library of standard responses for the use by the global team
Maintenance of the global demonstration environment

         Oversee the organization’s infrastructure requirements, transportation/fleet maintenance, including appropriate information technology, data identification/data management and work environments; as well as facilities operations, maintenance and development.
       Formulate and administer a quality assurance program, addressing the identification for corrective action recommendations to Managers and Directors regarding documentation, tracking and reporting of progress of Department of Rehabilitation, Ability One, Department of Labor, OSHA, Regional Centers, Department of Developmental Services, CARF etc. 
        Oversee ECF’s Injury and Illness Prevention and Safety Program, in coordination with Human Resources. This includes leading ECF’s corporate Safety Committee, as well as ensuring connectivity between and with site-based Safety committees.

          Ensure overall contract compliance and responsible proper execution and renewal of leases, legal issues, Corporate and HIPAA Compliance.
Master’s degree in public administration (MPA), business management (MBA) or a closely related field (finance, operations, administration) from an accredited college or University preferred.
 Ten years managerial or administrative experience in the public or private sector involving planning, data management, project management, human capital management.

title: Data Architect III/Dashboard Developer
description:
Ke`aki Technologies is looking for qualified Data Architect III / Dashboard Developer to support the Defense Health Agency (DHA) contract by providing 24/7 expertise in the areas of Data Architecture, Information Architecture, and Dashboard Development. 
 
    
  
Develop scope and understand technical requirements with input from stakeholders. 
Collaborate with designers to develop interface functionality. 
Present concise stages of interface design development to stakeholders. 
Develop software requirements specification documents for applications on DHA servers. 
Design and maintain SAS BI web reporting pages, portals and all other related applications. 
Support the following SAS Software, BI (BI) capabilities on: 
DHA servers, portals and dashboards 
Interactive business visualization 
Web-based reporting and authoring 
Advanced data exploration 
Microsoft Office integration 
Guided analysis 
Centralized metadata management 
Quality Indicators through up-to-date SAS codes provided by AHRQ and generate required tables and charts 
Develop, implement, administer and maintain policies and procedures to ensure the integrity of DHA Analytics databases, data marts, software programs and hardware systems. 
Follow all DHA/MHS protocols and procedures and obtain appropriate and required access and approval to develop/implement/maintain and administer data/databases within the DHA/MHS environments. 
Optimize and support data warehousing components, analytical cubes, stored procedures and complex SQL queries to support dashboards and reports. 
Develop process and queries to support recurring reports/requests. 
Identify and communicate database requirements in support of DHA Analytics initiatives and implement upgrades of hardware and software as necessary to enhance database performance. 
Implement data models, database designs and data access business rules to ensure that analysts, data miners and developers can utilize data effectively. 
Monitor database, operating system and user activities and perform database maintenance to include removal/archiving of obsolete data.
    
  
Three (3) years’ experience in project management of Information Systems projects. 
Three (3) years’ experience in business analysis. • Three (3) years’ experience in development of technical requirements in interactive media design. 
Three (3) years’ experience in development of product support documents. 
Three (3) years’ experience in development of requirements in interactive media design. 
Three (3) years’ experience in workflow development and documentation of workflow processes. 
Three (3) years’ experience in data visualization/information architecture. 
Three (3) years’ experience working with MHS Clinical Data. 
Three (3) years’ experience working with SQL, relational databases and their management systems. 
Two (2) years’ experience developing, testing and maintaining BI products (Tableau/Tableau Creator, Qlik, SSRS) 
Proficiency in SharePoint or related services. 
Prior experience developing databases and/or dashboards using Tableau/Tableau Creator software. 
Web Services data call skills required
Webmaster skills are highly desirable. 
Three (3) years’ experience using the following software (latest version), Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Office, Microsoft BI Stack, and SAS BI Software or similar. 
Proven ability to synthesize disparate facts from multiple sources and coalesce into an accurate and useful analytic product, incorporating Service and MHS strategic goals for use by leadership in both tactical and strategic decision making. 
Demonstrated ability to provide accurate and timely analytical products containing well-reasoned and cogent discussion points providing leadership with substantiated options or courses of action. 
Demonstrated ability to organize/participate/lead working groups to develop analytic products and byproducts or to develop/understand processes leading to effective optimization of analytic efforts. 
Demonstrated ability to effectively and clearly communicate analytical discoveries and appropriate recommendations/mitigation strategies to all levels of customers including Senior DHA leadership. 
Demonstrated advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products PLUS additional software/hardware skills and capabilities. 
Ability to critically examine and evaluate, problem-solve. • Demonstrated ability to undertake and complete multiple tasks with multiple deadlines simultaneously.
Ability to deliver products on time, on schedule, within budget. 
Flexibility and ability to adapt to rapidly changing and often time-constrained environment. 
Ability to acquire skills/capabilities necessary to meet growing needs/demands of systems/software/hardware.
    
  
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Biostatistics, Informatics, Mathematics or similar/related field. 
Other significant related public/population health experience such as previous participation in a data analytics/informatics fellowship may be considered as an appropriate substitute for education.
    
  
Ke`aki Technologies LLC is a fast-growing government service provider. title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud
description:
Director, Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist
The Deputy Director, Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist is a newly created position as part of the Digital Technology team. The organization has made an enterprise-wide commitment to using Salesforce Marketing Cloud as part of an overall transformation of its current digital ecosystem. Key drivers are to increase its current capabilities and simplify its challenging system architecture to propel fundraising, build education, create brand awareness, and drive public advocacy in order to deliver programs and aid that help children around the world.
In support of that mission, the Director will act as the Marketing Cloud resident expert, ensuring that the new Marketing Cloud implementation is setup and configured correctly using best-in-class methods and according to the business rules and data structure representative of the organization. This includes how best to handle management of donors, supporters, club memberships, etc. as it relates to defining data required in Marketing Cloud vs existing BlackBaud CRM (BBCRM), leveraging subscriber keys and other unique constituent identifiers, email addresses, opt-ins and opt-outs, personalization and other key decisions that will affect the behavior of the system and the ability of Marketing Cloud to meet the business and legal needs of. It also will entail ensuring how financial donation transactions, order tracking of Trick-or-Treat boxes, etc. are handled within Salesforce or on another platform and which data is needed to be stored in Marketing Cloud.
The Director, working with external implementation partners and with internal colleagues from departments across the organization, will be the lead internal resource for directing and potentially reviewing decisions to ensure Marketing Cloud has been positioned optimally for success. The Marketing Cloud Specialist will work hand-in-hand with the Digital Technology’s Solutions Architect on decisions regarding right-sizing Marketing Cloud databases, archival strategies and solutions, and overall design of data inputs and outputs related to Marketing Cloud.
Once the Marketing Cloud solution is in place, the Deputy Director will be involved in working with outside partners in the stand-up Email Studio, Social Studio, GA360 Connector, and Mobile Connect as part of the Phase 1 rollout. In this capacity, the Specialist will bring Marketing Cloud expertise to advise and consult business units leveraging these tools with the ability to maximize their use.
Once Marketing Cloud toolsets are in place, the ongoing operational focus of the Specialist will be to ensure any daily jobs, requested configurations, or other system changes are performed accurately. In addition, as requests for enhancements or projects are received, the Specialist will be asked to help define business requirements, functional designs, technical designs (which can include data and flow mapping, journeys, prototyping, and configuration), testing, training and support procedures.
While this is a technical role, it is one that equally requires the candidate to demonstrate that they can partner with business leadership to understand the organization’s business drivers to better inform the technical decisions being made. Moreover, this role requires the ability to translate and explain technology in a way that senior management, business leaders, and constituents can easily understand.
This role offers the right candidate the rare opportunity to help create a new digital platform product, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, from its infancy and build the most optimal business processes, configurations, and integrations to meet the needs of the organization. This position is critical to the success of the overall vision to change the entire digital ecosystem within the organization which is being counted on to drive additional digital revenue, engagement, and brand awareness. This visible role will be based in the New York City. Minimal travel will be required.
Must possess current and valid US Work Authorization and be eligible to work for any US employer without sponsorship.
Due to the high volume of applications received, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply.

description:

Job Duties:
Ensures the integrity of accounting information by recording, verifying, consolidating, and entering transactions.
* Prepares and records asset, liability, revenue, and expenses entries by compiling and analyzing account information.
* Maintains and balances subsidiary accounts by verifying, allocating, posting, reconciling transactions; resolving discrepancies.
* Maintains general ledger by transferring subsidiary accounts; preparing a trial balance; reconciling entries.
* Summarizes financial status by collecting information; preparing balance sheet, profit and loss, and other statements.
* Produces payroll by initiating computer processing; printing checks, verifying finished product.
* Completes external audit by analyzing and scheduling general ledger accounts; providing information for auditors.
* Avoids legal challenges by complying with legal requirements.
* Secures financial information by completing database backups.
* Protects organization's value by keeping information confidential.

description:

title: Healthcare Director of Clinical Research
description:
A fantastic and unique career opportunity for Director of Clinical Research is now available with a prestigious and expanding non profit Acute Care Hospital in beautiful, coastal and warm San Francisco Bay Area. If you are ready for new exciting challenges in your career while collaborating with brilliant and passionate healthcare professionals, look no further!
 The Director of Clinical Research will join a nonprofit organization that has served communities in the Silicon Valley Area for more than 50 years. The hospital strives to provide superlative care by focusing on patients’ needs, rather than on shareholders’ demands, and by incorporating the latest, proven medical technology and attracting the best medical staff and affiliated physicians.
 The Director Clinical Research will advance clinical excellence through the development and support of evidence based practices and quality improvement efforts. The Clinical Research Director will develop and oversee the Research efforts to include working with physicians and employees interested in conducting research and oversee the evaluation of clinical trials. 
 The Director of Clinical Research will enable and facilitate research while providing the infrastructure to ensure the research is conducted in accordance with all governing laws and regulations. This position requires an in-depth knowledge of the ethical conduct of research, research site practices, and federal regulations. Manages day to day activities required to facilitate clinical research implementation. 
 The Clinical Research Director will collaborate with direct care clinical nurses, CNS, educators, clinical leaders and staff to create an ongoing road map for evidence based healthcare to include annual, measurable goals, and clinical practice guideline review. Leads and directs research review activities and project coordination, is a member of the Institutional Research Board (IRB). MA/MS degree. PhD or DNP in Nursing, epidemiology, statistics or health services research or related field preferred. Minimum seven (7) years’ experience in research activities with competence in major statistical software analysis, program languages and data base management.
 For more than 50 years, the Hospital has been a destination for ambitious job-seekers as well as patients, thanks to a unique combination of cutting-edge technology, outstanding patient care and a sense of community that extends way beyond the hospital grounds. As an independent, locally governed, not-for-profit hospital, we enjoy a unique environment and have a long history of contributing to the health and well being of this community. Join the team now!

title: Portfolio Advisor
description:
The Portfolio Advisor serves as the primary investment relationship with clients.  The relationship with clients is maintained through the delivery of PMA services including cash flow, bond proceeds management, and execution of investment products.
Consistently demonstrates exceptional internal and external service with clients, along with the core values: Integrity, Commitment and Performance.
Provide ongoing relationship servicing with clients to maintain goodwill and gain additional business.
Responds promptly to customer inquiries and requests regarding account.
Maintains client database regarding authorized signors, account maintenance and agenda.
Promotes and cross-sells other establishment products and services as appropriate to customer requirements.
Analyzes client’s financial status, compiles data and develops timely and accurate cash flow based on data received from client.
Prepares and submits cash flow report to client.
Contacts clients regarding maturities, cash flow review and reinvestments.
Monitors investment purchases and trade processing.
Conduct pre-issuance planning, paperwork and bid request for bond proceed management of bond proceeds.
Prepare initial bond proceeds management report, print reports/confirms for client bidder and review with and submit to client.
Update, submit and review updated bond proceeds management report with client.
Prepare, submit and review monthly reconciliation reports with client.
Prepare, submit and review final bond proceeds management binder and opinion with client.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by management.
Bachelor’s degree (B.S.) degree from four-year college or university in accounting or finance; one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Preferred experience in Investment Management (Broker-Dealer–Advisor) Environment
PMA Financial Network, LLC is a highly collaborative environment with cross-functional relationships.  The Portfolio Advisor will be engaged across all working groups and levels; working closely with the company’s Associate Vice-President Investment Services, Relationship Managers, Associate\Vice-President Senior Relationship Management Officers and Senior Vice-President Director of Business & Relationship Management.

title: Occupational Safety and Health Manager
description:
Digital Group LLC, a TN based company with offices in Madison, TN, Knoxville, TN, Birmingham, AL and Clayton, NC, is looking for a 
Job Purpose:
Maintains safe and healthful environment by identifying and anticipating concerns and hazards; developing and enforcing systems, policies, and procedures.
Duties:
* Identifies and anticipates safety and health concerns and hazards by surveying environmental, operational, and occupational conditions; rendering opinions on new equipment and procedures; investigating violations; recommending preventive programs.
* Guides and promotes safe work performance by developing safety systems, policies, and procedures; developing safety campaigns, communications, and recognitions; training managers and employees.
* Complies with federal, state, and local safety regulations by studying existing and new legislation; anticipating future legislation; interpreting standards; enforcing adherence to regulations; advising management on needed actions.
* Enforces safety policies by conducting inspections; reporting statistics; counseling managers and employees.
* Promotes a safe environment by coordinating and cooperating with local, state, and regional safety groups and agencies.
* Represents the organization by collecting data; presenting information at hearings; coordinating with claims adjusters.
* Maintains safety information data base by developing information requirements; designing an information system.
* Completes operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees; following up on work results.
* Maintains safety staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees.
* Maintains safety staff job results by coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results.
* Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.
* Achieves financial objectives by preparing an annual budget; scheduling expenditures; analyzing variances; initiating corrective actions.
* Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Required: OSHA 500 Certification
Skills/Qualifications:
Safety Management, Training , Managing Processes, Developing Budgets, OSHA Compliance, Legal Compliance, Coaching, Planning, Database Design, Presentation Skills, Bedside Manner

title: Server/System Administrator
description:
Rezult continues to make great strides toward enhancing the technology services community nationwide. We are consistently looking for qualified professionals to join us in achieving success. Currently we are searching for a Server/System Administrator to fulfill an immediate vacancy.
This position is responsible for providing operational and technical support for our Client’s Operational Technology (OT) server and/or network environments. The successful candidate must understand business requirements and translate these requirements into solutions. The position must work collaboratively with multi-disciplinary work groups to seek solutions to problems. The position must champion compliance and change efforts which result in improved reliability and security of infrastructure services.
Typical Responsibilities and required experience: 
• Perform server, workstation, and/or network administration for OT environment.
• Monitor OT device health and identify issues using common industry tool sets.
• Problem tracking, management, and resolution of issues in a 24/7 manufacturing location. 
The candidate will be called upon to perform duties during off-hours on occasion as needed.
• Learn, understand, and apply Standard Practices to Operational Technology infrastructure assets.
• Engage in auditing, compliance, and risk assessment processes. Ensure computer system inventory and software licensing is accurate.
• Identify, Analyze, and Elevate potential Cybersecurity events according to company procedures.
Day to Day Work:
Daily activities may include system backup administration, anti-virus administration, performance tuning, Microsoft Active Directory administration, network security detection administration, administration of the physical IP cabling and IP address assignments, updating of network diagrams, security policy management, data access controls, software patch management, risk management, change control administration, database administration, and self-auditing to ensure compliance with standards.
• Administration of server operating system logging to identify security or reliability issues.
• Support of the data historian through routine database maintenance, data compression, and access requests.
• Implement hardware, software, and/or network solutions; ensuring standards are applied consistently. Close interaction with business partners during development, support, and implementation of in-house or 3rd party systems.
• Create and present project documentation for capital and expense projects. 
Required Skills:
• Must know VCM * 4 or more years of experience in IT Infrastructure administration
• Server, Workstation, and/or Network Support and Log Monitoring experience is required.
• A firm understanding of computing security and reliability practices is required.
• Strong written, verbal communication, and time management skills.
Bonus Skills:
• Previous experience in OT, Honeywell Experion, Emerson DeltaV, Foxboro, SCADA, or Refining environment beneficial.
• Experience with Security Information Event Management (SIEM) a plus.
• Experience with configuration of Cisco, Sonicwall, Tofino, or Checkpoint devices is a plus.
• Microsoft, VMware, and/or Cisco certifications are a plus.
Immediate start; full time W2 contract engagement.
